Reviews.Title: “In need of an upgrade and better management”
Reviews.Author: Tanya0810
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent; on Robson and in walking distance to shopping, the harbor, stadium and restaurants. Service was great; staff is friendly and helpful especially Lisa, the concierge. My only issue with her was her recommendations were not up to my standards but that could be a reflection of the hotel's standards and not her. Once we told her which restaurants we wanted reservations for, she was extremely resourceful in getting us to them. The bed is extremely comfortable but the rest of the room looks dated. The lobby bar and lounge is too small... We tried to get in at 6 pm and was already full... They have no restaurant in the premises so we couldn't have breakfast in the hotel. Overall, the was an OK stay. We should have stayed at the Westin Harbour down by the water.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen computer within first 3 hours”
Reviews.Author: Wanda A
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel fine...who knew when the hotel staff came to my room to deliver a thank you gift for bringing 85 people to the city of Vancouver they would STEAL my laptop and SLR camera.....My room was rifled through and stolen from 2 different bags....who do they think is responsible...the guest of course....the night mgr Danielle won't check the security camera cause she is too busy...I guess she is okay with a thief working here....haven't even slept here yet....

Reviews.Title: “consistently high quality”
Reviews.Author: kenmaestro
Reviews.Content: This is probably my 5th stay at the Westin Grand (having tried several others in between) and I am moved to write as this is a hotel/residence that has really 'come of age'. I first stayed in about 1998 (probably a year or so after it opened) and this end of Robson Street felt a 'little out of it'. In the intervening 14 or so years Yaletown has come of age and the hotel is very much in the heart of it. Designed in the shape of a Grand Piano (hence the name) it has about 30 floors and almost all suite style accommodation. Each suite or studio is well equipped with a moreoless full kitchen and all of the usual Westin goodies (Heavenly bed, Heavenly shower etc). The 'Hidden' bar & lounge on the lobby level serves breakfast buffet, lunch and light dinner with an imaginative menu and good service. After a long flight from London a simple plate of fresh asparagus with grilled chicken and a glass of pinot blanc is a perfect dish to combat jet-lag. The 'super-foods' buffet breakfast is packed full of fruit, berrys, smoked salmon and other goodies to set you up for the day. Only gripe are the elevators which can be a little slow when the hotel is busy but all in all a great base for business or pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Great place, not best for value”
Reviews.Author: postaltravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when going to see Gonzaga vs Hawaii basketball at Rogers Arena. Nice, clean, central. Right on Robson street for those that love to shop/dine. Big comfy beds and extremely clean bathrooms. Nice outdoor heated pool. Great for business trips, a little spendy for family outings. Parking is going to cost also. Front desk staff is truly professional, even let us check in 2 hours early.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Grand Vancouver is a must stay”
Reviews.Author: Jack H
Reviews.Content: Looking to find the perfect weekend get away. The Westin Grand in Vancouver B.C. is a great place to stay. Excellent staff, very friendly with an eagerness to serve that adds to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveller678
Reviews.Content: Amazing service, beautiful clean rooms and ours even had an incredible water view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: pintobat
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Westin Grand a few times now and it has always been a good stay. The rooms have "mini-kitchens" so you have a micro-wave, toaster, dishes, dishwasher, sink, small fridge and coffeemaker. Ideal when you have kids b/c you can make up breakfast or lunch before you head out. We have always made good use of the pool and hot tub too. Decent sized pool for swimming laps - and my kids have braved it in the rains of March saying the water was really nice! The workout facility is large and open with floor to ceiling windows to outside pool deck area. My husband said the steam room was the best one he has ever been in (nice and hot and steamy). The bathrooms are always very clean and all the rooms we have had come with both a big bath tub and a separate large shower. It is a 5-10 minute walk to Science World and we walk down to the Aquarium down Robson St and onto the seawall in 30-45 minutes. And it has been excellent every time we have stayed there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent every time”
Reviews.Author: Canuk44
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness, service and great staff you expect from the Westin. Nice area to walk about - close to restaurants shopping and sites. My first choice in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: debcox
Reviews.Content: We stopped off here briefly and were most satisfied with the high standards we found which we would expect from such a chain. our room was clean, airy and fresh with a well equipped kitchenette and as the room was very high up we had great views so worth asking for. most impressed

Reviews.Title: “Oh Canada!”
Reviews.Author: Paradice06
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand Vancouver is located on 433 Robson Street which is in the heart of the city's entertainment and shopping district. Upon arriving, I was greeted by and exceptionally professional and friendly staff who gave me the best room available as I requested. The evidence of it was in the room as I had a high floor with a breathtaking view of Library Square, BC Place and a beautiful skyline including mountains. My room was very clean and the bathroom amenities were of high quality. I really loved the leaf-shaped soap. In addition, the bathroom had a separate shower and tub which I thought was a plus. The shower was equipped with dual shower heads to accommodate various heights of guests. Other accessories included a mini-kitchenette including refrigerator, microwave, and dishwasher. And if you don't mind paying the ungodly prices for the convenience snack and drink products in the room's bar, they had more to choose from than I had seen in any hotel. The items ranged from a Kit Kat bar, juices, and soft drinks, to a variety of mini-bottled alcoholic beverages to large bottles of wine etc. There are however, two complimentary bottles of water, and two bottles of ungodly priced water. One bottle was $7 and it was maybe only 1 liter max. Maybe it has special healing powers or age reducing ingredients. If you're on a budget, just drink the tap water. It tasted great and was very cold. The bed in extremely comfortable and I slept like a baby every night. As it was my first time in Vancouver, I needed to find something to do. No worries, just head down to the ground floor and meet the kindest and most attentive concierge in the world. Not sure if I can mention names here but you will know who she is once you meet her. She knows the town like the back of here hand and will provide you with excellent tips on things to do and places to visit as well as give you very simple and detailed directions. She also recommended some great restaurants based on my preferences. She didn't steer me wrong. On the first day I toured the seawall (12 mile walk), on the second, I visited Granville Island and visited a dance club on Richards St; and on the last day, I visited Gastown to do some souvenir shopping as well as took a road trip across Lions Gate Bridge to visit West and North Vancouver. Needless to say, I had a great time and it was largely in part to her guidance. She is simply awesome! Overall, my stay was excellent. However, I did have a small plumbing issue... the water in my toilet overflowed. Had I realized it in time, I could have stopped it before if happened but I did observe it before the water spread to the exterior of the bath floor. I called express service desk and the issue was resolved right away and didn't reoccur. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely return largely in part to the wonderful staff. No matter how nice a building is, it is the staff that dictates the atmosphere. With that said, I am thankful to the front desk, concierge, maintenance, and housekeeping staff for making my first stay from 15-18 March in Vancouver a most pleasant one. :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: habsfan93
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed by this hotel. Despite being in downtown Vancouver, I didn't hear any street noise (I did request a quiet part of the hotel in advance). You are only a few blocks from the skytrain which can take you to the airport and there's a grocery store across the street plus tons of restaurants nearby. The room was very comfortable and spacious plus excellent staff. Everyone smiled and was polite and efficient. I think I am a convert to the Westin chain. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms/ nice location”
Reviews.Author: michael77092
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Grand in Vancouver last week on a four day getaway. It was my first time in Vancouver and I stayed at the Westin because my friend that I was visiting was already booked there. I am usually a Hilton loyalist, so I haven't stayed at a great many Westins. I was presently surprised. Without dragging this review out, I will just say that the location for me was perfect. It is within walking distance of great shops and restaurants, as well as public transportation. It is also central to everything that is not within walking distance, so no taxi ride is too expensive. The room is laid out nicely with a separate sleeping and lounging area. The queen room wasn't huge, but the space was very wisely utilized. The bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel itself was spotless and the staff were very friendly. I was able to book the room for less than $200/ night. For the quality of the room, the location of the hotel, and the fact that it is located in a large, beautiful North American destination city, I felt the rate was very reasonable. I would return to this hotel in the future without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Not thrilled with the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Arthur G
Reviews.Content: We made our reservations months before our trip and specifically asked for a room with a view and we were told they would make that recommendation. However, we were given a room on the lowest floor! While the room was adequate, it was pretty cramped and our daughter slept in an adjoining room with a pull-out sofabed. The problem was the "suite" was so tiny that we had to be careful not to trip over each other. Had we been told at the time we made our reservation that we could have had a higher floor and a larger room, if we were willing to pay an additional $20 to $50 dollars a night, we might have considered the possibility or sought out another hotel. On the positive side, the staff was helpful and the room service was incredibly fast and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great food, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BfromKtown
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on Robson Street towards the Yaletown section of town.. Great location to get anywhere in the downtown area, especially when you're walking. Breakfast in the 'Hidden' lounge/restaurant was very tasty. Rooms are large, beds are awesome. Everyone is very friendly and helpful. I'd stay here again any time !

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms - perfect for business”
Reviews.Author: SKim78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of my go-to spots for business travel in the Vancouver area. The rooms are large, spacious and you get a separate living/work space (which is great for ordering room service and working in the evenings). The good: Big rooms, pretty well updated Location - lots of good takeout spots in walking distance Good Wifi Nice and quiet Great views from room The bad: Long wait for elevator at peak times (only 2 elevators!) Room service menu is lacking (and the food isn't the greatest)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: CO_sojourner
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 3-night stay here for a large gathering of family and friends. The hotel is wonderfully convenient to just about everything and served as a great jumping off spot for everyone. We really appreciated all the little touches that made our stay particularly accommodating- umbrellas for guests to use, friendly staff, suggestions for places where we could stay out drinking later in the evening (their bar closes at 11 on weeknights), etc. One reviewer gave a poor review to the continental breakfast, but I have to say we were pretty satisfied with the offering of several types of breads, danishes and bagels, fruit, smoked salmon, yogurt, granola, etc. They offer a nice hot breakfast in the restaurant as well, if you're not up to venturing out for local offerings (of which there are many). There is also a market located within 1/2 block. We stayed in an executive suite on the 30th floor and the room was exceptionally quiet and had incredible views. Compared to other hotel chains, and even within the Westin family, we found this hotel to not only meet but exceed our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: My partner spends two weeks of the month at this hotel and I often go up to see him. It is a large hotel but never feels crowded or the staff hurried. I believe that it was originally built as apartments, and all of the rooms that I have stayed in have been suites. The location of the hotel is quite good, lots to do in the neighborhood. The staff is very efficient and pleasant, and there rarely is a wait for anything. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet breakfast a bit of disappointment”
Reviews.Author: LonelyPTraveller
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying in this hotel as we were booked in one of the suites that my family booked for us. The view outside our room was amazing. The room amenities was good. Service was not for the hotel it claims to be. Mind you, I have stayed in other westin hotels and this one doesn't do justice to other locations. I won't say more but buffet breakfast had flies (yes flies, you see this right ---Fruit flies) on their fruits. I told the server about it and not apologetic at all. Her facial expression (well there were no words from her) Like it was something we should expect? They did change the fruit tray though but damage has been done. We are not talking of a 3 star hotel. Or a cheap hotel. We, clients are paying a price for something right? The gentleman who also greeted us at the Starwood preferred guest check-in counter addressed me and my husband as "folks". Seriously? He said, "Hello Folks, what can I do for you?" Folks? Oh my.... This is disappointing as the room was really gorgeous and I love the toiletries they had. Absolutely not fair for housekeeping that did a good job in keeping our room clean too. Hopefully management will see this. On a lighter note, check out my pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: WendyBux
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Westin Grand Feb. 18, 2012, was exceptional. The Conceirge desk, Reception, Valet parking and Bell Service was exceptional, rarely do you find overall staff so friendly, eager to assist and make you feel as though your business is important to them. The room was very comfortable, clean and all in room services were outstanding. If you are looking to stay in the city The Westin Grand will not dissappoint.

Reviews.Title: “great spot”
Reviews.Author: judymichael40
Reviews.Content: just spent last night here and was very happy with my stay. funky hotel, close to fun yaletown. two blocks away from b.c. place. wonderful westin heavenly beds so a good night's sleep. comfortable sitting araea in our room, so we could sip wine before heading out. i will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelerCa_11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel about every six weeks for the past year and it has always been a great experience. The staff are very friendly, the service excellent and the hotel really comfortable. Rooms are big and have lots of space if you're staying for a few days and will be working in the room; desks are good size. Good bar and food right in the hotel if you are just hanging out alone in the evening and has a really nice pool on the roof that is rarely used and is great if you want to swim laps. As always, the Westin beds are my favorite and give the best night's sleep of any hotel. Only complaint: the really, really slow elevators. Takes an age to get down to the lobby in the morning. Gets pretty irritating when you're trying to get to work,

Reviews.Title: “Dream Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2K10SummerLoving
Reviews.Content: I won a competition, was flown to Vancouver(from Ireland) was put up in the Westin Grand in March 2011 and the rest is a secret shh! haha The hotel was beautiful and modern. As far as I believe the hotel used to be apartments but was converted at some stage. The staff were very helpful and friendly helping me figure out how to make phone call's from my (irish) mobile phone, showing me the way to mac cosmetics, giving us ideas on outings, the breakfast waiter was a delight The Rooms were gorgeous with big comfy beds, well lit, ventilated, heated and well equipped. I stayed in a room with 2 queen bed(I think queen.. double anyway!) about half way up the building. The food was very tasty, I only ate breakfast in the hotel but it was very well presented and tasted even better. The only downfall is the lift/elevator as there are 2 but go up and down randomly so you could be waiting 15 minutes for one to bring you down or up, I would suggest one just be for going up and one just be for going down. The hotel is in the middle of everything at a great location. f i were to go back to Vancouver and wanted to spoil myself for a few nights of luxury I would book myself into the Westin Grand again in a heart beat! :) (i clicked solo but i my Mum was with me.. yet it didn't feel like a family or friend type of visit.)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: MrMoreira
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well located in downtown's conservative, with staff and service efficient. Recommended with excellent cost benefit relation. Would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Grey Cup Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Argofan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Westin Nov 24-28 2011 when the Grey Cup was played in Vancouver. Had a 1 br suite with a pullout sofa, perfect for 2 football fans. We were on the 23rd floor with a perfect view of the new stadium. Within 1 block was a liquor outlet, grocery store, killer deli, Japadog. Used the pool and hot tub, both outdoors. Did not eat there, seemed expensive. Shorf walk from the airport skytrain stop.Ideal location. Only issue was having to wait forever for an elevator. 1 car up, one down. The hotel was full, but 20 mins for an elevator is a bit much.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ecperl
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel! My boyfriend and I went for 6 nights after Christmas through New Year's, all on just 50,000 Starpoints (yay for the Amex Starwood card). While the hotel is all suites, some are pretty small, depending on what room you get, since the hotel is curved on one side (I believe the rooms that ended in 1 or 2 were the smallest, and that those ending in 3 or 9 were the largest). I'm sure the first room we'd been given would have been fine, but when offered the option to upgrade to a bigger suite with a king-sized bed for just $20 more per night, we took it and felt incredibly comfortable for the rest of our stay. It's worth asking if there are other options if you're not psyched with the first room you're given. The staff at the hotel are incredibly nice and accommodating, and they were happy to show us other possibilities. We slept really well, since the bed was so comfortable and the room got very dark when the shades were drawn, and we really enjoyed just relaxing in the suite at times and watching DVDs on the TV (which we had hooked up to my computer). The kitchenette, which was well-equipped with plates, silverware, glasses, and a variety of cookware, came in handy when we decided to be lazy on New Year's Day and order in Thai food (right to our room!). The elevators were admittedly a bit slow, but we didn't find it to be an issue - I'd just say try not to cut it too close if you're really in a rush. The fitness room was very nice, with several treadmills, a few other cardio machines, and weights. And the outdoor heated pool and hot tub, which are open year-round, were great to enjoy on the cool winter days. Finally, the location was one of the best things about the hotel: there were a lot of convenient things within just a block or two (train station to/from the airport, grocery store, liquor store, drugstore, Starbucks, Tim Hortons for some of the best doughnuts outside of Dunkin Donuts), and it was an easy to walk to a lot of other cool places with great bars, restaurants, and sites to see: Yaletown, Gastown, Chinatown, the ferry to Granville Island, etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to be in a great central city location. I know where I'll be staying on my next trip to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Dale1960
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a night over the Christmas holidays. We wanted to do some shopping and enjoy the restaurants in Yaletown. The hotel was in a perfect location for both. Yaletown is literally down the street in one direction and the shopping of Robson Street and Pacific Centre Mall and also practically right outside the door. The staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful. The room was great - away from the elevator, we had a one bedroom suite with a really comfy pullout couch which was not a chore to sleep on. the bathroom is large and spacious and plenty big enough for us two gals.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way location, but great service”
Reviews.Author: AJCM
Reviews.Content: Sort of tucked away, as we usually stay near Coal Harbour. Great service, impeccably clean rooms and bathrooms, and at least a 4 star in my opinion. If location is not of great concern, I would highly recommend it. Otherwise, I would stick to something with a great water/mountain view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service.”
Reviews.Author: bohemian1011
Reviews.Content: My wife and 3-yr-old son and I stayed at the Westin for a long weekend. We got a one bedroom suite which was nice, on a corner, with a separate living area and kitchenette. It's a nice property and centrally located. I was pleased with the price of the suite but it seemed that there was a charge for pretty much everything. We're SPG Gold so I was hoping for a upgrade to a king suite (as opposed to the queen suite) and when there wasn't one available, they kindly provided free wifi instead. I was appreciative, but I also feel that there should be some sort of free Internet available in the rooms anyway. Even wired Internet wasn't free. The valets were friendly and fast getting the car each time, and over-all, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The highlight of the hotel was Lisa, the head concierge, who was incredibly sweet with my son. She was very helpful with information and advice for us and gave my son a toy.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: pouladi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in December 2012. Found the service to be outstanding. The room: The rooms are very clean and well furnished. The room we stayed in had a living room with a "closet kitchenett" and a seperate bedroom. Two TVs, one in living, one in the bedroom. Spacious washroom was a plus. Great views. The facilities/staff: very friendly and attentive staff. Though the only two elevators servicing the building were very slow to arrive and seemed inadequate. Location: in the heart of downtown. Steps from the public library, Center in Vancouver for the performing arts, the Vancouver Art Gallery, and Robson street shopping. Overall, great hotel in great location. Great value for money, though would benefit from an elevator upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoCooker
Reviews.Content: Great views of the city, small, but very efficient rooms as with every Westin Heavenly Beds a delight. A special shout out to the staff, very helpful, friendly and professional! My only complaint is the $15 continental buffet. I have no issues charging a fee, but it should be more reasonable 6 to $8 and you would have more people taking advantage of it. otherwise it seems to go to waste. Thanks for a great stay and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Snowflakesnsun
Reviews.Content: Great location, customer service.rooms kind of small but spotless and with a great view. Not as good as other westin grands such as the one in Berlin or Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, quiet.”
Reviews.Author: zhivago22
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, quiet, and in a great location - 5 minute walk to gastown, 5 minute walk to yaletown, 2 minutes to the stadium. Right next door to a Tim Horton's and a Starbucks and the Falafel Maison. Only downside was the elevators are soooo slow. You'll be waiting for 10 minutes. Other than that, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not much else!”
Reviews.Author: Jpresskin
Reviews.Content: I enjoy Vancouver and go 2-3 times a year. This was one of the worst hotel experiences I can remember. We prepaid a 2- 2-room suites that were pricy because we were guaranteed views, breakfast, partial kitchens and large private outside balconies with a view of the city. It took hours to find our 2 reservations (even though we had our confirmation letters with us) and by the time they found our reservations our rooms has already been given out. We ended up in horrible rooms with no views, no balconies and an old uncleaned mini bar that had someone else's old food and drink still sitting it. The rooms were dingy, musty and completely worn. The bathroom was unpleasant with cracked tile flooring and not a single amenity except one small piece of soap. We were issued 2 thin towels each ad nothing more. No one at the front desk would do a thing to help. The concierge was horrible and had no idea what she was doing. She made a hair appointment for me at a salon that was no longer in business (it cost $25 in cab fare to find that out.) The same concierge that night then wrote down the wrong address for a dinner meeting which caused a problem. After two days, we cut our losses and checked into another hotel and lost the money we prepaid the Westin. Three weeks later we got a final invoice from The Westin Vancouver with an additional $420 in charges to my credit card and no explanation. I emailed and called the hotel several times for an explanation of the $400 in fees. A week later I got a voice mail saying the $400 was a cleaning penalty for smoking in the rooms. We did not know this was a non smoking hotel and there were no signs or notifications. Why didn't housekeeping or the manager tell us there was no smoking allowed when we were there? As it turns out smoking is allowed in the private balcony rooms (which we paid for and did not get) I don't think I would ever stay at a Westin again after this. I would certainly never stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “A Grey Cup win aside, this is an outstanding hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Reklaw252
Reviews.Content: We came to the 2011 Grey Cup and looked for a quality downtown hotel and found one which is outstanding! We went "all out" and booked an executive suite with wi-fi and breakfast included. A wise decision Every staff person we interacted with was friendly (without being intrusive), informative and helpful. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Often_Traveling_Jack
Reviews.Content: I stayed almost a week in this hotel, and I have to admit I'm overwhelmed with care and attendance of hotel staff. That was my first visit in North America, and not only front desk and concierge was very kind and helpful but also to my surprise maintenance and cleaning staff was also very nice helpful and welcoming. Biggest room advantage in my opinion is not only air conditioning but also humidity control. Both works also when you're not in the room with hotel key inserted in master switch. I stayed in Superior Suite with view, room was nicely decorated and have two 42" TVs which was nice surprise, as 32" are most common elsewhere. Room service was very tasty with nice selection of hot and cold in-room dining even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service - comes from a Platinum level member”
Reviews.Author: Jignesh P
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Westin all over the world. I have accumulated over 160 nights in 2011 with SPG hotels. So when I had to visit Vancouver on a business trip, I obviously chose Westin Grand. That was the worst decision of my trip. The hotel itself is conveniently located from the train stations (both Canada line and Expo/Millennium line). My encounter with the staff was not very friendly. I am a government employee and staying here for on the government rate. Even after presenting the ID the hotel changed the rate during my stay. I had to call the manager on night duty a couple of times and the lady was an absolute nightmare to work with. She didn't just hang up me twice, she also sent a letter to my room stating that I was ineligible for the government rate and rate would go up by $100 a night. She also added 5 different charges to my room including internet, convenience and more. Being in Vancouver for the first time, I really wanted to enjoy the city and my stay. Instead, I ended up being a complete stressball and spent many hours trying to resolve this. Ultimatley I had to call the SPG customer service in USA to settle this. I will never ever step into this property. I have decided to stay at the St. Regis - a boutique hotel just 3 blocks from here for all my subsequent stays. Some of my colleagues are frequent guests there and from what I hear, it is a 5 star hotel with unlimited free calling all over the world, free internet, free cooked breakfast for two and Fiji water bottles in the room. The rate was much cheaper than my government rate at Westin that didn't include internet, breakfast, calling etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but you pay for it”
Reviews.Author: vetism
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand Vancouver is in the center of downtown Vancouver, so no doubt the location is fantastic. Vancouver is a walkable city, so you'll find all kinds of dining, shopping, and entertainment establishments within walking distance. You'll find that the room rate is high as a result of this, since in my opinion other aspects of the Westin Grand Vancouver (the room, the amenities, the service) are just on par with other nearby hotels in this category, whether Starwood properties or otherwise. This is an all-suite hotel, but I find my suite to be on the small side. It is clean, nicely decorated, and I do like the "heavenly shower". It has big flat screen TV, but no HD. The elevators are fast, but you may have to wait a couple of minutes during peak time. The building occupies a small footprint, so you'll find different things on different floors (i.e., hotel lobby on a different level from the street). All in all, I think this is a nice hotel, but know you're paying a premium for the location, not for too many other things you might otherwise associate with a "Westin Grand."

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: Aaron M
Reviews.Content: Hello, I wanted to write a short review to commend the experience I had at the Westin Grand Vancouver. I often travel on business, and of the many hotels I've stayed at (both in Vancouver and other places), the Westin Grand is fantastic. The rooms are comfortably and tastefully decorated, and the location is excellent for anyone who wants to be close to the heart of the city. However, the staff and service at the Westin deserve special mention given my experiences - they were friendly, accomodating and attentive. In short, I would recommend the Westin Grand to anyone travelling to Vancouver, and have done so already.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: frenchanglo
Reviews.Content: Loved both stays in that hotel on my way to and back from Vancouver Island. The first two nights we had the grand surprise of being upgraded to a suite in the top floor with an incredible view on the library. Not such a luck the second time ... However we enjoyed the friendliness of the staff. The calm of the rooms, did not quite used all facilities as the area as so much to offer in terms of bars and restaurants. Despite being a chain the service we received both time was personal, very pleasant and staff most helpful in booking cabs, giving directions and booking restaurants. Great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, even greater if they can get a few service issues right.”
Reviews.Author: Andy_0nT0ur
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand has a lot going for it. Great location, great bar & restaurant and for the most part great service. But it pays to check what room you have before settling in. On arrival at the hotel we tried to check in (early as it was 1.30pm) but was told the room wouldn't be ready until 4.30pm - even though check in time is 3pm. I was offered a room on a lower floor but as I had booked an executive deluxe suite room (on the top 2 floors) I chose to wait it out. When the time arrived I was given room 3000 which has to be the smallest room on the floor - and hardly matched the executive layouts displayed on the website. A quick call and I was relocated to a corner room on a much lower floor, with all executive privileges intact. All good. Later that evening a member of staff in charge of customer service rang to arrange a transfer to a corner room back on the 30th floor the next afternoon. While the whole check in process was far from enjoyable, the hotels willingness to set things right did impress. With all that settled I got to enjoy the room and hotel. A well appointed gym, great restaurant in Hidden (some of the best food in the city) and its location to shopping and downtown. Despite the initial hiccup, I would recommend staying here. Just be aware that the hotels unique shape means every room is a different layout - avoid the 000 rooms and opt for something bigger and brighter - corner balcony deluxe rooms are wonderfully spacious and super comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful view.”
Reviews.Author: Sunworshipper049
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable stay at this hotel. The hotel was full, and we ended up with a smaller room than we wanted, however, we did enjoy the location. The hotel has been refurbished and has a modern, clean feel. Beds were very comfortable and concierge very helpful when information was required for my day trips. Great access to Stanley Park and the marina. The maid service was not great. We had a babysitter recommended to us through the concierge and she was amazing and took great care of our children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 'boutique' hotel”
Reviews.Author: LongWayAcross
Reviews.Content: After staying at this property a few times and finally asking the staff about why there are only two elevators, we were told that it's so not to take away from the boutique feel of the hotel. Hmm. It's a Westin. Anyway, overall nice rooms and attentive service. Yes the self parking is $26 which is a little on the high side for a parkade. But if you park on the street it's free from 10pm to 9am if you plan on leaving early.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flipper95
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on leisure. This was actually my second time at this hotel, the first was years ago just after it opened. The hotel continues to not disappoint; it is very upscale, modern, and comfortable. The location is very good, and you can walk to just about anywhere in the city and there are plenty of restaurants and nightlife close by. The room was excellent, very comfortable bed and great bathroom with heated floors. The windows open a bit for some of that clean BC Air, and the road noise wasnt a problem. i didnt avail myself of the gym but it was decent for a hotel gym with decent cardio and some weights and strength training equipment. The pool looked nice as well. My only gripes, there are just two elevators and this is a tall busy hotel so you may experience lots of stops and crowds. The Westin chain, including this property, are big into knickle and diming so expect to be fee'd about 15$ a day for internet and phone usage. If you want to save some money, walk across the street to Starbucks and or A&W and get free internet. I wish these hotels would cut a break on the fees for amenitites that should be included at the rates they charge. Still, the hotel is a good one, and I wish I could have stayed a bit longer. Last, parking will run you about 26$ a night self parking, I tried some of the private lots immediately nearby first to see if I could save a few bucks, they were no cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay, thank-you to everyone.....”
Reviews.Author: Salop1
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here for 15 days, I have got to know the place quite well. It is situated in the middle of Downtown Vancouver with easy access to the Skytrain network a couple of blocks away, many places to eat nearby and close to the main shopping areas. There is an excellent supermarket a few metres from the front door for those that prefer to buy their own supplies. On arrival a polite concierge will take your bags to the lobby on the first floor for check-in. Check-in was easy, with pleasant, helpful and friendly front desk staff. My room was a 29th floor deluxe suite, (this is a suite hotel), on the corner of the building with a balcony, good sized bathroom, a pleasant sitting room with TV and desk, and a good sized bedroom with a very comfortable bed and another TV. Floor to ceiling windows give fantastic views over the city especially at night. Air con was good, available separately in the sitting room and bedroom. Inside the entrance area was a closet with microwave, dishwasher toaster and coffee maker (no milk). It was great to be able to do some simple cooking with ingredients from the nearby Marketplace supermarket, as a break from restaurant food. The suite was clean and well serviced with bathroom products and there was a mini-bar. The suite was quiet, although the city bustle was evident when one sat on the balcony. Room service was reliable and the food delivered was hot and attractive. The restaurant on the first floor next to the lobby was open for breakfast and dinner and was clean and comfortable; it could get very busy at times, particularly as it isn’t very large. The atmosphere was pleasant and cosy, with nice soft furnishings. The menu was good, if not particularly large and the food served was very pleasant, well-cooked and at a proper temperature. The restaurant staff were first class, efficient and above all friendly and welcoming and always helpful and considerate. Laura and Lisa at dinner, Jesse at breakfast were particularly pleasant to get to know over a long stay and made a visit to the dining area a real pleasure. Well done and thank you for making my stay such an enjoyable one. I have no criticisms of the hotel, nothing went wrong, everyone was on-the-ball and the Westin Grand a very pleasant experience, so I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: brooklynshaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for work. The hotel is in a great location and the rooms are wonderful. They are set up like suites so you have 2 rooms, one living room, one bedroom. The bathroom is very roomy as well. The only downside with the hotel is that you have to pay for internet and usage at the business center. The staff was helpful and the atmosphere was inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Laurenkarl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work and was very pleased with the experience. Centrally located and well appointed. I was upgraded to a suite with separate living area which was great (I am returning for work and will book the same level of room).

Reviews.Title: “One Night Wonder”
Reviews.Author: Joe C
Reviews.Content: Although we didn't stay long, we had a very relaxing time. The staff were pleasant and smily. We brought out dog and everything was ready for her too in the room, with dog dishes and a big doggy bed. The room was large, comfy and very bright. I was surprised there was a little kitchen with dishes and sink. The Hidden restaurant is one stop I would recommend. Great food, great service, lobster poutine and crab mac N cheese were delicious. Finished it off with an oreo cheesecake! Great stop for a vacation even if you live in the city and just need a night from the regular routine!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Jay G
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great service. The rooms have separate living and sleeping areas. Very quiet and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Restful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: TWT1
Reviews.Content: Although our stay at the Westin Grand in Vancouver BC was only two nights, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The suite room arrangement makes for a bit more privacy and the nice "kitchenette" in the room was very handy. We even had a small fridge sent to our room to keep some medication (and some wine) chilled during our stay. Breakfast in the lobby was very nice both off the menu and buffet. Our waiter Nichola was very helpful with information on the city. The concierge, Lisa Cumming, provided advance suggestions and made reservations for us at a couple of really good restaurants. She really knows her job and is very friendly and personable. The Westin Grand staff is well equipped to take care of its guests. The hotel is in an ideal location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wow these guys excel at customer experience!”
Reviews.Author: EJTH
Reviews.Content: One of the best business trip experiences I have ever had in a hotel. All staff, right across the hotel, were engaging, interested and completely customer focused in everything they did. Customer-centric is their middle name - all of them! Healthy breakfast options abound and the selection of fruits, nuts, yoghurts etc was out of this world. The very friendly omlette chef was kept busy and the waiting staff were helpful and really demonstrated an upbeat friendly style. Room was large and had all the usual amenities. Can't recommend the place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: Seven_Continents
Reviews.Content: The great: the staff were always helpful, upbeat and ready to answer questions. The hotel location is great, walking distance to everything in downtown Vancouver especially the newly refurbed stadium. There are lots of good food choices around. The Canada Line train that goes direct to the airport is a 5 minute walk. As for the rooms, it's a matter of taste. Due to the architecture of the building, every room seems different. They are suites in the two room sense, but mine seemed just a few feet too small to have been made a suite. In the living space the TV was way too close and the chairs could not be positioned well, though the furniture was great. The bedroom was small with no clothes storage other than the closet. The drawers are out in the living room space. I was on the 12th floor so didn't have great views but there was no street noise. This property is more central than the Westin Bayshore or the Sheraton, but if a large room is your must have, I don't see this "all suite" hotel hitting the mark. If you are a family or threesome, the extra room would be great. No complaints about the bathroom, I had a separate bath/shower and lots of room. Overall, a really good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: snowgirls
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Westin Grand in a 1 bed suite on the 27th floor - corner with amazing views of downtown and the water. Pro's - so close to everything, great views and plenty of restaurants (eat in, take out - you name it all within a short walk) Room had a nifty little 'kitchenette' in a closet containing sink, microwave and dishwasher. Bathroom had a separate soaker tub and double headed shower. Living area was spacious and comfortable. Would've been very convenient for a multi night stay. Bed was comfy as was sofa bed in living area. Mini bar had lots of snacks, drinks and even a giant lollipop avail. Very easy to get to from either Yaletown or Downtown Skytrain stops; only a few short blocks. Con's - felt a little 'nickel & dimed' for a room with that price tag. I was disappointed to not have an iPod dock or music other than the clock radio. Music was avail. on the TV but at a cost of $9.99 for 2 hours... We also didn't have towels, but that was rectified by a phone call to the front desk. There is an automatic fee for the morning newspaper... you could be credited the cost if you didn't want it. I’ve stayed in cheap airport hotels that have provided that at no cost. We were charged for an extra two people staying in the room, but after a discussion with the front desk this was removed. We'd already paid this charge when booking. All in all... a lovely hotel right smack in the midst of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “UPGRADED TO 1/2 A PENTHOUSE”
Reviews.Author: sabrinaVancouver_Bc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin recently, got a good (not great) price through Hotwire...not as good as winter prices thru priceline...but, was well worth it....Room wasnt clean upon arrival (3ish) so they offered an upgrade to the penthouse...well, half the penthouse...closed with a door/wall you couldn;t see...was lacking in "suite" and bed was pullout...which would not have sufficed had it been for more then one night....In fact, the entire 1/2 penthouse would not have sufficed if more than one night...very tight in space. Nice TV. Although told it has a kitchenette...doesn't. But the view was to die for..and the windows were spotless...that was what I paid for and was happy to do so...from new bc place roof to library, to water, to north shore, to 3 of the 5 sails...could see it all. Fantastic. Also offered free breakfast in the morning (omelette bar and assortment of light breakfast fare), and a fruit and water (basket)...a plum, an apple, an orange and a bottle of water (disappointing), and free internet. Late checkout of noon was also great. Second time visiting this hotel and have been pleased both times. Parking was a load off as well....well lit, and did not have to pay!

Reviews.Title: “One night, great service”
Reviews.Author: EOppie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Grand Vancouver the night prior to our cruise with Disney. I had requested a high floor, in a corner room to take advantage of any views. All of our requests were met, and the room was ready early when we went to check in the morning of our arrival. While the room layout was a bit odd, it was more than acceptable. Having the separate living room space, and joined bathroom access was great. It allowed privacy for the guests staying on the sofa bed in the living room. Concierge was helpful in recommending where to go for dinner, and where not to go after dark. The area around the hotel was safe, and we felt very secure at night. It was a quick walk from the closest metro station, very doable for an able bodied visitor. We chose to take a cab to the cruise terminal the next day, which we arranged through the front desk. They called upon its arrival, and assisted us with luggage. If you are going to the cruise terminal I definitely would take a cab. It is door to door service to the cruise terminal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, Nice rooms but maybe a little over priced”
Reviews.Author: Canada19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights and it was a great stay. The staff were wonderful and very accomadating ( we had to call more them more then once because of a lack of phonebooks in the rooms) they were always happy to help and if you needed something were at your door within minutes. The location was perfect you could easily walk to Robson or the Arena and theres tons of places to eat around the hotel including the restaurant in the hotel. The only negative i would say is they may be slightly over priced we paid 250 a night plus 30 a day for parking and that doesnt include anything except your room no breakfast or even vouchers for breakfast. But the location itself could probably make up for the high price And there are two elevators and 31 floors so sometimes you have to wait 5 or 10 minutes for an elevator

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice room and great location”
Reviews.Author: TheAvatar_GR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is slightly more expensive than what I spend when travelling for pleasure. It's a wonderful hotel and a great location. Staff were very helpful and everything went on without a glitch.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for us”
Reviews.Author: Jack90
Reviews.Content: The worst thing I can say about this hotel is that it needs more elevators. Seems minor until you are there! We booked a deluxe suite and it was a touch small for 4 people, but its downtown so we expected that. It would have been fine if we hadn't of kept the pullout bed open. We found the mini kitchen to be very convenient since we were travelling with kids. It was well stocked and had a dishwasher. For some reason, they set this room for 3 people the entire 3 nights we were there, yet we had reserved for 4. Each night we had to ask for more towels. You'd think they'd figure it out eventually. The movie channel played movies that are still in theater ($17) I thought that was kind of cool. We didn't use the pool, but they had some sort of pool party on Sunday afternoons that is for the single 20 somethings of downtown. We went to the suspension bridge instead. To the hotel's credit, they have a plan B for kids. They offered to pay for a cab to go to another Westin to use the pool. I guess the pool party is not G rated. Sounds like fun! There is a grocery store and a liquor store withing a block of the hotel, which was great for us. We ate at their restaurant that has a tapas menu and we really enjoyed. My husband is all about big steak dinners and he was pleased with how substantial a tapas menu can be. Everyone speaks of the great location, they are correct. It was kind of picey, but it suited our needs, so we got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Best Westin stay yet”
Reviews.Author: E Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Grand for our 4th wedding anniversary. It was our first trip to Vancouver and everything about our stay was perfect. We were upgraded to a view room on the 28th floor and had welcome chocolate dipped strawberries delivered to our room on our arrival. The gym and pool area were wonderful, clean and modern. The staff was friendly and courteous. The location was unbeatable. We would definitely stay there again, and highly recommend this hotel for Vancouver visitors.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: kim n
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Westin Grand in Vancouver. This hotel in located on trendy Robson street in the downtown area. Pretty much anything downtown is within walking distance. We walked to Stanley Park as well, which was a good distance but still a pleasant walk. The hotel consierge Lisa made our stay extra special, as she was most helpful with tips on dining, tourist attractions etc. The room was spacious and comfortable, the rooftop pool and hot tub relaxing and tastefully located. The service at this hotel was great, and I would highly reccommend the Westin Grand.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Medici58
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for those who want to be close to the heart of downtown Vancouver. It is right on Robson St. and walking distance to other major sites. We were in a 1 BR suite which was spacious enough for 2 people. Bed was very comfortable and the bathroom size was good as well. The only thing I noticed is that it takes so long for the elevators to reach your floor especially when it's check-out time but other times of the day was okay. We loved Vancouver and will defnitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ... and Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: AM-PM-2011
Reviews.Content: This location was great. Once we parked the car we didn't see it till we checked out. This Trip to Vancouver was our "unofficial" honeymoon, as we wanted to do Europe but were unable to go till Sept, so we decide to a short get away to Vancouver for a week. At the Westin we got a mountain view junior suite, the room included a sitting area and a separate room. It also included fridge/microwave/dishwasher/bar sink all nicely hidden away. The room was fairly large. The only thing was there wasn't much of a mountain view. You could see the mountain behind a bunch of buildings but that's about it. Besides that the room was clean and looked fairly up to date. The service at ths hotel is honestly the best I have seen during our travels. The service that stands out the most was from Lisa the head concierge. She went way above and beyond our expectations. This was our first time in Vancouver, so we were not to sure on a few things. She gave us tips on where to go when to go, where to go for drinks where to go eat. Helped us plan our route and stay in Whistler. And while we were in Whistler we even called her to book a trip to Victoria, she arranged our trip and had us pick up from our hotel even though it was not a Westin. (it was unfortunately that the Westin was all booked for our final weekend in Vancover) And lastly we were pleasantly surprised to come back from dinner on our first night in Vancouver to some goodies and a wonderful card in our room. Lisa and the Staff at Westin thanks for making our trip to Vancouver amazing. We loved it and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Xanderkat
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay there the night of Aug 19th. We booked the deluxe suite on the 31st floor and LOVED every moment of it! We had an issue with the vanity mirror not lighting, and we told front desk and they assured us that it would be fixed, and it wasn't. There were also fresh red wine spills on the carpet in the living room (we could tell as they were wet from what we assume the housekeepers sprayed stain remover on it) the view overlooking BC place, and the surrounding area were breathtaking to say the least! The beds were super comfy and the bathroom was amazing! (except the water pressure fluctuated when using both of the shower heads). Great stay and would love to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “The suite life in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: shamu-architect
Reviews.Content: Great deal on double suite included free buffet breakfast and wi-fi and third night free. Suite came with refrigerator, microwave oven and dishes and flat wear and even a dish washer. Staff at breakfast was phenomenal and would do anything to accommodate us. Food was exceptional especially the breakfast breads and homemade jams. Major issue which we were told is being addressed is the card access system for the two elevators. Most of the time the card readers were not working well. Had to replace cards and saw other guests and even management having issues. We were told that a new system was being installed in the near future. Surprisingly the hotel's only "restaurant" did not offer a full dinner menu but we were able to order off the more extensive in-room dining menu. This was not really critical since there were dozens of restaurants within walking distance offering a huge variety of menus and prices. I strongly recommend Japadog ( super great take on hotdogs including desert versions), Noodle Box for delicious asian fare. There is a supermarket adjacent to hotel so that you can restock your refrigerator. Self parking available at a price but parking spaces and access is very tight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: SageGuy
Reviews.Content: We booked a corner room using our BCAA/AAA membership. The rate was very good for a downtown hotel and beat most others in this category. There was another advantage in that no prepaid fees were required. Frankly, I'm at a loss to understand the negative ratings about the slow elevators and the corner rooms. I've stayed in smaller properties with more elevators and have stood in the elevator lobby for great lengths of time while full cars came and went. We didn't experience any overly long delays. If time is an issue for you and you are worried about the elevators, then my suggestion is to leave a little earlier. I've read comments about the corner rooms being inadequate. We found that far from the case. It had everything we needed including a great view. The bed was comfortable, the layout was great, the bathroom had both a tub and shower and there was a safe for our valuables. While the kitchenette had the essentials to warm up a meal, remember it isn't a full kitchen so don't expect to make a gourmet meal. The dishwasher was a nice surprise. There are many restaurants nearby. There is also an IGA supermarket right on the corner. You don't need to go far to meet all your daily needs. We also experienced a great example of customer service. We missed checking one of the closets and we left my wife's leather jacket. As soon as we got home, she called. It was in the mail to us the next day and arrived a day later. Thank you Imelda in housekeeping for your honesty and thank you to Lost and Found for expediting the return. All in all this hotel deserves a good look if you want good customer service, want to be close to good food and beverage or just want to unwind and enjoy the view.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Night HORRIBLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: P S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Grand on our wedding night, and I had requested a late checkout on the next morning because I needed somewhere to get ready for my wedding party which was the next day. The lady who made my reservation said it would be fine to have a late checkout and that there would be no problem. Well, it turns out on the morning after our wedding, they told us they could not offer us late checkout anymore!!! I was rather upset, so I booked another hotel for the night of our party and told the staff at that hotel about my situation, and they let us into our suite early so I could get ready. Never staying at the Westin Grand ever again!! The guy Christian at the front also has terrible customer service. I found him unfriendly and unwelcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Alex449
Reviews.Content: We joined Starwood Preferred and they came up with an excellent offer of buy one night get the next night 40% off so we upgraded to a corner balcony executive suite. The room is a little unusual in it's layout but has a separate living room/kitchenette and fabulous views plus if there is a smoker in your party they can use the balcony instead of having to go all the way downstairs. The hotel is 3 blocks south of granville and everything is in easy walking distance in both directions - granville island and the waterfront and there are loads of bars and restaurants close by. The staff are brilliant - extremely helpful and friendly. Make sure and take a room with breakfast and wi-fi as it will save quite a few $$'s

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: derek k
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights on vacation. First problem is location. The part of Robson Street it is located on is rather seedy. Every time I walked to the hotel, I felt as if I was heading to a bad area of town. It is not located on the nice part of Robson Street. Next problem is the elevators. Always required a wait and there were only two. The room was mediocre--INCREDIBLY poor lighting in the room, making it difficult to read..Could not believe how bad it was. The bed was uncomfortable-did not sleep well. We had believed that the Westin provided comfortable beds. The food in the restaurant was limited in choices and mediocre in taste. Buffet loaded with flies. Hotel staff rude--no greetings by them when entering. I am very confused when I read any good review of this place

Reviews.Title: “A Really Nice Hotel with Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: Snowbird409
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times when I come to Vancouver for business. The staff at the hotel and in-house restaurant/lounge is fantastic across the board. I've never met a team member that wasn't friendly, and I've met many of them. The rooms are well furnished, especially with the Westin bed. It's an amazing bed, and provides a great night's sleep. There's a small kitchette with everything I ever needed. The balcony is only available in a small number of rooms; they provide nice fresh air and a view of the city / harbour.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourites”
Reviews.Author: editzz
Reviews.Content: I have been lucky to stay here wtice whilst working on events at the nearby arena. The staff are fantastic. I have never had an issue. The doorman are always polite, and some really know the area and can suggest restaurants. The rooms are simply awesome.....the beds are so comfortable, even more comfortable than my rather expensive bed at home. Two big screen tvs in the suites, although more HD would be nice. A good sized desk for working and a comfortable, although a little dated couch. On my last trip, I had a workout room which had exercise mat, weights and a treadmill. Cool !!! The bathroom is great. The shower has multiple heads, and honestly i didnt want to get out. The location is fantastic. There are restaurants all around, as well coffee shops, pharmacies and convenience stores. I ate at the bar downstairs around the corner but in same building...I presume it is part of the Westin. Food was great and price was fair....although music was a little loud, but I guess it is a bar. I dont know about prices, as I was on business and never saw the bill....but man I love this place !!!

Reviews.Title: “Super location, nice accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Sparty80
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in a room with a queen bed with a pull out sofa bed. The mattress on the sofa bed was not very 'heavenly' as we were told when we made the reservation. It was nice to have a separate bedroom and living room. Room was clean and our corner room offered great views and lots of light. The location allowed us to walk to most places of interest. Overall we would stay there again bit would opt for two queen beds.

Reviews.Title: “Rude concierge, SPG Gold and unable to offer late check out”
Reviews.Author: Sanchang
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, great downtown location, easy to walk around. We had a 1 bedroom corner suite which was nice for the extra space and small walk out balcony. Being on a low floor, however, we had no view whatsoever. World's slowest elevators - at one point, guests from four rooms on our floor were all waiting to go down. The elevators also had a card swipe to access the guest floors. Good security measure but no one could ever get it to work. We would cram in the elevator on the ground floor, then one by one, guests would try swiping to no avail. When someone finally gets it blinking, a small cheer goes up and it's a mad dash to hit your floor number before the blinking stops. Regarding the concierge, she's great if you're the one she's helping. If not, well, she won't even so much as look up and acknowledge your existence. I stood there for five minutes, twice. Now, I do appear to look like a teenager but that's absolutely no excuse to ignore a customer. I've never been completely ignored by a concierge. Hugely disappointing. Another strange thing - I called to ask if there were luggage racks and whoever I talked to said the hotel has no such thing. I later found one in the closet. Weird. And as a Gold member, I thought I'd get 4pm checkout. Nope - they said 1pm was the latest they could do. No other Gold perks. Disappointing there too. On the other hand, I found the bellmen to be especially attentive and helpful. Maybe management should promote one of them to be the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - poor management”
Reviews.Author: Oslextor
Reviews.Content: Some months ago we booked two rooms - one should have three beds as we are a family of five (2 adults/3 kids). We arrived to the hotel on the 22.7 for one night. Everything was perfect. We had two rooms - one with a double bed + a single bed and one with a double bed. The rooms were not in the same floor. As we had to come back for three nights after our cruise I asked the reception to try to give us two rooms in the same floor during our next stay. She said she would try her best. When we came back, there was chaos. The male receptionist looked surprise when we asked him for two rooms in the same floor (no note has been taken of our previous request). He managed to gave us two floors in the same floor - 1107 (3 beds) and 1102 (2 beds). We asked if it was possible to get two rooms side by side and he told us that it was impossible. Ok. We left to the samll lobby while my parents checked in. As it was very early in the morning and the rooms were not ready we decided to explore Vancouver. When we came back to the hotel the receptionist gave us the keys to 1108 and 1102. We told her that we had room 1107. Then she realized that she has given our keys to my parents. That meant that we had to take all the clothes from my parents room (they are over 80 and well installed by then) and change rooms. We ended of course with rooms 1707 and 1708 and my parents in room 1702. What I do not understand is what they did not give us these two rooms when we checked in the morning. They told us that it was impossible to give us rooms side by side and then they give one of them to my parents, who checked in after us (!). Then the room with three beds had a double bed and a sofa(could be opened). When we asked why we did not get three beds as booked and requested (and as we did get in our first visit) they told us that other guests have arrived before and got the rooms with three beds. My sister had the same problem but at least she got a 50 USD compensation (I never was offered a compensation). Of course all this matter is not a big issue, but is just to show you that there is a complete desorganization at reception, something you could not expect of a 4 star hotel. Besides that (and the elevators) the hotel is fine - good location, a very nice concierge in the ground floor and good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Will try another place next time”
Reviews.Author: jjhkim
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Was ok. But expensive for what you get. I never understand these hotel management people. They charge you internet ($15) and parking ($26) as extra. Why not just build it into the price of the room? Most people who stay at these places are upper income people anyways and would not deter them from staying there, but charging as extra does leave a bad taste in one's mouth. Only 2 small elevators for all the floors. So if you're in a hurry, get ready to get frustrated.

Reviews.Title: “amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: xtina_kk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for 5 days and the customer service was excellent, the breakfast was great, the room was well decorated and equipped and the hotel had a great location. I couldn't have asked for anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, well located for city centre. Slowest elevators on the planet!”
Reviews.Author: Starkraving
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice with my family during my holiday. Both bookings were simply for a room for 2 adults and a child, and on both occasions we were given a suite with a separate bedroom, my daughter having the double sofa bed in the living area. The bathroom had a bath and a separate shower cubicle. Two large flat screen TVs, mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and sink. The outdoor pool area is accessed via the 3rd floor, overlooking Robson street. There are only a few (maybe 10) sun loungers which is too few - 20 would be enough though based on the number of guests using it. Be aware that the pool area seemed to be constantly used for corporate events, so we would be lying by the pool whilst the event was going on. On our last day of our holiday (the only day that we had planned to stay by the pool all day), the hotel closed the pool to hotel guests and made it available for a private party. Whilst I was initially very annoyed at this, especially as we had no advance notice, the hotel response was excellent. I went to the reception who had already made plans for anyone who wanted to use the pool to be transferred by free taxi to the Westin Bayshore pool, and a return taxi as well later in the day. The Bayshore pool was better and by the sea, so we were happy with that. Only thing i would say, is it would have been nice to know this alternative was available beforehand, saving the initial annoyance. So, my impression of the service is that it is very good, and the room standard was excellent. The lifts/elevators however, will drive you crazy! There are only 2 of them to the 30 floors of rooms and they are painfully slow. A 10 minute wait is not uncommon. All the guests were moaning about them. I think that the hotel must realise this as they have installed a tv on each floor next to the elevator, presumably to amuse the guests whilst they wait. The location is central for the stadium, shopping, Yaletown, and most other downtown locations. We managed to lug 3 suitcases from the City Centre Sky Train station in about 10 minutes, though there are always taxis outside the hotel. For food, there are lots of places immediately outside the hotel, including a grocery store. Yaletown is excellent for restaurants. By the way, wireless internet is $14.95 + tax per day ! Another hotel ripping guests off. STOP DOING IT PLEASE! It should be free, in the same way the gym, pool etc are free.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: ahoyhoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights. It was our first visit to Vancouver and I found the hotel to be centrally located with large clean rooms. There were shops, a grocery store and several restaurants within walking distance. The soaking tub and dual-showerheads were a nice touch. It was also nice to have a fridge and microwave handy. Our first night coincided with the Stanley Cup final game so we were holed up in our room that night due to rioting but the hotel did a great job of ensuring the safety of the hotel guests. The front-desk was also very friendly. I had an erroneous charge on my bill but a quick call to customer service took care of it. All in all, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Smart living in the most beautiful North American city (plus some tips)”
Reviews.Author: TravelguyNYC75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Grand Vancouver for 3 weekend nights in July. We booked our stay enough in advance so we were able to take advantage of the hotel's Cash & Points option. That made our stay an excellent value for money. Check-in was quick. Our 20th floor superior suite is the lowest category of "rooms" in this all suites property. Even as a lowest category room, our suite was smartly designed making a separation between the living room and bedroom. The small living room had a minibar and a nice convenient "kitchenette" unit with tableware, microwave, a sink and a dishwasher. Bathroom was relatively spacious and had a bath & shower combination. The breakfast buffet here doesn't really have a wide selection of items. However, it looked all fresh, had all breakfast necessities and on top of all it carried an very reasonable price tag of CAD$15pp. Wi-fi is available for a fee of around CAD$15 per day, however the service is a little patchy. If you have your laptop with you, use the cord service instead of wi-fi. Vancouver's area of tourist interest seemed to us relatively small - walking distance city, which made the Westin Grand's location very central. Except for Granville Island, we walked everywhere. Relatively to the number of rooms the Westin Grand Vancouver has a pretty large lap pool makes it self very useful in the very few warm/hot days in the city. The multi strength machine at the gym really elevated my work out from what is normally just some cardio machines and free weights in hotel's fitness rooms. Concierge and bellboys had very useful information about restaurants and places of interest exploring the city. Generally speaking, the staff at the Westin Grand Vancouver were happy to assist, courteous and genuinely friendly. All-in-all, in this most beautiful North American city that serves as a gate to BC, cruises, busy airport connecting to the Far East and so many outdoor attractions the Westin Grand is certainly a hotel we will return to and highly recommend to others. Tips: * Dining in Vancouver (as well as in all of Canada) is more expensive than in the US for the same level of restaurants. We had an excellent meal at Goldfish in Yaletown that was worth every penny. The food was very nicely presented (and excellently prepare as well, of course). The wine list is acknowledged by Wine Spectator and the service is professional and yet charmingly friendly. * Canadian law prohibits (so we were told) preparing burgers less than well done. From our experience, skip burgers in Vancouver! * Vancouver is a sushi mecca. Prices of sushi here are lower than in NYC for fresh, high quality fish.

Reviews.Title: “good for business”
Reviews.Author: mtrlgrl
Reviews.Content: The rooms have a kitchenette, which is very practical. It is beside the grocery store so it is easy to stock up on food. However, the fridge is tiny and filled with mini-bar items, leaving little room for you food. Room is dated (older carpet) but very clean. No table to eat - only a coffee table. My internet was complementary with my rate, but I think everyone should get wifi, in 2011, there is no reason to charge guests for wifi. Very slow elevators (only 2 for 30 floors). Very comfortable bed. Good stay, excellent location and service. My hotel of choice when in Vancouver for business. 4 stars for value.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: GIMD
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family in May while my wife was attending a conference nearby. We booked two connecting rooms so that we would have enough room for all of us (2 adults, 2 young kids). To our disappointment, when we arrived we were told that we could not have connecting rooms as such requests are "not guaranteed". They gave us two rooms on different floors which obviously was not helpful. We elected to all stay in one room. To the hotel's credit, when I complained to the manager during checkout, he knocked off one night's charge. This made things more palatable but I would have rather have paid the full rate and had connecting rooms as planned. The hotel itself is new and nicely appointed but when we return to Vancouver (several trips a year) we will be at the Four Seasons as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Slow Elevators!”
Reviews.Author: RenziMalaysee
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times when visiting Vancouver. I had a suite on the 30th floor. It's small but clean with a queen size bed. Staff is friendly and bell staff very attentive. Central location. Only wish they had more elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: LM1284
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Westin at the end of the month - having stayed at other Westins before I expected a certain level of quality. The end of a month long trip I decided to splurge on an executive suite and was bitterly disappointed. The suite was tiny - smaller than basic rooms I've had at other Westins. The bathrooms looked dated with bath over shower an shower curtains - just felt cheap and average. Not at all what I've experienced at other Westins. Definitely not worth what I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms - unique layouts”
Reviews.Author: Jlee17
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with family on visit to Vancouver. The rooms were very clean and configured nicely to create the sense of a small apartment. The room included a complete kitchen: microwave, dishes, silverware and a refrigerator and dishwasher. We didn't do any dishes as the chamber maids did that, but it was interesting to see that in a room. Bed was very comfortable and service was great. I would highly recommend it and visit again. Bathroom met the wife's high standards and the outdoor pool was greatly enjoyed by the kids.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: jacklsheppard
Reviews.Content: Great staff. The location is centeral to all of downtown areas. The room was very nice and clean. I've read some of the negative reviews and couldn't disagree more. I'll stay here again!! Try it, you'll like it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Not A Special Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glacierboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights before our cruise departed. Room was nice and well spaced. Location is very central in downtown Vancouver. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Elevators were slow. Tim Horton's is next door and good for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, but not cheap!”
Reviews.Author: antibes
Reviews.Content: I am normally a flash packer, staying in good quality budget accommodation. However through certain circumstances I stated at the Westin for4 nights for free, so of course I was happy to do so! It has a Brest location near downtown / robson street, and I could easily walk to the waterfront and gas town. I arrived at 8 am from a very long flight, but the were still able to check me in which I was very grateful for. The suite was nicely, if a little small, but had everything Inc fridge and microwave. The bed was so comfy, like sleeping on a cloud. Internet and breakfast was not included, something that really annoys me about posh hotels, and the elevators were incredibly slow! Staff were friendly and helpful and I got lots of good info about what to do in Vancouver. I really enjoyed my stay here, but wouldn't pay these prices to stay here again, just not in my budget!

Reviews.Title: “It was great, staff friendly, right in the hub of Vancouver with great access to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Lee63255068
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver for Brisbane but also did some sight seeing, this hotel was fantastic for both. Good size room, really great beds and fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: K_SamNewEngland
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Westin Grand Vancouver w/ our two teenagers. We got a room/living room on the 30th floor AND we paid for two nights, stay three as a Starwood (SPG.com) member. Helpful and friendly staff in a beautiful contemporary hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located in downtown”
Reviews.Author: ulfmertens
