Reviews.Content: We got un upgrade when we stayed at Westin Grand so we shouldn't complain at all. And I don't want to. We had a wonderful stay. We got one half of the penthouse incl breakfast and internet flat instead of a standard without breakfast and internet flat. The hotel is perfectly located in downtown. All interesting sightseeing spots are reachable in walking distance. Breakfast was definately the best on our trip (seven different hotels). However, some things were not as perfectly organized as I expect it from a hotel like Westin Grand. When we arrived no concierge welcomed us and took the luggage, our luggage was then put to a wrong room and when we left very early in the morning our wake up call was half an hour too late and lunch package was also not ready the time we agreed on. Parking $26 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Never fails to impress me!”
Reviews.Author: kinx81
Reviews.Content: From the front desk staff to the unseen cleaning staff, this hotel never ceases to impress me. Everyone is polite and helpful. Need directions or a suggestion of a great place to eat and they quickly address your needs. I had a room on the 23rd floor overlooking the public library side. Room was immaculate. Small living room with desk and large flat screen tv mounted on the wall and kitchenette hidden from view behind doors. Bath tub was large and deep, double headed shower, and complimentary bath products were good quality and smelled great. Bedroom had room darkening curtains, great quality sheets and duvet, lots of pillows, and a large closet and small dresser, and another flat screen tv. Didn't get a chance to use the pool or gym this time but in the past I have enjoyed them both. Outside the hotel's entrance you have a Starbucks, Tim Hortons, IGA (grocery store) all within a less than 2 minute walk. The location on Robson Street allows for easy access to shopping. You won't regret staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Byron31
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 4 nights at end of 3-week trip in Canada, and we loved our suite. It had a great separate living room, with a fully-equipped kitchen (it didn't have a fridge, but you only need to request one, and they'll send one to your room), a big bathroom, and a really comfy bedroom. It was very clean, and from the 18th floor we had great views over the city. The hotel is in a perfect location - right on the main shopping street and only 10 minutes from Gastown, Canada Place and gay village. However, I think the hotel should provide free access to the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Will Consider it again!”
Reviews.Author: morphius909
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for Business Trip (Coincded with Game 3 and 4 of the Cup Finals). The Entrance is a bit odd and the Elevators a bit wierd but the attendants were very friendly adn you are located at basically the base of Robon Street by the Sports Complexes. Check In was fast. The room was nice, I had a living room with a separate bedroom. Fairly nice renovation, but the bathroom was a bit rundown and I would suggest they upgrade them to look more modern (i.e. Tub, Toilet, Light Switches). It's the little things that count. I had fairly high speed internet, the mini bar was nicely stocked and I had two flat panel tvs, 1 in the living room and 1 in the bedroom. Room Service (Breakfast) was very good and you received a lot of food. Overall I will definitely stay here on my next business trip!

Reviews.Title: “The name says it all”
Reviews.Author: blueeyez77
Reviews.Content: This hotel truly is Grand!! From the moment you walk in the front door to how guests are treated at this hotel, it is a genuine experience. In the heart of downtown Vancouver, this hotel has great amenities and is ideally situated. Within a block of excellent restaurants, shopping and, of course, Gastown! The rooms are everything you can dream of and more with floor to ceiling windows, marble detailing and the most comfortable bed you've ever slept in. I definitely give this hotel 5/5!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in the Starwood tradition in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: idahoprincess8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Vancouver to celebrate our anniversary in August. Once we arrived at the Westin Grand, we were told that we were being "walked" to the other Westin property in Vancouver due to overbooking. What could have been a very disappointing start to our trip turned out to be a wonderful experience, all due to how the staff handled the situation. We were so impressed with how well they took care of us and how welcome they made us feel, despite the unfortunate overbooking situation. We would absolutely stay at the Westin Grand again any time. The staff was exceptional, and they really went above and beyond to help us celebrate our anniversary, from upgrading us to a gorgeous suite to sending mimosas up to our room before Sunday brunch. The handwritten note of congratulations from the staff is still something I treasure--how often do you receive a handwritten note from anyone these days, let alone a staff member at the hotel where you're staying? One of the best benefits of the Westin Grand is the location. It is right in the heart of the city and an easy walk to many restaurants, shops, bars, and neighborhoods. The walk to Stanley Park is doable as well, which is well-worth the visit, especially on a sunny day. The other Westin is located on the water right next to Stanley Park for easier access. The two are very different properties and having stayed at both during this trip, I would definitely choose the Westin Grand again over the other. In the Starwood tradition, both Westins are wonderful, but the Westin Grand has a great character and staff that reflects the best of what Vancouver has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “restored my faith in Starwood”
Reviews.Author: RESPOO
Reviews.Content: Travel to Vancouver once a year and always stay within the Starwood family properties, prevously stayed with the Westin Bayshore, not a good experience, thought I would leave starwood, but I couldn't, this time made reservations at the Westin Grand on Robson, The Westin Grand restored my faith in Starwood, the customer service was outstanding, large room with separate bedroom and extremely clean. Very close to the Canada Line to connect to the airport, no longer will pay the high price of a taxi. A quick coffee or bite to eat, your favourites right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Average...not for young children.”
Reviews.Author: WTravelerSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Grand in Vancouver, BC last month. We were greeted by a very friendly and professional Valet/Bell Hop staff who were very courteous. Valet cost $31USD/day. The hotel entrance is a little small and difficult to find being hidden behind one of the smaller alleys. You also have to take the elevator to the second floor to the lobby, or climb a number of steps. We requested a 1 bedroom suite and when we got to the room, found it to be a little cramped. It also had a very small patio overlooking other buildings beside it. The pool was a decent size, however by 4:15pm, the sun hides behind the surrounding buildings making the pool cold and shady. The hot tub beside the pool was very relaxing and not very busy. Although the location of the hotel states it is on Robson, it actually is closer to Grandville which is about 5-6 blocks from the heart of Robson. If you were to walk to some of the great Japanese restaurants toward the end of Robson from the hotel, that’s not for the faint of heart since it’s about 10-12 blocks... BTW Save yourself the stomach ache and bad service, stay away from Hon's Wun Tun House on Robson. If you came to party, it would probably be a good hotel since it is close to the nightlife on Grandville. If you however bring your kids, I would recommend not staying here and stay at the Westin Bayshore instead. Since you are close to the nightlife, even on the 15th floor you will hear the street noise and sirens all night. You are also surrounded on all side with other residential buildings, so you can say bye to your privacy. Overall, nice to have stayed here to have seen another Westin option, however I probably won’t stay here again unless the other SPG hotels were sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel with tiny suites. Nothing Grand about this MOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sajjidd
Reviews.Content: $31 valet parking was a little high and then check in was on the 2nd floor with a line and 1 person to check in people. I was in a corner suite and the suite was incredibly tiny. There wasn't enough room to put up my luggage after we opened the pullout bed. (family of 2 adults and 2 kids) The bedroom only had space barely enough to squeeze past the bed to use the bathroom. There was not enough closet space to put luggage or anything. Tall building looked deceptively attractive, the ambiance and rooms tell a different story altogether. Nothing Grand about this hotel oops I mean motel. How did the get 4 stars? Someone was drinking on the job for sure. I give it 2 thumbs down. Try the hyatt around the corner or the four seasons for a real 4 star experience. I have stayed at plenty of high end boutique or other hotels and this one was by far not worthy of the westin name let alone westin grand. This place is worse than a 20 year old best western. I am very critical because if I'm going to spend my hard earned money then I want to get the service or standard I pay for. Pay for what you get and this place was a total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Wildlilac
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and it was awesome! The location is good and the service staff are helpful and friendly. I was about 7 months pregnant and the bed was heavenly and clean! I had a proper and comfortable rest for those two nights. The bathroom was bright, clean and spacious. We had breakfast at the hotel - it was delicious and healthy. Or you can choose to go to the Tim Horton nearby for a cheaper option of coffee and baked goods. Will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at the Westin Grand”
Reviews.Author: TDumas
Reviews.Content: We came for a Bon Jovi concert and stayed two nights at the Westin Grand. The hotel was absolutely perfect. We loved the comfortable cozy bed and the view was beautiful. All the staff was so friendly and helpful. The location was right in the heart of all the shopping and only a few blocks to the arena. We walked everywhere! The only issue we had was the elevators were slow and at one point waited over 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Would Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel2012
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 5 day trip to Vancouver, and really liked it! I've never gone wrong with staying in a Westin, and definitely did not go wrong with this stay! We had a corner suite on a high floor with some great views. The suite was spacious and had many amenities, and of course, was up to Westin standards in terms of cleanliness and luxury. Location was also good, with a couple grocery stores right around the corner, and walking, short drive to all major attractions. If I go to Vancouver again, am definitely staying here again! Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel – I’ll stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: Suman514
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over a weekend, and loved it. Not sure if all the rooms are the same, but I had a suite - with separate living and bedrooms – spacious enough for me. It included a microwave, dishes, sink and dishwasher. Standard Westin toiletries (i.e., white tea). Location was also great – right on Robson and just minutes away from Granville. Easy walking to Canada Place from where you get awesome views of the surrounding mountains and North Vancouver. Make sure to visit Stanley Park while you are there. BTW, amazing food in Vancouver. I went to Shuraku for sushi.... to die for! Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: LeanneAlberta
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin in Edmonton and loved it. Have to say I love this one to!! I wanted to stay at Bayshore since we did have a airmiles gift certificate for one of the rooms we booked but they dont accept those there so we stayed here and I was not disappointed. Loved the location. Could walk to everything and the decor was great. The doorman were awesome and helpful with directions and the pool area was great!!! Loved it so much I am going back in May for the Usher concert and will be staying here!!` Everything seemed updated to me and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Only one night but excellent impression”
Reviews.Author: ctlshaw
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Vancouver and was able to book a room at the westin grand with a reduced rate. While i only had one night here, I really liked the hotel. Location: i thought the location was perfect for someone staying in the downtown area. Not too far from the arena, restaurants, skytrain... An IGA is right nearby for those wanting to buy some munchoes without paying for the mini-bar items... Decor: it suited me well. I liked the lobby being on the second floor. The one bedroom suite, while small, did it for me in terms of style and layout. The bed was very comfortable. A mini-kitchenette was included in my room which was convenient. The bathroom had a nice large tub. View: i had a nice view out of the front of the hotel looking over the city. True, i didn't have mountains, but a city view at night is also nice. Staff: i only had to deal with the staff at the front desk, but they were friendly and accomodating. They answered all of my questions, and obliged one of my small requests. Overall: if i needed to be back in vancouver, i would stay here if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from this 4*”
Reviews.Author: Tdot_to_Van0924
Reviews.Content: Average and forgettable. After staying at the Coast Coal in September (AMAZING HOTEL), we were expecting something just as good at the Westin. Didn't live up to our hopes. Don't get me wrong, it was a nice hotel but those little extra perks were lacking. Decor was definitely not cutting edge or interesting.Theres a heated pool/hot tub but we didn't get to try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Worth ever penny!”
Reviews.Author: QuiGonJin
Reviews.Content: I've never experienced better service. Rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable and the people went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A sweet hotel in every sense of the word.”
Reviews.Author: PlatoPutas
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 10 nights at the Westin Grand for business, but I would definitely visit the hotel for vacation. The hotel is well located about 4-5 blocks from everything -- Gastown, Yaletown, Chinatown and the shopping area on Robson. The staff were always very friendly and helpful, especially the young men who double as valet/concierge in the street level lobby. While there are many floors, the hotel still feels intimate because there aren't many rooms per floor. Each of the rooms have a slightly different layout, and I love that they are all suites with a kitchenette. There's a sink, microwave, dishwasher, dishes and utensils. I also requested a tea kettle and humidifier for my stay. The one thing to keep in mind is the bar fridge is not very cold. The bed is indeed heavenly, and it was a treat to have two flat-screen TVs, one in the bedroom, and the other in the living room. There was a desk and a great rolling table that I could pull up to the couch to do work while in front of the TV (productive, right?) The bathroom is completely acceptable. I liked the White Tea and Aloe toiletries, and the blow dryer was so terrific I emailed the hotel after my stay to find out the brand and model so I could purchase one for home. Lisa, the head concierge, got back to me right away with an answer, another example of how they go above and beyond for their visitors at this hotel. My only major disappointment was the breakfast at the Hidden restaurant. I totally expect that hotel restaurants are generally over-priced. However, their Omelette is $16 with two ingredients (not outrageous) and I was basically served folded scrambled eggs with maybe 10 pieces of tiny shredded cheddar cheese and literally one-and-a-half grape tomatoes (yes, outrageous). I didn't understand why I couldn't taste any of the fillings I ordered and had to pry open the omelette to see if anything was in there. Why the kitchen would go to such lengths to skimp on the ingredients is beyond me. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, but sadly I can't overlook my breakfast experience so I would not recommend dining at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Happy here”
Reviews.Author: Emiwillseetheworld11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, wish we were there longer! The room was on the smallish. However we had the best stay in this hotel, The beds were beautiful, the kids loved the TV, the location was excellent, close to the shops but quiet. It was a hectic time for us, a whole day skiing at Whistler and Blackcombe, another full day of tours (Grouse Mountain, Capilano, Vancouver,) oh the coffee was beautiful! A staff stood out in the crowd, Jesse of the Hidden Restaurant -,he knows his customers, excellent memory, excellent service - he cares and seems to love what he does and genuinely like the people that stays at the hotel. Maintenance staff was quick. Overall stay, happy here, would come back again

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: mattropolitis
Reviews.Content: I have had to stay in Vancouver for more than half the year sometimes- when I do, I always stay at this hotel. Can't beat the beds, the showers, the baths. Make sure you request an 03 room, a room ending in an 03- these are the largest corner rooms with insane floor to ceiling windows and great views of the city or mountains. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spoil yourself here”
Reviews.Author: jciupa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights by myself. Came to vacouver to relax and watch the canucks play. I stayed in one of the Penthouse Executive suites, top floor, ceiling to floor glass overlooking downtown vancouver. The hotel is immaculate. Upon arrival you are treated like a person and not a room number. From the outdoor hottub with a view to the breakfast every morning the whole experiance was worth the money. If you are going out for dinner, I highly recommend Joey Forte's. It's about a 20 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms; Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: FreqTraveller005
Reviews.Content: Smallest 'suites' I have ever seen. They take 1/2 a regular hotel room and put a wall up the middle and call it a suite. Upgrades to larger rooms available for a substantial upgrade fee of course. This is how an SPG Gold gets treated - lower life forms beware.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Room Layout - Apathetic Staff”
Reviews.Author: hawksblue
Reviews.Content: This is the absolute worst quality Westin I've ever seen. The room had a terrible layout. The entry-way to my "superior" suite was literally about 15 inches wide. Not even a modest-sized carryon bag can fit through there without lifting and twisting. I saw one of the other rooms and it was okay, but unless you know what you're in for, you might get stuck with such an atrocious setup. Another colleague of mine with the same unfortunate layout had a room where the lights didn't work. We brought these things up to the staff and they were apathetic and unhelpful - also very uncharacteristic of a Westin/Starwood hotel. I asked to be contacted by the GM, because no staff members seemed to care about these and other issues and never heard back. I would never stay here again. Oh, parking is $30 for a tight/cramped garage and wifi is not free, even for elite starwood guests. There are many nice hotels in Vancouver to choose from, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: cdnbgirl
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in downtown Vancouver than this is an excellent choice. The hotel is tucked away just steps from Robson Street and is close to everything, shops, restaurants, and public transportation. Rates are reasonable, quiet, and very comfortable rooms. My husband and I stay here when we are visiting from Vancouver Island. There is also a IGA supermarket located next door and is open until midnight incase you want a snack and don't want to pay the minibar prices....Also try the Japa Dog across the street for lunch. They are famous with the Japanese tourists and Vancouverities in the know.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to rave about.”
Reviews.Author: ridersfan23
Reviews.Content: For a westin this hotel is seriously nothing to rave about. I read multiple reviews on here and on google about the staff being rather "cold" at first I thought can't be, but after experiencing it myself, it's by far true or there is a lack of a language barrier. The bell guys downstairs were great but the front desk staff need serious customer service training. The hotel rooms nothing to right home about...nice but I've stayed in Sheratons and Westin's that are by far nicer. If your staying for a longer period of time I can see the microwave, dishwasher, etc be a nice treat. The location is not too bad for this hotel. Close to sky train, Rogers Arena, BC Place, etc. Nice that there is a Supermarket IGA right next door. Fitness/pool facilities had a quick look and they looked actually pretty good. Internet - Well another scam by the hotel. 1 hour $6.95 , 1 day $16.95 I thought the Sheraton's were bad...until I discovered the westin properties are actually worse!!!!! The massive complaint I have is if your platinum and you call down to ask for the late checkout they don't even bother checking the profile until you tell them. The newspaper wasn't always delivered every morning and the cleaning staff were VERY PUSHY to get ous out of the room by 4pm. 3:55 already knocking on the door. RELAX we're leaving! Overall...would I stay here again? NOt sure...just wasn't really up to starwood standards by any stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: ralphyboySeattle
Reviews.Content: I'm a Starwood Preferred Guest member and frequently stay at Westin hotels for business travel. I selected the Westin Grand for this business trip believing that the separate living areas in the rooms would be ideal for my client meetings. As expected, the room layout was fine for my business purpose. The common areas, however, were terribly disappointing. The hotel suffered from an overall lack of cleanliness and disrepair. The elevators were constantly filthy, the wallpaper in the common hallways was tattered in obvious locations, and room service trays were not removed from the floor outside rooms for hours on end. The rooms themselves were uninspired and a bit worn and depressing. Service in the hotel was up to Westin standards, but in every other way I found this to be a disappointing and unacceptable business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: srm1977
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel early which was great. we did have a couple of maids knock on the door to clean the room as the message had not filtered down to them. The room we had included a bedroom and living area. the views from the room are fantastic. everything in the room seems top end and there were no disappointments. The hotel is in the centre of things and so you are a short walk from most of the central attractions. We skipped breakfast as the selection did not seem very large and the cost was high. if you pop next door to Tim hortons you can get a reasonable priced breakfast. They were also very good at storing our bags so all in all an excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Westin Comfort In A Small Package”
Reviews.Author: gpbc
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed at the Westin Grand Vancouver twice this year; June and October. Though the hotel is hardly `Grand`, it has become one of my favourite places to stay in downtown Vancouver. This small boutique style hotel has only eight guest rooms per floor but yet offers all the comforts of a larger size Westin. Each contemporary styled guest room is equipped with a fully equipped kitchenette that include among other things a microwave, dishwasher, small fridge, toaster, etc. Most rooms have two TVs; one in the bedroom and one in the lounge area. Some bathrooms even have windows. And of course, the Heavenly Bed, which feels like sleeping on a cloud. I feel like I’m walking into my own boutique apartment each time I walk through the door. The hotel is within walking distance of many of Vancouver’s attractions. There’s no shortage of restaurant and bars nearby. The Granville strip, which is filled with nightspots, is just three short blocks away. If you want to dine in, a fully stocked supermarket is only one block away. I’ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BronsonTexas
Reviews.Content: Every room is a suite. Ours was probably one of the smallest, but had 2 rooms and 2 large screen TVs. Our room was so clean, it seemed brand new and was very modern. The bed was so comfortable! The couch had a lounger on one end where I could stretch out. We had a fridge, microwave, dishwasher and nice dishes. A couple times, we warmed up leftovers from restaurants. Located on Robson Street, we walked to Waterfront, Stanley Park, Chinatown, Gastown, cathedrals, etc. Robson Street is the local in-spot and there were multiple restaurants nearby. I would definitely stay here again. My only complaint was that the hot tub wasn't hot enough to bother getting in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: JY311
Reviews.Content: Great location right downtown - were able to walk to Gastown - Chinatown - Stanley Park - Grandville Island - GM Place. Welcoming staff - were able to provide us many recommendations of places to visit and their favorite little hot spots. Restaurant was great - great food although a little pricey. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Only complaint would be that the rooming service menu is confusing as we called an hour before it said it closed and there were only three options we could still choose from. Did get the chocolate fondue one night though and it was fabulous. Would definately recommend staying here if you want to be able to see a lot of the city while you're there. Beds very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A real pleasure experience following a long journey!”
Reviews.Author: CarrigeenYorkshire
Reviews.Content: This was a very enjoyable one night stay, for our first visit to Vancouver. We had a beautiful two room suite, high up the tower, with a great view of the city. We had everything we could need, particularly a big comfortable bed, air con., fridge, mini kitchen, two tv's, etc. We cloudn't fault it. The staff were helpful and knowledgable about the city and the local area. We found it very central and walked easily to local restaurants and places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: HayaoMiyazakiLover
Reviews.Content: It's downtown, so yes, the room itself will be small, BUT the room itself is very clean and the hotel's location with respect to downtown is ideal. I highly recommend this hotel simply due to the location and price, it was very convenient for us to visit many places on foot. The staff members are very friendly and helpful for those visiting from the U.S. Eat dinner at Le Gavroche, yes it's pricey but it is worth it. The food is delicious and it is a very romantic/intimate place to dine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: goblingoblin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. Decent central location in downtown Vancouver. Nice executive level room(which is on top two floors of hotel) with view of city. Two queen, comfortable beds. Very clean hotel, decent bathroom. Staff was very professional and helpful. We got the buy two nights, get one free, so we thought it was a good deal. Breakfast for two each day was included(they gave us vouchers). Waiter was very nice and let us use four vouchers one day since there were four of us. Option was buffet breakfast or $16 toward entree breakfast item. We got eggs and chocolate coconut french toast off of the regular menu which were great! Nice workout room. Outside pool was bit cold, but we did use the hot tub one day. We had no problem with elevators. Would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, poor service, misleading reservation”
Reviews.Author: Guinett
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be the big disappointment in what was to be a fun weekend in Vancovuer. We booked ahead with Starwood, asking for a suite with 2 bathrooms and after checking into our suite discovered there was just one bathroom (we were a small group of 3 women). We phoned the desk and they told us there was not one room in the entire hotel with 2 bathrooms. Clearly someone needs to explain this to the booking agents working the phones. We were out to a concert with plans to purposely not eat until after the concert. We arrived at the hotel restaurant, sat ourselves when no one would show us to a seat and then sat for 20 minutes without any server or staff person attending to us. Finally we left, staff saw us leaving, smiled and said nothing. Very clean rooms, very poor service from the reservation to check-out. Would not stay there or perhaps with a Starwood hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Westin franchise Hotel....watch out for Dogs and Cats !”
Reviews.Author: OttVanTor
Reviews.Content: Asked at check-in if there was a platnium lounge, the young guy said "this is not actually a Westin Hotel.....it's a franchise with all rooms owned by investors and we manage the property"...........so no platnium lounge. Some other points of note: - ELEVATOR WAIT TIMES Wait times for the 2 elevators was more than 5 minutes. - DOG AND CATS IN THE HOTEL Am allergic to dogs/cats and was shocked to travel up the elevator with 2 of the largest dogs I have ever seen. I don't care who you are or what hotel chain you are.....there is no way on this earth that a hotel chain can properly clean a room after a dog or cat has been there. Who are you kidding. Asked the reception and they confirmed, it's an animal friendly hotel. Wish I had known that. I felt very uncomfortable in my room as a result. - FOOD IN THE BAR had food at the bar.......it is pricey and while the soup was tasty, it had the density of near solid yoghurt. The sandwich was tiny and consisted of 1 half slice of bread cut in 2 with chichen/cheese on top. - STAFF: very impressed with the staff in the bar, restaurant, concierge and reception, they were all friendly and very helpful. - OVERALL IMPRESSION: over priced and under value. would not stay there again if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Hotel That's Really Boutique”
Reviews.Author: DrSGPrice
Reviews.Content: Corner suite had great view, but it is the friendly, helpful service that really stands out. Except for the concierge who always made us feel as though we were interrupting her, and that we had to rush and accept the first bit of information offered, the staff goes out of its way to make guests feel comfortable. Thanks to stand-by concierge Rachel, the folks on the ground floor, housekeeping, and front desk. For a vegetarian/vegan family, it is surprising and welcome to see organic gin and vodka at the bar, and for Hidden's menu to include soy milk, tofu scrambler, and mock "chicken." The location, thankfully, is two blocks from Robson Street madness. We would definitely return. (And don't forget Westin's Heavenly Bed.)

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Larrykw
Reviews.Content: Paid CA$386 per night including self parking & stayed in the executive suite on the 31st floor (top floor) but the room was so tiny, we could always hear all kind of noise from outside which made us difficult to go to sleep. The daily breakfast buffet for 4 was confirmed by Expedia but when we checked in, the front desk manager claimed it was only for 2 adults, anyway, there was nothing to eat and they even charged CA$4.50 plus tax for a cup of orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: brackenrig
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Westin Grande Vancouver - not a great experience and not worth the cost. Upon arrival, the parking elevator wasn't working. Valet parking was a still a premium to the already steep $26/ day so had to walk up and down 3 flights of stairs. When we got to our room, the bellman noticed we had a bottle of wine and asked if we wanted the ice bucket filled. I said yes, tipped him $10 and he never returned. Next we discovered the bedroom phone wasn't working. Then found out the light bulbs on the desk lamp were burnt out. Then noticed the desk was filthy - something had been spilt on it and was never cleaned. Went to get some ice to discover the ice machine wasn't working(I’m guessing this is why the bellman never returned). Lastly reading through the Westin book in our room , I noticed the parking was listed as $21/day, not $26/day. When I called to inquire, the front desk mentioned the parking rates had increased. She did discount me the difference back, however had I not looked in the book, I would have been over charged. Oh and they wanted $15/day for internet usage too. Room was fine but not worth the $200 / night, that's for sure

Reviews.Title: “A Modern, elegant-decor, downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: srichtdi
Reviews.Content: The junior suite separated the bedroom from the sitting room. We think we were put into the smallest possible suite in the whole hotel, but it was still okay. Many nice restaurants are within walking distance including upscale quaisi-street food that is excellent. Don't be afraid to try them. The central location makes it easy to walk almost everywhere. A "Marketplace" IGA grocery store and a liquor store are in the same block as the hotel., and they'll have everything you need. There is a bar refridgerator that is stocked with the usual high-priced stuff. We bought milk, juice and beer and tried to keep them cold in the mini fridge, but it was barely cool. After two days when we asked at the front desk to have the fridge checked, we were informed that the mini-fridge is not meant to cool anything, and that if we wanted a real fridge they would bring us one. They brought it right away. You just have to request a real fridge. Our only other complaint was that the Westin charged $14.95 per day for the internet. The Vancouver Public Library is across the street, with FREE internet access. Also, it is the coolest library you've ever seen. The architecture is amazing. Even if you don't need the internet, just go see it and get some sushi or a "flying wedge" slice of pizza. Overall, you will be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Will never be a bad choice with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheSalfordOne
Reviews.Content: A genuine all-suite hotel with much to recommend. Stayed on two separate occasions and booked two different suites. The first was on the top two floors in an executive suite. Not the biggest but absolutely fine. On the 30th floor, so no balcony, which was a pity. Obviously great view but better to have an equally good view from a lower floor but with a balcony. Real point of the 'executive' tag was the inclusive breakfast. It actually just pays for a continental buffet but the restaurant staff are quick to tell you that you can use the 'value' against anything you want, so that's what we did. The extra each morning was just a few bucks if anything at all. We preferred the corner suite on the 16th floor. It was bigger and with a balcony. The single bathroom had two doors - one into the bedroom and one to the lounge with the sofa bed. It worked brilliantly well, so our daughter staying on the sofa bed was really easy. Good kitchen unit with microwave, sink and a dishwasher (that was really for the maid). There's a mini bar which won't keep anything cold, so you have to ask for a fridge which they will happily bring to the room. The single restaurant is a bonus for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The food is superb and meant for sharing, so you never need to waste anything. But there's a market next door too open late, so you grab anything you want to make sandwiches or hot snacks if you don't want to spend a lot of money. Only minor quirk was the slightly course air conditioning. The first suite was generally too cold and too hot if you turned it off. Second was better and the balcony for the fresh air a major advantage. Aircon in the restaurant was also a small problem. We were all freezing after one 3 hour lunch, and hot drinks would get really cold quite quickly at breakfast. Location is great. Just a few blocks from Vancouver City Centre station, where the train takes less than 20 minutes to get to the airport. Definitely better than sitting in traffic in a taxi. Plenty to do on Robson, great restaurants and shops in the nearby Pacific Centre Mall, Sears, The Bay etc. A superb noodle bar just over the road. The hotel always has deals, so check them out before you book. We got the 5th and 6th nights free on the first stay. Most importantly, the staff are brilliant. I can't believe anyone would ever write a bad review about this hotel. Turn left outside the hotel and head the few yards towards the public library (on the left) pick up the hop-on, hop-off bus at the stop 20 yards on the left down Homer. You're a short walk away from Gas Town, Yaletown, Granville, Burrard and so on. You really can stay here for while without needing a car. This was something like my 20th trip to Vancouver and I still found lots of things to do. The Westin Grand was a perfect base for enjoying the city.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: benfbrown
Reviews.Content: Truthfully, I read the previous lukewarm reviews of this hotel and I almost changed the reservation before we travelled. Ultimately, though, I decided to go ahead and stay there. I would rate the Westin Grand as average. It is probably above average when compared to hotels that cater to business travelers but it is below average when compared to other luxury hotels. The room was upscale but a little worn (with the bath being the most worn-it had some issues with the grout and caulk in the bathroom). The lobby was nice and the staff were mostly accomodating. However, we had several small problems from the moment we checked in. For example, our reservations clearly said that we had reserved a balcony suite on the 30th or 31st floor. Upon check-in, we were placed in a lesser room but this was rectified immediately when we noted it to the front desk staff. Still, though, we ended up on the 29th floor. I note that there are other reviewers who stated they had a similar experience. We also had some minor problems with our key card and internet service (both were logged in for a one day stay so they both stopped working until we contacted the front desk). While relatively minor, these types of things should not happen in luxury accomodations. If I am paying $150 per night then I would be more forgiving. However, at $300 per night, I expect a higher level of service and quality. Unfortunately, the Westin Grand just didn't deliver.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel gives WESTIN a BAD name! Gives SPG even a WORSE name!”
Reviews.Author: MLD31
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying the housekeeping staff is superb. Some of the desk staff is friendly. The positive stops here!!! I am a SPG GOLD member. I booked 2 nights at this place on cash and points. I think the staff here does not understand that cash and points really come out to be over 200 bucks per night. I did NOT get a FREE room on just breathing! I EARNED my points. When I checked in, I asked for an upgrade to club floor. Was told the hotel was full. I understood that. The next day, I asked again. This time, I was told I have to pay a 50 dollars to upgrade. I was OK with that. I went to my "upgraded" room which was IDENTICAL to the size of my old room. I was told the 50 bucks I paid is supposed to cover the 32 bucks free breakfast that I had to ask for when I requested the upgrade! I felt like I was in the Twilight Zone episode! I was also told that I was informed the room size is identical! Who in his/her right mind would move to an identical room for an extra 50 dollars to get a 32 dollars breakfast! Yeah, you got it, NO ONE WOULD! So I told them to give me back my old room. At this point, I was told to return my free breakfast voucher!!! How is that for TREATING a GOLD preferred guest? I have never ever been treated like this at ANY hotel let alone a Westin! I wrote a note to complain and never heard from anyone at the hotel. Next time I am in Vancouver, I will stay at the Sheraton Wall Centre. They upgraded me for FREE to a club floor and their club lounge is amazing!! By the way, this hotel has TWO elevators for the entire hotel. NO club lounge. Because of this horrendous experience, I would never stay at another Westin as a SPG guest. I will stick with the Sheraton where they treat you well. This Westin made me feel as if I was a charity case! YUCK!

Reviews.Title: “Read my review and you will NEVER stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chocolatebox98
Reviews.Content: When my family and I arrived to the hotel, the front desk staff put us in a smaller room than we were supposed to have and we were all on separate floors. We were sent to bigger rooms but they were still on separate floors. At that point we were to tired from a day of travel to really care. The room we were sent to was awful. The door wouldn't completely shut and the sink didn't work at all which we quickly learned that it was because of a burst pipe, because water gushed out from the floor; we had to use all our towels to clean that up. The phone didn't work and the only light in the living room was burnt out. Then we decide to go to the pool to relax, the sauna was out of order. We go back to the room, try to order room service, was told it would come in a half hour, waited an hour, called the front desk and learned that my order was never placed. Then when we try to get some sleep, the fire alarm goes off in the middle of the night, had to trek down 21, yes 21 flights of stairs with a groggy 3 year old. Once the whole hotel was evacuated, in the middle of the night don't forget, we learned that the fire alarm went off because of a water leak on one of the top floors which short circuit the fire alarm....all...night...long. So there was absolutely no chance of sleep, and this was after climbing up the 21 flights of stairs again. This was all on New Years Eve so not only was the holiday ruined for us, but their was drunk people in the streets being obnoxious while we were definitely not in the mood. The personnel was cranky and rude the whole time, while bums waited outside the door to ask for money. I would never stay at the Westin again in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: David48025
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Grand for 3 days on our honeymoon. We booked a suite many months in advance and when we got there - we indeed had a sweet but it was on a low level and had structure beams blocking the windows. I called down to the front desk to see if there were any other suites available and they sent us up to the top floor with one of the only suites with a balcony. We were thrilled with this service. We took the ferry into Vancouver from Victoria and loved every minute of it. The Westin Grand is in an amazing location and if your high enough you have a beautiful view of the cityscape with mountains in the backdrop. Room service brought us fresh fruit and bottled water every morning. It's pricey - but it's a pretty great hotel in a very great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great suites”
Reviews.Author: carpenoctemBerlin
Reviews.Content: This hotel ist the best in Vancouver. Very large suites, great views, good minibar, good room service etc. The bar at 3rd floor is nice and their service superfriendly. Check-in and -out was less friendly but still okay. It is centrally located and everything is is walking distance. And for the size of the rooms the price is really okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but does not live up to Westin standards”
Reviews.Author: Laura717
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fine, and location was great - but I don't think this hotel lives up to Westin standards. Tiny shower, only 2 elevators, concierge not very knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlanP00le
Reviews.Content: Impressed with the location (Robson St is one of the main streets in Vancouver) the standard of the rooms and the friendliness of the staff. If you can afford it stay here - you wont be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Shame about the city”
Reviews.Author: cbetofop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Grand on Robson in Vancouver in May 2010 for 1 night prior to and 2 nights following an Alaske cruise. The hotel is very good indeed offering individual mini suites rather than rooms, with only 9 suites on each floor. The hotel's restaurant 'Hidden' is also excellent. One small criticism is the number of elevators. In the mornings / evenings you can wait an age. Ok on the lower floors,as you can use the stairs but on the 17th, this was not an option. We returned to the hotel very early in the morning following the cruise, but there was no problem at all with an early check-in. The only issue is Robson Street itself which is a bit of a deserted cavern most of the time, and how Vancouver keeps getting voted as one of the best places to live in escapes me...it is like a towering Soviet edifice in scale and appears dull, grey and soulless in the Downtown, Gastown, and Yaletown areas at least - the streets are mostly devoid of people save the odd beggar outside of shopping / office hours - Seriously Moscow has more going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bevchris
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nights here. We had a great stay, the location was perfect, the room spacious and very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful and we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Vancouver Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveFrancis
Reviews.Content: I had booked an Expedia deal at this hotel several weeks ago. It seems since the Olympic Games, Vancouver hotel prices have risen at least 100 percent. The Expedia deal was fairly good, and travelling with the in-laws, I booked two suites at well below advertised rates. The hotel is on Robsen Street, which as you know is the heart of Vancouver. Very easy to find, checking in was a breeze. The front desk was very friendly, efficient, and had an upgrade to a bigger suite all ready to go. The lobby is very opulent, clean, and smells of white tea. The elevators are express, and whisk you to your floor in seconds. This was nice because most hotel elevators in Vancouver are cramped and slow. Entering the suite, we found it was in perfect order. One bedroom through the hall and bathroom were magnificent, with dual shower heads, marble everywhere, and nice bath amenties. The living portion had a giant flat tv, as did the bedroom. Temperature was already set to 68 degrees. Mini bar, kitchenette, and fridge, albiet cost prohibitive, were in very good order. We checked out the facilities on floor three, and found a very well equipped fitness room, dry and wet sauna, a nice sized lap pool, and jacuzzi. You may order food to this level until 10pm, and it does make for dramatic views of Robsen Street and the surrounding city buildings. As with any Vancouver hotel, parking is really a drag...at 24.00CAN there just is not anywhere in the city you can park for less...so I accepted the fee with a minor grumble. We did not dine at the restraunt this time, but I was able to query a couple just coming out who said it was too expensive for them, but remarkably good. Several other couples mirrored the same sentiment. I travel to Vancouver a lot, and I recomend a short three block walk west to the Lennox Pub at the Corner of Robsen and Granville. This is a fun and very traditional Irish Pub that strangely plays Reggae music....which is delightful. Dinners and lunch are fairly priced, and our entire dinner party loved the fare. A special note: The servers here were fantastic, cute and cheerful. This made our visit so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever, bar none. Best Western, not even.”
Reviews.Author: jsazaki
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer: I want to say as a precursor to this review that the night I stayed here was booked with travel points. I don't know whether or not this makes a world of difference because it shouldn't--FUN FACT: travel points are often collected by spending money at hotels, so as far as I'm concerned I'm a paying customer and would like to be treated as any other. Long story short, don't spend your points here just in case this is the reason why my stay here was so horrifyingly bad. My mother and I came to Vancouver for a week and had one night where we planned to stay at the Westin. I am in my twenties and my mother is in her fifties, we are quite well traveled and come from the east coast (where things are faster and seafood tastes cheaper). I'd like to think that we both represent two typical but diverse demographics of patrons at this hotel, and who are not at all picky when it comes to accommodations, as it is said often: nobody travels just to sit in their hotel. This hotel is well situated, I guess first dibs on the sweet digs is one of the few bonuses to being a part of a multi-billion dollar hotel franchise. The restaurant in the hotel (at least for breakfast), is fine. Service is attentive, blah blah blah you can probably find better brunch somewhere else but it's passable. So yeah that's pretty much where the good ends. We check in at 9am and are very surprised to be presented with our room key, since we were planning on leaving our bags and checking in at the 3pm check in time (I called the night before, and was told curtly that they were operating at 100% capacity, so : ???) We get in, and realize that our large window faces into a parking lot underneath and condo windows several meters away, once again, no problem-- Vancouver has nicer views elsewhere. We requested two double beds and were instead given a single queen sized bed. Once again, no problem--we could just share the bed for a night. Then we realize something: our room has no chairs. At all. There was literally a bed, a table, and what seemed to be a half completed kitchenette with the doors ripped out. So I call downstairs at around 10am and ask them if it's possible to switch to another room because I figured it's not like my breathing contaminated the living space or anything and I haven't yet removed my pants to wander around the room aimlessly and jump all over the bed. Plus, it was 10am, none of today's new guests have even checked in yet. The gentleman on the other line tells me more or less that it sucks that I'm shafted with this chairless bedlacking room but he can't switch my room because it would be unfair to the other guests who will not be arriving for another 5 hours or so. He reiterates that the hotel is operating at full capacity like I'm supposed to feel sorry that they're making tonnes of money and actually doing their jobs or something. Fine, whatever so we leave all our stuff in the room and head out for the day. Upon returning to the room we found two chairs set up, which was a nice alternative to sitting on our one queen sized bed. Then we found out that none of the lights work, the room didn't have any sort of garbage bin or soap (no big deal but still come on), and that the fridge was broken and smelled like rotting fish. The 'engineer' who brings us lightbulbs and another fridge to store our now turned milk laughs and tells me that there are 6 other fridges broken downstairs, like it's funny. Okay so I'll skip to the end, I don't think I would recommend this hotel to anybody. I'm happy that the other people on Tripadvisor have had a good experience here but honestly my experience here was not only the worst out of any other Westin experiences, but even worse than a good handful of hostels in Capetown. Is expecting a Westin hotel room to be ready with a chair and a working lamp too much to ask for? Seriously? 'Service Express' was pretty quick to bring stuff to solve the problem, but I'm here to travel efficiently, not to play build-a-hotel-room and certainly not to spend my entire freaking day pleading politely on the phone like a moron for light bulbs so I can use their 15 dollar a night internet.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: Jenna_2000
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel experiences I've had; enjoyed every minute. Staff was amazingly helpful and nice. Room and bed were very comfortable and our views of the city were fantastic. My husband and I walked everywhere and found the location of the hotel to be great...will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Suites good for a family, but hotel seems to be showing its age”
Reviews.Author: ploughman1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after a 5-day spring skiing trip to Whistler, where we stayed at the excellent Pan Pacific Village Center. After that outstanding experience, the Westin Grand was a bit of a disappointment. The suites (I think all the rooms here are suites) are a good set-up for a family with 2 small kids. We paid $30 on arrival to upgrade from our $289/night suite to a Deluxe suite. It was very small (with the sofa bed pulled out, you really had to squeeze past it), the shower door was poorly fitting (so it leaked a bit) and the AC was very noisy (and wasn't working at all when we first arrived - they fixed it quickly). We were also very near the elevator, the noise of which kept my wife awake. Having listed all my complaints, I have to say that the staff were very accommodating. Upon our request they moved us to another (slightly larger) suite, and comped us the very good breakfast. The day manager followed up with us to make sure we were satisfied with the new room, and was very apologetic. All-in-all, not a bad experience, but I just think the hotel is aging and in need of a bit of an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: potbellypete
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Vancouver to catch a Canucks game and decided on the Westin due to its location to both GM Place and the shopping on Robson St. We stayed 4 days and had an absolutely wonderful time. The check-in was 1 floor up the marble stairs and took all of 5 minutes. I liked the security process in the elevator where you have to swipe your hotel room key to gain access to your floor. The restaurant and lounge (Aria) are one in the same. The hotel website makes them sound seperate. My wife had the duck which she said was amazing. I had the seafood linguine and it seamed like it was prepared in a haste. The noodles were only warm, not hot. The seafood was laid out over the noodles, not mixed in. We really enjoyed the buffet every morning which had been included in the price of our room. There was plenty of fresh fruit, pasteries, cereal and muffins to choose from. And for only a small surcharge, the smoked salmon eggs benedict was delicious, as well. The entire hotel staff was very friendly and always offered directions to wherever we were heading to that day. The valet would have our car waiting for us even though we always called down right before heading out of our room. We experienced no more than a 60 second wait for the elevators at any time. We didn't try the spa or weight room. As for the room, the view was just amazing. We had room 3109 which is a corner suite with balcony. We could see the harbour/grouse mt. on one side all the way over to Mt. Baker and Burnaby in the distance on the other side. We never saw housekeeping but the room stayed spotless. We would have breakfast then head out for the day and the room would be made up before we returned at 5pm. Then we noticed after dinning out every night, there would be fruit and water on our table and the room would be tidy again. So they must stay very busy. There is both a tub and shower in the room, as well as a small kitchenette. The tub also comes with a pull out shower head to rinse off the soaking suds. Our stay was made even more enjoyable due to catching 4 days of no rain in April, quite a surprise. I would definitely recommend this hotel to even my closest friends and family. We have stayed a number of other hotels in the area, but this is the first time we found one with a corner suite balcony and a tub. The kitchenette was just a bonus as we enjoyed the starbucks coffee in the morning and the hot tea at night. Oh, and lastly, I should mention that if you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs or leave the music playing at night as the emergency vehicles at night travel with full sirens on. The noise, as in any city, bounces off the other buildings and seems as if they are right outside your window.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: bookworm450
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from front desk to parking staff - I bought some fruit from the IGA next door (open late) and they offered to send up a mini-fridge so I'd have room to store it. Didn't even know I could that. Absolutely fantastic location, right next to the public library, and within 5 minute walking distance to many nice restaurants, Granville shopping area - and really, Vancouver is a very walkable city so you can easily get to Davie St. (lots of restaurants too), nice views of the ocean, etc. Went for work so I was given a suite with a small balcony and queen sofabed. The little kitchenette is very handy and has a microwave, sink, dishwasher, all supplies/utensils. Every day they would clean the utensils/plates which was nice of them although slightly unnecessary. The door on Robson was useful since that's a busy street but closed later at night so you have to use the entrance where the cars/taxis go in which seemed a bit inconvenient but it's not a big complaint. Wifi is free but $15/day for non-guests (bit of confusion when I asked at first), Starbucks at every corner. Didn't eat at the restaurant or use the gym but the Westin brand is pretty consistent across cities. Gym seemed smaller but facilities were similar to the Montreal Westin. They always deliver a Globe and Mail newspaper to your room every morning. Basically, it's a nice, clean, new hotel in a fantastic location. Would recommend for anyone needing to stay downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Got to Love Starwood and Westin”
Reviews.Author: AfricanKing
Reviews.Content: Central location, clean and safe. Love the views and the pool makes you think you are at a resort. Service was top notch, Great job to all.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel but certainly the best bargain”
Reviews.Author: rosiefromlondon
Reviews.Content: We booked an executive one bedroom suite on the top floor of this hotel through the hotel's website and it worked out at about £100 a night as the rate was low in the first place and we got a free night. When we arrived we also found we were entitled to a free breakfast each day, which was very welcome. It's not the most stylish hotel but it's perfectly functional. The bathroom was very spacious with a separate bath and shower. We had a king sized (very comfy) bed in the bedroom and sofa bed in the lounge for the kids, with fantastic views over the city and towards the mountains. Both rooms had up to date plasma screen TVs. My one gripe was a lack of storage space for clothes (but then this is a problem with hotels wordwide - they only ever provide enough shelves/drawers/hangers for one person even though their rooms can be occupied by up to four people. Very annoying). Other than that, we thought this was a total bargain - I would normally expect to pay about three times what we did for a room and hotel of this quality. The staff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful, wtih a special mention to Jesse who works in the Aria restaurant and was a great guy - friendly but really professional at the same time. If only all waiters could be this good - definitely a cut above any other hotel waiter I've ever come across. We stayed at the Westin for three nights to adjust to Pacific time before heading up to Whistler. It's a great location - there always seemed to be a taxi outside the entrance and the main shops were just up the road. If we can get such a good rate again we'll definitely be staying here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spacious Option for Trip to Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: MTCB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for the Vancouver 2010 Paralympics. The room was very spacious and the suite layout perfect for a family of 4. The first night we arrived the heat wasn't working so early in the morning we called the duty manager who personally came up to check out the problem- he couldn't fix it but promised to get engineering in first thing which he did. More importantly he offered us breakfast for all three nights for our troubles- We didn't need to ask him for it he came out and offered it which in my opinion shows a true commitment to service! People who are focused on solutions rather than problems always win in my book. The hotel is centrally located and perfect for walking around Vancouver. I highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Strange Room”
Reviews.Author: rowu1946
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this not for one night on a business trip. It was a fine hotel but did not meet my expectation of the Westin brand. The bedroom in the suite has a strange shape so that the bed has to be placed diagonally in the room. When in the bed, I found myself facing the corner of the room. It drives crazy. It was quite difficult to find the entrance to the hotel. I was driving my rental and circling the building several loops before I finannly called the hotel to find out where the entrance was.

Reviews.Title: “great location and views”
Reviews.Author: orange_crush6
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in the executive suites while looking for apartments in the downtown area the last week of January (before the olympics!). This place did not disappoint! Room- the executive suites are HUGE! If I could live here I would. Great space, nice decor, comfortable bedroom, great living room, and I especially loved that there was a mini dishwasher! Bathroom- also HUGE! Great shower and tub. Views- had beautiful views of the downtown area, mountains, and water. My room came with complimentary breakfast which was delicious. Did not see the pool or the gym, but I heard they were nice. Great location next to the main shopping area and restaurants. Cabs were 5-$10 depending on where you wanted to go in downtown. No complaints about anything. The staff was also nice and attentive. Cost- we got a great deal with starwood "free 3rd night across canada" so the average cost ended up being around 180/night great deal for the space you get.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: unplainjane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Grand for 4 nights on business, and from the minute I walked into my room I was impressed. I stayed in a superior king which has a separate living room and bedroom. The bathroom was huge with a big tub and separate double shower head. There is also a little kitchen area with a refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher. The room was clean and furnishings very nice and tasteful. This was one of the nicest hotel rooms I have stayed in. As well there is a little balcony that overlooked the outdoor pool and hot tub. There is also wifi in the rooms which is normally $14 a day but I had a corporate rate so it was free. Speaking of the hot tub, it was amazing. Sitting at night in an outdoor hot tub overlooking the city, in the Vancouver rain is something to be experienced. It is connected to the gym which also has steam rooms. I used this area few times I was there and there was hardly ever other people around. So it was always very quiet and relaxing. In terms of service it was very good and attentive. Every time I had to call from my room the phone was always picked up immediately. I called for room service one night and she said it would take 40 minutes but the food arrived in 10 minutes. Quick! The location is fantastic. For breakfast it is right beside a Tim Hortons and Starbucks. As well for shopping it is close to Robson and Granville where there are lots of shops and a mall. For unique outdoor shops walk to Gastown which is at the top of Homer. Really nice to walk around the one main street there. As well there are tons of nice restaurants in Yaletown if you walk in the other direction on Homer. Everything you want is within 10 minutes walking distance of the hotel which is great. There is also a supermarket closeby and a wine store right beside the hotel. If you want a drink or bite to eat really close there is a cute and cozy bar called Subeez a block a away. A couple of negatives is that halfway through my stay I called to have the lamps beside my bed fixed as they didn’t work but no one came to fix them. As well on my last day the internet was really slow in my room and they said they would call IT but 20 minutes later told me they couldn’t get a hold of them. Just tiny things that didn’t affect my stay. For the room, friendly service and location I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to be at.”
Reviews.Author: dakid23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend on Valentines Day. The staff was very helpful and the hotel is in a great location. I would want to come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - AMAZING EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: Chafman
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Vancouver on a rainy night for a series of meetings the next day before returning back to TO. Needless to say, I was hoping to have a good night of sleep... and I was spoiled. When checking in, I got upgraded (for no apparent reason) to the VIP floor where I got the most incredible experience: a very large suite with an amazing view of Vancouver from the 20th+ floor (see pics). To complement the amazing room, the mattress was heavenly confortable and the room extremely quite (I didn't hear a-n-y noise). As for the service, the staff was very friendly and helpful, a great combination for busy travelers. :) This was definetly the best experience I had in my 100+ stays in hotels across North America.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Heated bathroom floors, lemon water in the spa, need I say more?!”
Reviews.Author: SpideyFan
Reviews.Content: Amazing location in the heart of Vancouver, if your staying here for the Olympics, you'll be centrally located for all downtown events. Everyone I encountered had a smile on their face, and the day that a business function closed off the restaurant, the hotel gave plenty of notice and waived room service fees, many hotels would have been like "that's your problem" but not the Westin. Internet prices were outrageous in the business center, but I have yet to find a hotel where their not. The rooms themselves were beautifully appointed, clean, and comfortable. Nice views, but surrounded by tall condos and apartment buildings so remember to close your drapes at night, the curtains alone are too thin to keep people from seeing in. If your high up enough you'll need not worry about street noise. I found the thermostat difficult to operate and should have come with instructions, but maybe it was just me. The spa was fantastic and safe, for use only by hotel guests or locals with a key card. All equipment and facilities were functioning along with the steam room, sauna, and jacuzzi. It seems like at some places one or more of these are out of order or closed for cleaning. Outdoor pool was operational but too cold for swimming. But it was nice that they left the choice of swimming in 60 degree weather up to me and didn't close the pool for the season as some hotels do. Overall, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for business travel”
Reviews.Author: mauigal06
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with friendly, helpful staff. Good size rooms right in the heart of downtown Vancouver. Quality in-room amenities fully refreshed and stocked each day. Staff make an effort to recall previous visit preferences and to proactively ensure current visit goes well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and smart”
Reviews.Author: CanucksTraveller72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice in September, first for 2 days, then for 3 more days later in the month. On the first visit we were given a complimentary upgrade to a King Suite which was a nice surprise. The room was spacious, split into a seperate bedroom and a living room / kitchenette. It's a great bonus to have these kitchenettes in all the rooms... with the IGA Marketplace supermarket next door it was handy to be able to get breakfast supplies for the mornings. The beds were super comfy, the room had everything we needed, it was spotlessly clean, and overall it was very good value for money. On the second stay, there was no free upgrade but we were offered a paid upgrade to a King Superior suite at an extra cost of $30CAD per night. We accepted this and was glad we did... if you are offered the upgrade at that price, snap their hands off because it's a steal. The King superior suite was like a condo / flat, with a balcony, a small living room, hallway, kitchenette, large bedroom, and large bathroom. I could honestly have lived in there. The only small hiccup was a blocked toilet on the first night, but maintenance were there within minutes and fixed the problem promptly. The Westin Grand is superbly located at the Eastern end of Robson Street, close to BC place, and only a 6 minute bus or cab ride, or a 10-15 minute walk to all of the restaurants clustered further West around Robson / Thurlow. This is about as good as hotels get in this price range, and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Really excited until we opened the door...”
Reviews.Author: 2Roos2Joeys
Reviews.Content: We got a 'deluxe room' through Hotwire for US$105 + taxes etc. We were so excited, until we opened the door... Bear in mind that we brought 2 large suitcases, 1 medium suitcase, 1 small suitcase, port-a-cot and a pram for 2 adults, 1 x 2 year old, 1 x 7 month old for a month long holiday - through out Canada. Upon opening the door we were concerned... Where was all our luggage going to go? Where was the port-a-cot going to fit? Where will put the pram when it's not in use? Where will the kids play? How will we all fit? It was late when we got there and we just made do. The views from the 25th floor were fantastic! We looked right up Robson St, towards Richards and Seymour Streets. Very handy IGA supermarket 2 shops down. The rooms are perfectly presented. Bathroom was huge. Separate shower and bath. In fact it was so big, this is where we but our two large suitcases and the pram, when not in use. It also had a handy clothes line/ string thingy. The suite had a dishwasher (no powder - house keeping does it), microwave, sink, toaster, coffee maker, 3 setting of dinner plates, bread & butter plates, bowls, cups & saucers, glasses, large slotted spoon, egg flipper & ladle, chopping board, glass mixing bowl, plastic jug, 2 sharp knives - big & small, and a mini bar (filled to the gills with all the stuff you want and somethings that come in really handy). You have complementary use of an umbrella, which you can buy later if you want. You also get a tea towel and dish cloth. Large desk with comfy ergonomic chair. The double sofa bed was well used. The tv in the lounge and the tv in the bedroom operate out of the same ill fitting cabinet, shelf above, shelf below job. The bedroom is separated from the lounge by noisy opaque glass doors that don't really do much at all. The king bed was brilliant! I think it was feather topped and the 4 pillows were all feather, 2 firm, 2 soft. My issues... They never changed our bed sheets until our baby was sick all over the bed 4 days into our stay. Our dishcloth was taken on our first day there and never replaced, and our tea towel wasn't changed at all. You couldn't secretly watch tv in the bedroom without it disturbing our 2 year old (in the lounge room) because the speakers were in the back of the telly and glass door blocked no light at all. We couldn't keep the temperature in the room even. The heating came on then air-conditioning, then heating, then cooling. We all ended up with colds, you get warm, kick the blankets off, only to have pull them back on again, all night. And when you had the doors shut (so our baby could try and nap), one room was hot and the other cold. We had one of those interconnecting room door thingy's also. We heard every conversation that our neighbors had. The room was a tight squeeze, especially when the sofa was pulled out. In fact you could say that it was about as wide as a pull out sofa, with a very little room to walk past it. The first thing we had to do each morning was put the sofa bed away. No where for our kids to play. We had to make toast in the bathroom. Our stay was majorly effected by the size of the room and house keeping. We spoke with another couple who had 1 baby (not 2 like us), and they said that they demanded a different room. I asked the bell man if all the rooms were as small as ours (when we checked in), and he said they were, but... They have different configurations! The other couple kindly showed us their new room. Such a better layout than ours! Grrrr! We didn't raise our issues with the hotel. I didn't think we could because we had got it through Hotwire, not directly. I just assumed that the average service we received was because we didn't pay full price. I wished we had! Can't beat the location and the shops that are around. Everything is on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, great amenities, great location, GREAT VALUE!”
Reviews.Author: Jordsmom3061
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Downtown Vancouver and close to everything we wanted to see. It's a beautiful hotel with many amenities including a separate bedroom and living room and a large bathroom. Two TV's and totally comfortable for two people. The concierge was excellent in her knowledge of the area and steering us towards fabulous restaurants. Vancouver is fantastic and I'd love to go back. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it's grand but it's also bland.”
Reviews.Author: BlackberryBoy
Reviews.Content: I should first clarify that I don't intent my title to be too negative, I just liked the rhyme. I gave this hotel four stars and I stand by it, it was a decent hotel but the decor is quite dull and similar to many other hotels I've stayed at. I own a business in Vancouver but commute to town by ferry and I occasionally have to stay in town if I have to work late, this time my event was canceled and my wife and I ended up having a pleasant night on the town. The location is superb, it's right across the street from the main library (unique architecturally and well worth a visit in my opinion), and walking distance to everything from the Art Gallery to the Convention Center. This is also a rather unique part of downtown in that there's plenty of meter parking on the street and it's not very sketchy so I didn't feel stupid leaving my car on the street all night. Why do I mention this? The hotel parking was over $20.00 a night, the parking meter's are about $2.50 an hour but you don't have to pay from 8:00pm until 9:00am, this piece of info may or may not save you some money depending on when you arrive and depart. The hotel looks and feels much more like an upscale condo than a hotel, frankly I don't like the look or vibe but that's just my own opinion (more on this later). There is no lobby on the main floor, you have to taken a staircase or an elevator up one floor for this. The doormen were very friendly and explained this to us within a few seconds of us walking in. Reception was fast and friendly but we did have a little surprise when the a woman walked out of the room we had been assigned to as we were about to walk in! The woman at reception was very apologetic (I think the guest had already checked out but hadn't given up her room key yet or something), anyway we were quickly assigned a new room which was an upgrade to a one bedroom suite with a king sized bed in the bedroom. The room was perfectly adequate with a small living room with a sofa, a couple of chairs and small coffee table. There was a fairly ingenious kitchenette set up tucked away in a closet but I couldn't see it being that helpful for cooking. There was a small sink, a microwave and a dishwasher, be warned that the only fridge was the mini bar which was already full of costly snacks so if you were planning on doing grocery shopping you'd be strapped for fridge space. (probably a good time to mention that there's a full service grocery store called I.G.A. just a couple of stores down). By far the best part of the room was the bathroom, it was unusually spacious for a chain hotel with an enclosed shower seperate from the bathtub and with two really nice massaging shower heads too! I really don't like the look that a lot of upscale hotels are going for, when I walk into a lot of rooms (this one included) I feel like I'm at a show suite for an overpriced condo development. That said the styling really worked for the bathroom, it looked very sleek and expensive and my wife loved it as well. The bedroom was fine with a decent sized closet and a comfortable bed although my wife and I both struggled to find a comfortable pillow, there were a lot of them but none of them were very comfy! The only other thing would say about the room is that it's stocked with fantastic Starbucks coffee and tea! We didn't use the restaurant but I've heard it's very good, we didn't interact with the staff much but every one we did talk to was professional, friendly and competent. Although I wasn't wowed by the room itself I would hardily recommend this property. I've lived in or Vancouver all of my life and I love the city, but the downtown has a lot sketchy areas even in places you'd think would be nice. This hotel is located in one of the best possible locations, there was not a panhandler or squeege kid in sight! This part of downtown is very residential, the hotel is surrounded by highrise condos, which means there are always lots of people walking around even late a night not only does it make it feel very safe to walk around at night, it's also a very pleasant vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Love the suites and great location. Needs faster elevators!”
Reviews.Author: KatieCanada
Reviews.Content: I'm not normally a SPG points collector so I don't stay in this chain too often. Nice all suite hotel - dishwasher and microwave in my room, esp if you're staying longer. Mixture of bachelor style units and one bedrooms. Good service - my room had no toiletries upon arrival and this was quickly fixed. Smooth check in and check out. Cons: slow as death elevators and it would be nice to have an LCD TV. Premium prices for parking downtown - didn't valet the car so not sure the valet rates, but self-parking is $21/day for guests.
