Wi-fi isn't free here :( Pluses: nice suites, big bathrooms, clean, great location, great service staff. Conference rooms are a good size and the service staff are excellent here for meetings. Definitely a solid hotel in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: seaquest11
Reviews.Content: Room rates much higher than value of stay. The staff was very efficient on checkin but front desk gave us an electronic key card that did not work in elevator which is mandatory to go up...not down though...took card back and she said it was fine after she checked it but it still failed to work...had to find a more helpful person to get it replaced and this time it worked. Suite had amenities in fridge and on the shelf available for purchase that were totally outrageous in price such as $3.50 for a soda or $8 for a mini 50ml bottle of alchohol (this could be more effective than the AA), 1 microwavable popcorn for $5...or my Fave...a bottle of water for $5 (LOL)... One of our bath towels was neatly folded up with a 4" rip in the middle. Wireless internet free at most decent places cost $14.99 for a day.... (plus PST & GST) whatever that is makes it a total of $16.79... cost... for a toll free call to use our calling card cost us $1.40 each time a call was placed.. The general area is under siege by both construction and street people begging for money... I would never stay here again... It is an overpriced- overhyped hotel that should be used only for the overindulgent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Good Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: forever_yours_390
Reviews.Content: We had to embark on a ship from the Vancouver port and decided to fly up a few days early so we could explore the city. The cruise line had recommended Pan Pacific and I'm glad I decided to do my own research. The Westin Grand was not the most affordable hotel, but I only take vacation once a year and I'm more concerned with being comfortable and receiving good service. The Westin has a more corporate feel to it so if you're looking for flowers and pretty decor you won't find it here. If comfort, cleanliness, good location, and superior customer care are on the top of your list then you should definately consider staying here. Everyone on staff was professional and efficient. I plan on retuning to Vancouver since we had such a blast and will definately stay at the Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “great location and rooms and very good for longer stays”
Reviews.Author: gaffelaar
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 6 nights and had a suite consisting of a small bedroom and separate sitting room. There was a small kitchen in a cupboard. Nice view from the sitting room and comfortable sofa and armchair (although a bit jaded and in need of recovering). Hotel location is great, on the edge of downtown and easy reach of gastown, yaletown etc, also both a supermarket and liquor store on the same block so easy to have relaxing evenings in when we did not feel like a restaurant meal. Had a very comfortable stay and one of the few places we came across in two weeks in Canada with quiet airco/or quiet when windows were open at night, good sleep every night.

Reviews.Title: “MONEY GRAB”
Reviews.Author: akmacca
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand is located right in the heart of Vancouver on trendy Robson Street. The loby is small but functional and on the same floor sits the restaurant which is rather small, but manages to serve tasty meals. My room was on the 21st floor but still not hight enough to afford a view of anything but other highrises. I think you would have to be on the top few floors to get a view of the water. The room was well appointed with separate living and sleeping accommodation, both rooms had tv's. The kitchen is tiny, just a fold out really but I think that it serves its purpose and is more than adequate. The bathroom which is large in comparison to the rest of the unit. Overall the rooms are adequate, nothing special. The pool is on the smallish size but the gym is excellent with an array of modern equipment. There is an IGA supermarket just a few door up the troad from the hotel which is a welcome relief from pricey restaurants. Felt safe enough walking the streets but saw an alwful lot of strange people wandering around. My biggest complaint is that a hotel that charges such an expensive rate has the audacity to charge $21 a day for parking and then again for internet access, something that I have had provided freee of charge in the tiniest motel in the tiniest of towns in the USA and Canada. For this fact alone I wouldn't recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: anelizon
Reviews.Content: Excellent for business or pleasure, I was in Vancouver in mid August and found the room quite luxurious with a small kitchen, huge bath and the best bed you can imagine. I was also amazed with the attention in the reception and by the staff, when I asked for headache pills and late room service, I was treated with great deal of attention. The location of this hotel is quite good, just by Robson street for the best shopping or a great dinner out in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: philotravelin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and well-maintained. The staff was generally friendly and helpful. The room, which was a suite, was on the average size for a suite, but the doors separating the bedroom from the living area were smoked glass. Location is on the far side of the shopping district, closer to the arenas. This made for an easy walk to excellent ethnic diners, and a small grocery store is located next door if you want to use your mini-bar to the fullest, least-expensive extent. Easy drive to the beautiful Vancouver parks. Very nice pool! Only issue - incredibly slow elevators; only two for a high rise! By the way, disappointingly, we found Vancouver filthy and covered with the homeless! Otherwise, very friendly city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience At Cost!”
Reviews.Author: myvoicecarries
Reviews.Content: My bf and I book all our hotels through Hotwire.com, so we were quite pleased when we managed to book three nights at the Westin Grand in Vancouver for 90 dollars a night (USD). From what I gathered this was considered an 'economy class' type of Westin, but even without the perks of typical Westin properties...this hotel was fantastic for my bf and I (we're both 20-somethings, we are pretty low-maitence). The hotel has the lobby on the second floor, so when you enter you don't see it right away. From what I understand this is meant to give you the illusion that you are walking into an apartment building and not a hotel. It is supposed to make the place feel more like yours than theirs. Interesting idea, didn't bother me. Some reviewers I've read though really did not like this feature. The rooms are great. We had the most basic suite with a small sitting area, a seperated bedroom (both rooms had large floor to ceiling windows and televisions), and a well spaced bathroom. There is also a closet kitchenette that is kept behind two large doors. If you never need to use it, you don't notice it even there. The fitness lounge in the Westin is fantastic. Plenty of equipment and free weights. Was never so busy that you had to wait to use a machine. Had nice features such as ice cold lemon water (it's soooo refreshing after a good sweat). There was a decent sauna we took advantage of once and I believe there are steamrooms as well. One of my absolute favourite things about this hotel was the outdoor pool. It's on the third level (the workout lounge overlooks the pool) so you have a great rooftop view of the city. My bf and I went everyday and it was always empty. I guess being so close to the beach, people would prefer to catch their rays laying on the sand...but if you want to avoid the noise and crowds of english bay - DEFINITELY take full advantage of the Westin pool. There's also a hot tub which was great on colder nights. All the great amenities Westin is famous for were all included...for example 'the heavenly bed' and our favourite 'the heavenly bath' which has two shower heads (one is turned off to save water, but you can turn it on if you want the full luxious experience). The staff at the hotel were very kind and helpful. Everyone seemed in good spirits and they were always looking out for the customers best interest. My bf and I loved the fact that there was a grocery store, a mini mart, and a liqour store conveniently located at the base of the hotel. Made getting last minute items very easy. Not to mention that being on Robson was fantastic. Don't listen to anyone who tells you that it's an 'unsafe area' to be in. It's really great, you are always just a short walk from everything you'd want to see and anywhere you'd want to be. I can't say enough good things about this hotel, definitely would have gladly paid more for it, but it's twice as nice that we got it at such a discount. I promise anyone who is swayed into staying at this hotel through reviews such as mine, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed.”
Reviews.Author: vegasprincess87
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit and I was not impressed with the staff that work here. I am 22 years old and it seemed as if they took advantage of that. We were told parking was free if you didn't use valet. Then was charged $20 for parking as we left. Not that much but we were not expecting it. The man working at the front desk talked down on us as we were checking out Since we had been charged $230 more then was quoted. This will be the last time I stay at a Westin Grand. For the price It was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Carmen1318
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during our trip to Vancouver for my mom's birthday. It's located very close to Robson street if you're a compulsive shopper. The lobby was kind of small and you had to take an elevator up 3 stories to get to it. But walking around downtown Vancouver, land is very scarce, so I'll let that one slide. The hotel is very close to Stanley Park. If you are taking a ferry to Victoria, stay elsewhere, because the drive from the hotel to the ferry is 45 mins. We found out the hard way and had to take a helicopter there (helipad was located in downtown). Room space was okay. The bedroom was actually separate from the living room, which made the rooms feel smaller than they actually were. But the plus is you get a TV in the bedroom and the living room. The bathroom had sufficient space and was elegant. You could actually open the bathroom door without hitting someone sitting on the toilet...haha. Paid $200/night for the rooms here. Considering the location, downtown Vancouver density, and the quality of the room, it was very good value. Booked it through travelocity.

Reviews.Title: “Odd room configuration but Westin quality abounds”
Reviews.Author: aek2009
Reviews.Content: We received a suite on the 10th floor. No view to speak of, and the rooms were filled with furniture. While overly complex, the amenities of the Westin were available. To be honest, we stayed because I have enough points for a free room. Usually a more adventurous traveler, I would not stay here again on vacation. But I don't say this to diminish the Westin brand - it's quality. The hotel is nicely located between Granville Island and Stanley Park. And there is no free wireless!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Luxury in the Heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: dawgfan1995
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Grand Vancouver over the US's Memorial Day Weekend. The hotel itself is located nearly in the middle of everything you should see in downtown Vancouver -- just north of Yaletown, just south of Gastown, just west of Chinatown, and a mile east of Stanley Park and English Bay Beach. The rooms are big suite set ups. Getting one of the 03 suites on the corner is recommended -- it is roomier, and the hotel upgraded me to one of these based on my status with Starwood. My room wasn't ready when I got to the hotel to check in, so the desk clerk "bought" me a drink at the bar while I waited for it to be ready. The service at the bar and restaurant was excellent and the staff were quite friendly -- offering excellent suggestions for restaurants each night of my stay. Even the room rate was reasonable -- only about $200 US each night. There is nothing bad I can say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A modern and luxurious hotel - but expensive if you are paying.”
Reviews.Author: jac2028
Reviews.Content: During the 4 nights that I stayed at this hotel I found it very comfortable and modern. The rooms are extremely comfortable and the staff were very attentive. These rooms are probably some of the nicest I've stayed in. They even have little kitchens in case you want to eat. The beds are unreal. If you're staying in Vancouver there are better locations, this is a little out of the way for the park and the heart of Robson- but close to Gastown, Chinatown and Yaletown. One of the coolest bars in the city is also right across the street (the club in the library- the Library). One bizarra thing did happen in my stay; one of the days while I was at work someone used my washroom (evidently a man who did not flush.... ). It was obviously hotel staff because I was the only one with access to the room. It's no big deal but was curious. I would recommend staying here for business as it's quite pricey. If you're paying stick with the Carmana Plaza which has many of the same luxuries (a slightly better location in my opinion) and a much cheaper pricetag.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet suite”
Reviews.Author: Todnick
Reviews.Content: As part of our tour of the Pacific Northwest, we stayed for five nights in Vancouver at the Westin Grand. We missed the entrance to the hotel to park our car and had to drive around for quite some time to get back. Many one-way streets, plus no left or right-hand turns during specific times of the day, coupled with extensive construction made an around the block ride into a five-minute ride. Once there, however, they came out pretty quickly to valet the car and get us up to the lobby. The hotel has 30 floors and two elevators; suffice it to say that you will have long waits during your stay. The lobby itself was unremarkable and small. I didn't find it all that inviting. We had a corner deluxe suite that felt more like a little apartment than a hotel room. We really liked it. There is a smallish bar / kitchen area behind double doors off the hallway upon entering. It had a small sink, microwave, dishwasher (if you can believe it), and mini-fridge. The refrigerator had items for purchase, but there was a little bit of room to put some food in. The living area had a couch, chair, TV/armoire unit, desk and chair with floor-to-ceiling windows. Off the living area was a small patio for lounging with a view of the city. The bedroom had a queen bed and TV/armoire unit. The room was pretty small. It would be nice if they upgraded to king beds, but I don't know that the bedroom would hold it. The bed itself was comfortable and the sofa in the livingroom was a pullout. The bathroom had separate sink and bathtub, vanity with plenty of storage space, nice toiletries and plenty of towels. The bathroom opened to both the bedroom and hallway making it very accessible and adding to the feel of an apartment vs a hotel room. All of the hotel staff were very pleasant to us, always saying hello or good evening whenever we met. The concierge (Lisa) is really good at her job. This woman knows Vancouver and can get you around quickly. We had many requests and all were answered to our satisfaction. She really adds to the hotel. Vancouver is a nice, clean city with a bit of a European feel. We really enjoyed it. There are tons and tons of restaurants. Every meal we had was good regardless of the price. In fact one of the least expensive meals we had was by far the best. We went to Granville Island and I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. If you want fresh produce, it's great; otherwise, I wasn't too impressed. They say it isn't touristy, but it is.... It's a great spot if you want to try local foods and eat your way through the market. We enjoyed Vancouver and would recommend the Westin for accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good suites with kids”
Reviews.Author: TravelWhereNext
Reviews.Content: The downtown location is fantastic. Right next to the gorgeous public library a bonus on rainy days. Lots of small restaurants nearby. The suites work well when travelling with kids. The outdoor pool is lovely, and the housekeeper was very helpful. The front desk staff is VERY pleasant although a little slow. The overpowering fragrance of the soap and bath products, and the parking situation (expensive) were two of the few complaints. A couple of lamps were broken otherwise very well maintained, and clean. The in-house restaurant not suitable for kids. The bathroom was a dream. The high price is the main detraction,and they charge for wireless access at those prices!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge was amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: native*texan*2005
Reviews.Content: We worked with Lisa in advance of our trip and again when we got there! It was raining and we rearranged some of the activities. She was spot on with her recommendations, suggestions and ideas. She was great and really helped to make our trip. The hotel was perfect. The location could not be better and we were quite happy with the value. Stanley Park is truly wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Experience at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: Rickety_Rick
Reviews.Content: Trouble free visit. Got a suite among the top floors, awesome view. Service was incredible. However, like all big city hotels, they DING you with all the extra fees... internet access in room was $14 for 24 hours. And the parking fees... yikes. Vancouver is a wonderful city, make sure you visit the Capilano suspension bridge. Take a walk around Lord Stanley Park...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Rosemarie7
Reviews.Content: After taking a short dip in the Westin Grand's tiny swimming pool, my husband came down with a severe ear infection, which has still not cleared up after two weeks and two different antibiotics. The doctor asked him if he had gone swimming in a swimming pool. I phoned the Westin Grand to warn them that their pool was most probably the source of his problem but the lady I talked to was having none of it. She suggested the cause was allergies (?!) although my husband has never had an ear infection in the 30+ years we've been together. During our stay, the staff were very nice, but one of the elevators was broken, causing long delays for people to get to their high-rise rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: atlhppwt
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the great service we experienced at check in, from the bellman and the front desk. My bags arrived at my room before I did and the bellman made sure I was familiar with and comfortable with the room. The front desk gave us a great booklet with discounts to many sightseeing destinations. From the all suite rooms (with two televisions!), to the dual showerhead, to the soaker tub and kitchenette, the room was very comfortable and exceeded my expectations. I was worried the Westin Grand might be a little off the beaten path, but it turned out to be the perfect location for everything we wanted to do: sightseeing, walking, shopping and dining out. It's on the "quiet" end of Robson St., away from the frenetic pace found in the shopping district. With Yaletown just a few blocks away, dining options were plentiful. We also had an easy stroll to the Aquabus ferry on False Creek for a ride over to Granville Island. I can't say enough about the Westin website and the specials that are offered. I found a half-price sale that allowed me to stay at a hotel way above my usual standard, making for a special trip.

Reviews.Title: “cant get more central than this”
Reviews.Author: renovatio
Reviews.Content: The name westin grand is true to its construction style, the entire hotel looks like a grand piano. located on robson street abt 30 mins from the airport and roughly the same from the pier (for those taking a cruise). one cant find a more central location than this. to the left of the hotel is all the eating,drinking,coffee places u want with a wide variety for veg as well as the non veg pallate and to the right is the shopping area. u can walk all the way to grabville island a must see and gast town, both tourist destinations. the hotel has huge spacious rooms, the service is impecible and the staff is very very helpfull. if ur in vancouver and not at the westing grand u have def missed something.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: moolie_loo
Reviews.Content: Check in time is at 3pm and when we arrived at 4:30pm, we had to wait a good 20 minutes before our room was ready. Actually, after 20 mins our room on the 26th floor was still not ready but the room on the 20th floor was. We down-graded 6 floors while still paying the same room rate because we were too tired to wait for another half an hour. After staying at many hotels, this was the first time I had to wait to check-in and even though the hotel manager and staff were curteous, this still does not make up for the fact that I had to wait for my $300 room. I find it unacceptable. One of the elevators was broken upon our arrival. We had to wait for a long time to make one trip up and down the elevator. The room itself was good but not exceptional since it was pricey. The location of the hotel was fantastic. Overall though, I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: Stephen442
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a treat on the penultimate night of a two-week holiday that involved constant transfers and several hotels. This was much much more expensive than all of the rest, but was probably the worst stay other than one dire budget motel in Ontario. The room was cramped and over-frilly. The prices charged for things like internet access and room service were obscene. The lifts were slow and poor quality. The service was peremptory. There was nothing at all that explained the high hotel rating - this is a three-star at best. It's not a bad hotel, it's just not good in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Class and Service”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryTamara
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Grand from May 15-21, 2009 for a girls get away. This is a very nice hotel situated in a great location. The location is close to Yaletown, shopping and sea wall. Next door is a IGA Garden market which is great place to grab a quick snack and there is a Starbucks on each corner. Close to nightlight life as well. Hotel is very clean, quiet and service was topshelf from the front desk to the doorman. The outdoor hot tub and pool were a great way to end the evening after a day of walking and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Nice Pool and Gym”
Reviews.Author: Nanci_Dru
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Grand for 2 nights. We found the location to be great. It was within walking distance of Gastown, Yaletown, Stanley Park, Granville Island, and great shopping. However, cabs were readily available outside the hotel and the staff was helpfulin getting us cabs when needed. The area is a city area with restaurants and shops. It seemed like a very safe area. The staff was friendly. Check-in and check-out were a breeze. The concierge, Lisa, was extraordinarily helpful and gave us maps, suggested things to do and restaurants, etc. The hotel also puts out a list of suggested restaurants. We ate at two and both were wonderful. The hotel itself was not as "grand" as I'd hoped, though it was clean. We used Starpoints for our stay, so we had a smaller room. We are gold members but did not get an upgrade, as we have at other Starwood hotels, even when using points. The room was nicely appointed with a "kitchenette" (closet) with dishwasher, microwave, small sink, and utensils. There was a mini-fridge that was stocked with the usual overpriced goodies. This was all helpful, but it would be difficult to actually cook. Perfect for warming up leftovers or microwave meals, though. There is an in-room coffeemaker with Starbucks. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. The bath was large, with stone sink and floor. There were plenty of towels and Westin white tea toiletries. There is a small business center, though the computer use is not free. The best part about the hotel was the gym and pool area. There was a nice outdoor pool and hot tub. Inside was a gym and sauna and steam rooms. We enjoyed these a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Palmsea
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand has the perfect location in Vancouver for walking, eating, sightseeing and shopping. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite with a beautiful view of the water. The hotel was extremely clean, and our room was spotless. We were greeted by a very friendly valet and bellman, who immediately helped us with our luggage and checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Central Vancouver downtown location for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: garfodie
Reviews.Content: Had more business in Vancouver, and stayed at the Westin Grand. It's a pleasant, modern property that is right on Robson Street, and an easy walk to the commercial office towers downtown. It's also close to the arts (beside the Vancouver Public Library, and a short walk away from the Queen Elizabeth Theatre and the Orpheum (for the symphony)). It is indeed next door to an IGA supermarket, and there are some decent restaurants nearby. Parking is a $21/nightly in-and-out charge, and there is reasonable supply, though the driving corridors are narrow. Stayed in an upper floor, in an ##08 room. This room was beside the stairwell and the ice machine. The ice machine is really loud, and was an annoying distraction at night. The room is a suite, pleasant but small, and this level of suite came with a dishwasher, a microwave, a toaster, various cutlery and tableware, and even a mixing bowl and cutting board. Though, since there wasn't a range-top or hotplate, it's unclear what this would be used for. (I guess you can make a lot of TV dinners.) The hotel only has two elevators, which is concerning when you're on an upper floor, and even more annoying when one is placed out of service. For a facility with nearly 30 floors, this is startling. Nonetheless, this is a fully satisfactory place to stay when visiting Vancouver. Its location is very good, and the quality of the rooms and service was solid.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with service, cleanliness, and Room #3003.”
Reviews.Author: hoohiki
Reviews.Content: The Westin was certainly grand when it came to service, cleanliness and the corner rooms in the executive suites, particularly rooms #3003 and #3009. We arrived in the middle of the night with 2 tired and hungry boys after a 6 hour flight from Maui, and Phil at the front desk was kind enough to quickly register us and find food for my boys. The bell boys were prompt and helped us with the ice, extra blankets and pillows, and turn down the sofa bed. The next day, we had a complimentary continental breakfast at the Aria restaurant within the hotel, which surprisingly consisted of a buffet of any breakfast food you wanted. It was lovely! After breakfast, we sought the concierge's help for things to do in Vancouver in one day, and Lisa who was knowlegable and resourceful advised us to see the Aquarium, Stanley Park and the Telus Science World. My kids had a wonderful time at these venues, thanks to Lisa's suggestions. She also arranged for us to take a shuttle to Whistler the next day. I also have to acknowledge, the bell man who pushed a luggage carrier filled with 12 bags, 2 blocks for us to meet the bus since it was unable to pick us up at the hotel. We stayed in a suite on the 30th floor. We had a corner room with floor to ceiling windows wrapping around so the view of the city and harbour was spectacular, especially at night with all the city lights. The room had a mini kitchenette, a living space, and a master bedroom. The bathroom was large with a separate bath and shower stall. Very clean and quite new! Upon our arrival, we also had complimentary fruits and water. Local calls were also free in the executive suites. The location in the middle of downtown was very convenient. A supermarket was right next door and restaurants and Starbuck's at very close proximity. All in all, we had a very pleasant stay, and if we were in Vancouver again, would not hesitate to choose the Westin Grand again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - experienced better and experienced much worse/ watch your bill!”
Reviews.Author: jfuller77
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets an OK. The room service food was great. Really great, fresh but also pricey so you wouldn't have expected anything less. The room was ok - clean enough but looked pretty tired and in need of some freshening up. The kitchen was really handy ( we had our two kids with us) and we were easily able to prepare some quick breakfast and bottles. The service was pretty good although when we questioned our bill upon check out we were questioned right back which was very rude in my opinion. There were some local calls charged to our bill which we never made (used our cell phones to make calls) and they also charged us for wireless Internet that never worked the first night we were there. They admitted that they were having problems. The pool is outside so not really the greatest during rainy spring in Vancouver. All in all it was just an OK stay. We've stayed at alot of other hotels in the City and this one is middle of the road.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: ciphertext
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand is a very good choice for a centralised location in downtown Vancouver. It's situated right beside the Vancouver library and Yaletown and is within short walking distance to the main shopping and eating areas. An IGA is also conveniently located right by the hotel. I had a mini 1 bdrm suite that came with a tiny cooking area (sink, microwave, dishwasher) which was a pleasant surprise. Service was good and the room was very clean. Also there was a good, decent sized gym available.

Reviews.Title: “great suites”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous place. Very spacious living room and nice bedroom and bathroom. Included microwave, sink, dishes, toaster silverware and tea towels -- so great place if you are staying a few days. Decor was very nice. Very clean and staff were very nice. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellingcutie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel this past weekend, as part of a brief getaway for our anniversary. We arrived via car and parked in the self-park lot under the hotel. The cost for that is $21, and does include in and out privileges. Check-in was easy, and when we mentioned conversationally to the front desk person that we were celebrating our anniversary, she upgraded our room, even though she had just finished checking us in to a different room! We were placed in a balcony suite on the corner of the building, which had a nice view of the city. The sitting room and bedroom were nicely decorated, and the bathroom was large and lovely. The suite (as with all suites in the hotel, I believe) had a handy little kitchenette area, which included a minibar, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, dishwasher, several drawers of utensils, and shelves with cups, plates and wine glasses. The hotel is in a good location, within walking distance of several interesting areas of Vancouver, including Gastown and Yaletown. There are tons of restaurants and coffee shops in the area, as well as plenty of other shopping, including a huge underground mall just a few blocks away. There is also a full-sized grocery store next door to the hotel. We were pleasantly surprised to find a plate of chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us in our room upon our return from exploring! Check out was also easy, and the person working at the desk made sure to ask if we had had a nice anniversary celebration. I was very impressed by the service at this hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, Upgraded room good size/quite adequate”
Reviews.Author: sharem57
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a small footprint. Small lobby area. Clean and well maintained other then the glitch with the sometimes on elevator. The worst when you have to wait endlessly when one of the 'vators are not running. I was upgraded to a larger room, mini suite, actually. The room was nice. clean. The WESTIN bed was very clean crisp and comfortable. One problem wiht the hotle is that taxis are in sort supply and when they call for one you do have to wait abit. Dont know if this is typical of all hotels in Vancouver. Overall it was a good stay but nothing stood out.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: sleepygirlsf
Reviews.Content: We had excellent service at this hotel and it's our second time staying there. It's been consistently good and we will definitely be back. Our go-to choice of places to stay since it's close to everything you need. It's in walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. Not in any particular district but within blocks of Yaletown and Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “The Luxury”
Reviews.Author: goodreviews1
Reviews.Content: It was a magnificent hotel and we stayed at a wonderful room on a wonderful level and it was very cheap for the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - can't fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mungo57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 3 nights in September - overall we were really happy with the standard of the room, the helpfulness of the staff and the hotel location. It is situated at the quieter end of Robson Street but only 10mins walk from the action. We had booked a "superior one bed suite" and it was lovely - nice bed, great bathroom, mini kitchen etc. If there was one tiny gripe it is that unless you had a laptop for free wireless, the internet in the lobby was waaaay over priced. However, the gym was the best hotel gym I've been in and there was a great pool and jacuzzi - excellent for relaxing after being out and about in Vancouver! If we go back to Vancouver (which I hope we will..) I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of anything bad to say about this place.”
Reviews.Author: JonnySLondon
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and efficient. The room was clean and in good condition. The location is great for central Vancouver. But for some reason that I can't quite put my finger on, it just wasn't a very memorable stay. I think that is because you can get from your room to the street outside without going past reception, so you don't "feel" like you are in a hotel. Our stay was perfectly satisfactory however and I wouldn't hesitate to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Loved the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: cosette13
Reviews.Content: I grabbed a great hotwire rate of $119 on this hotel. We were put in a corner suite. We had one room with a bed/tv and another living room area with a pull out sofa/tv/desk. There was a kitchenette with toaster, microwave, fridge, sink, dishwasher and place settings for 3, plus other cooking essentials. The bathroom is huge, with a beautiful shower with double head (and great water pressure) and large soaker tub. We had a nice balcony overlooking the library. Great view. Internet is pricey at 14.99 plus taxes for 24 hours. If I went out onto the balcony I could get signals from other places, but as soon as I was inside the only thing I could pick up was the Westin's own wireless. Since it was too chilly to sit outside, I paid the $ for internet. Quite a ripoff actually. Room service is very pricey, but expected for a 4* Vancouver hotel. Pool and hottub are outside and open in the winter. The pool was too chilly to swim in, but the hottub was nice. Fun to sit outside in the cold dark air and hot tub. There is also a nice workout room. Steam room and sauna as well. We had a very quiet and comfortable stay. I used valet to park the car ($25/night to valet or $21 to self park). When my car was brought out the next day it had been washed, which was a nice touch. Very safe hotel, very quiet and didn't hear a peep from other rooms or the hallway. The only thing we didn't like, was the sofabed was extremely uncomfortable. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, but would ask for a regular room with 2 heavenly beds, not 1 bed and a sofa bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel convenient location”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkSpinone
Reviews.Content: We arrived tired from our 10 hour flight from the UK booking in was speedy & efficient. 1st impression of the concierge & bell station was how small, then we found more space upstairs at reception. Our queen suite was quite small but more that adequate for our stay and the bed was very comfortable. The instructions for the shower had worn off and we had to phone down as it was not like any other we had encountered. The response was Oh a lot of people have trouble with that. So why not fix it and put out new guidance? The cold breakfast buffet was absolutely fabulous and could not be faulted in any way. When we called for a bell boy to bring our luggage down we we told be with you in a couple of minutes. 10 minutes later we staggered down under our own steam as we needed to get our car and get to the ferry. They lost our request.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: narrell
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our Three nights stay here, the rooms are very clean, modern and comfortable.The staff were very helpful with all enquiries and requests. There was a minor mishap with a burst water pipe while we were there which ended in some minor water damage to the carpet in our room, but the staff were onto it straight away and not only moved us to another room, but also upgraded us. The problem was fixed with no upsets. This hotel is close to shops,restaurants,the airport and the Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, if somewhat cramped.”
Reviews.Author: joejoejoejoejoe
Reviews.Content: Solid hotel with amazing views if you ask for a good room. The staff was very polite and when I asked for a new room I was upgraded the following day; the hotel was full that night. The view of Mt. Baker and the city skyline was amazing. The hotel has a very claustrophobic feel to it. The hallways are narrow, the lobby is small and the carport is positively the smallest of any Westin I have ever patronized.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the other Westins”
Reviews.Author: Ellenlg
Reviews.Content: We had booked the hotel over 8 months before the cruise. when the rooms were booked, we had asked that they be close together, no problem, breakfast was suppose to be included. When we got to the hotel, the price was different from the one quoted, the rooms were not even on the same floor,breakfast was not included and cost about 20. per person.the other family traveling with us was told that they had to change rooms at 10:30 pm on the second night, due to some type of water problem, they came up handed them the new cards, and left. they had to pack up all the suitcases, etc and move them, with no help, and were still charged the full amount. We will never stay their again

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: logcolb
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand is an absolutely terrific place to stay in Vancouver. We travel a lot and stay in a wide range of hotels and this hotel is near the top of the list. The location is very central in Vancouver and an easy walk to just about anywhere. The hotel is fairly new and has some of the best rooms I have seen in a while. They are all set up as suites and are all different, due to the configuration of the building. We opted for a corner room, which is well worth the small additional charge. The corner room has windows that wrap around on the side, so the rooms are very bright and airy, and it had a small balcony, which I do not believe many of the other rooms have. Probably one of the nicest bathrooms I have seen for a while with separate glass shower and tub. The rooms are very tastefully done and have an excellent wet bar with microwave and fridge. The overall feel is of a very comfortable, but small, one bedroom apartment. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If you want something nicer and more comfortable and tasteful than your normal hotel room, this is a terrific place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A solid good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LynnBert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 3 days. We stayed at a corner one bedroom suite on the 19th floor. We had a very nice city view. I enjoyed looking at the city skylight every night by opening up all the curtains, it was incredible. The staff here are very courteous and helpful. The bedroom and living room are on the small side. The furniture including the bed and the sofa bed are in excellent condition and very comfortable. It is nice to have a small refrigerator and microwave. The nicest part of the suite is the bathroom, it was big and nicely appointed with granite counter and tiled shower. The shower has two heads! What a luxury for someone coming from a very dry part of the country! Although it is on the edge of the center of downtown, the neighborhood where the hotel is in is not bad at all. Vancouver is a big city, there are always people walking on the street any time of the day. I never felt unsafe. Center of downtown and major shopping is only a few blocks away and the walk is quite pleasant. There are many eateries within couple of blocks of the hotel. Most of them offer entrees in the $7 to $10 range. I was surprised to see many Japanese fast food restaurants. The best part of Vancouver for me is Granville Island, especially the Public Market. We took the water taxi to get back to the hotel in drizzling rain, I think this must be quite typical of Vancouver, even in the middle of summer.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: A3Queen
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood Gold member.. and really try to stay at Starwood properties. This Westin needs updating BAD! Lobby and other public areas were very nice. Location was good (although in hindsight I wish i would've chosen their other property on the water near the park). We had many problems with the rooms (one smelled like urine, another electricity and air didn't work etc). Thankfully the staff worked very hard to make us happy and comfortable and gave us a great upgrade for the last 2 nights and many extras. The conceirge Lisa was very helpful as well. Staff get marks for excellence.. hotel itself needs an upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Hick-ups in the machinery...”
Reviews.Author: French
Reviews.Content: The hotel enjoys a good location in downtown Vancouver. Valet parking and concierge services were efficient and smiling. The reception desk however seemed to be staffed with very young/unexperienced personnel. Both (DeLuxe) suites allocated were OK (we had booked two) although I found them a bit small considering the 450 sq ft advertised. It looked more like a 350 sq. ft. suite... We had a (last minute) third person with us, and her bed was prepared on our request (plus they did not charge any supplement). Our hotel package included breakfast and sparkling wine/strawberries. The first (half bottle of) wine came just after our arrival, but we had to wait (after many phone calls) for the second one to arrive just around 9 PM.... Then we decided to go for dinner at the hotel restaurant, just to hear from the Night Manager that restaurant was closed (it was 9.30 PM!). For a hotel in such a large city as Vancouver is, it was rather surprising... After some discussions... the Manager on duty offered to give us cab vouchers to go to another place, but we finally stayed at their Lounge which offered a decent but smaller menu. To make up for the inconveniences, the Manager also offered dessert "on the house"! A good commercial gesture!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandCarters
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. It was excellent in every way. We had a suite on the 7th floor that overlooked the city. Everything you could possibly want was in our room. The kitchen area was well equipped and with a small supermarket being a block away it was great to just do whatever you wanted.The standard of cleanliness was outstanding and every little detail was thought of. There was a wide choice at breakfast and the staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is very centrally located so you can walk to Gastown,Yaletown,Canada Place, and you are right on Robson Street which is one of the main thoroughfares. We would definately reccomend this hotel you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Three Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: okop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Grand for business over a three day period. Worked out great as I am a usual SPG member so enjoyed staying at this Starwood Property. Hotel is situated in an excellent area downtown Vancouver. I was told I received an upgrade on arrival being a Plat member but not sure what it would be as all rooms are suites anyways. The only thing I noticed was that I had a small balcony that most other rooms did not. I think only two rooms on each floor will have a small balcony. Meeting rooms were good and customer service was also very good ........no complaints on this end. Room was plenty big enough with seperate sleeping area and very nice / large bathroom with seperate shower. As usual Heavenly Bed was just that........had excellent sleeps. All in all the Westin Grand was an excellent choice and would not hesitate to stay here again not only for its very comfortable rooms but also excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “great 7-day stay”
Reviews.Author: collegemom998
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 7-day stay at the Westin Grand. Had a fabulous experience. As another reviewer recently stated, I can't think of a more convenient location downtown. Cab fare was $30 from the airport and a quick ride. Hotel got our room ready quickly. The room was great for us with a 15- and 18-year old. Loved the kitchenette for snacks and such. Used the grocery store next door every day for bottled water, fresh fruit, etc. Rented a Budget car for two days around the corner from the hotel. All the staff gave great recommendations for restaurants and great directions. Everyone was polite and courteous. Didn't use the restaurant, but did use wireless internet in the room a couple different days. Worked great. Self parking was $21 a day and very smooth, except be warned that the main gate getting in and out doesn't open until 7:00 am. Had to retrieve someone to open it for us. Housekeeping was responsive to our request for extra towels and paper products and kept us well stocked the entire time. Go back in a flash. Loved Vancouver and the Westin Grand!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel,Great location”
Reviews.Author: xyza
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 3 nights prior to an Alaskan cruise. Check-in went very smooth,despite a complaining customer next to me. Not the hotels fault,nothing would have pleased this person! Room was in excellent shape,beautiful view of downtown. Loved the shower and Westin's heavenly bed!! There is a lot of construction downtown prior to the Olympics, but we did not notice any noise. I selected this hotel mainly for location,and frankly I don't think you could get a more centrally located hotel. We walked to Gastown, Chinatown, Yaletown and used transit for Stanley Park and Granville Island. The staff were very friendly and helpful,suggesting restaurants nearby and help getting around. We did not notice any of the delays with the elevators as others have said. We loved Vancouver, and on our next trip (which I hope is soon) we will definitely stay at the Westin again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with exceptional concierge”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelerDC
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a typical Westin property, only instead of simple box rooms, it had these odd-shaped suites shaped. It was a 100 unit condo building that Westin converted into 200 suites. They are comfortable and have great views of the mountains and Vancouver. The challenge for the hotel is that there are over 30 floors and only 2 elevators. The day that we left only one was working, and that wasn't pretty. The concierge Lisa makes the stay in Vancouver great by truly knowing the city and tailoring your experience in Vancouver to exactly what you are looking for. I highly recommend a visit with her upon arrival for exploring the city and local fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: honestreviewer50
Reviews.Content: Very Good hotel with excellent suites. A good place to stay after a long flight - room quiet. Cruise ships are nearby Beds Comfortable - room furnishings of a high standard Excellent buffet breakfast Local to good shops and restaurants Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: kinwafu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin Grand in Vancouver as the last weekend of a 4-week tour of BC and Washington State. We are a family of 4 - two boys age 11 + 12 plus Mum + Dad. We booked one of the corner suites which had ample accommodation for us all plus a great (and huge) bathroom. The kitchenette was most useful for doing breakfast in room and the microwave for the popcorn! Don't think I've ever stayed in a hotel room with its own dishwasher before. The outdoor pool is a bit on the small side. They happily provided extra towels, pillows and a kettle. When we had a bit of a scare over the airline we were flying back with going on strike they gave us free access to the Internet to sort it out and waived the phone charges as we tried to find out what was happening. Luckily all went well in the end but the hotel must be praised for their pro-active help when we were worried. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a superb location!”
Reviews.Author: JoshThePilot
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand Vancouver is located in the prime tourist area of Vancouver's Robson Street area. It is an easy 20 minute car ride from the airport, which should not cost more than $30 (Canadian $). When we stayed at the Westin we had a rental car but the location is easily accessible to TransLink buses. Parking is $21 per night and valet is $24 per night. Each time we requested our car it was brought up promptly. The hotel has 31 floors with all of them being classified as suites. Our room did not have a 2nd room but did include a small wall unit with dishwasher, toaster, microwave and cooking/eating utensils. This is very helpful for people who wish to make their own food in the room. The top floors (30th and 31st) are home to the executive suite rooms and are only accessible to guests saying on those two floors. The guest rooms are only accessible by two high speed elevators. Although the elevators move fast, the amount of people coming and going (especially during peak hours) means you will be waiting upwards of 5 minutes or more for an elevator. To access the guest floors (2 to 29) you must use your keycard to unlock the floor buttons. This feature offers security and keeps unwanted persons off the guest room floors. On the third floor there is a “WESTINworkout” room (fitness center) with treadmills, stair climbers, free weights and several multi-exercise machines. There is a unisex sauna off to the side of the gym. Both the men’s and women’s washrooms have steam-rooms. Access to the outdoor lap-pool and whirlpool is also through the gym. During our 5 night stay, we found the hotel to be excellent with very attentive service. One thing that I was not satisfied with was the lack of a free high-speed internet connection. In room internet access was available for $14.99 for 24 hours. Considering that most hotels (even lower priced ones) off nower it, surely a Westin property that charges over $200 per night should at least have free access somewhere in the hotel. Even the business centre requires guests to pay to use it. I recommend the Westin Grand Vancouver hotel for travelers looking for an upscale experience who do not mind paying the extra price for it. If you have a CAA/AAA (Automobile Association) or government ID, rates can be slightly cheaper. There are also packages available that include breakfast, champagne & roses or aromatherapy packages.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Westin Grand”
Reviews.Author: Nik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Grand for four nights at the beginning of July and were pleased we had chosen this hotel. It has a great location and we found most of the staff very pleasant and helpful. We had a room on the 11th floor which had a separate bedroom, lounge with kitchenette facilities and spacious bathroom. There is currently some construction going on opposite the hotel but as we were out for most of the day we were not affected by this. Yes, there can be some traffic noise, but this hotel is in the heart of the city - its expected! We did encounter one problem during our stay. We had pre-paid for four nights through our travel agent. But it would appear that an error had been made by the hotel reservation staff as when we returned to the hotel in the evening on the last day of our stay our room key had been de-activated and we were unable to access the lift or get into our rooms. Our friends found that their room had not been made up either. The situation was quickly resolved once we were able to provide the reception manager with confirmation of our pre-payment for four nights. However, she did not apologise for the error or inconvenience. When we went out of the hotel that evening for dinner we confirmed with reception that the matter had been completely resolved and received an apology from the desk clerk, the Reception Manager being nowhere to be seen, However we did feel that she should have apologised immediately she saw that the error was on the part of the hotel and not us. Nonetheless, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and loved Vancouver. Too busy visiting Granville Island, Stanley Park, Gastown, Grouse Mountain, Capilano, sightseeing and shopping to use many of the facilities at the hotel, but the pool did look nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KPTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin Grand for 4 nights while visiting Vancouver in June '08. The deluxe corner suite is fantastic with kitchenette, living room, and separate bedroom. Bathroom is finished with tile and granite everything. Can't beat the Westin heavenly shower! The hotel is fairly pricey, but you get what you pay for. The rooms are well kept and extremely clean. The bed was more comfortable than at home. The lobby and common areas are beautiful. Underground parking was easily accessed, and the location directly on Robson street was great. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great location”
Reviews.Author: krazygloo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on 2 occasions over Dec and January, and both times were a very pleasant stay. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The first room we had was on a lower floor and didn’t have much of a view, but when we returned after our touring, we upgraded to a larger suite, which was much more spacious and on a higher floor. The suite had a large tub and separate lounge area. We got an internet rate on the first booking of $215 CAD which was prepay for 8 nights. The second room we stayed for 3 nights and it included internet and was a bit more a night. The property was very easy to access, and from living in Vancouver 5 years ago we knew that it was in a great location. The bonus is that there is grocery store right down stairs, and you have all the facilities to make your own breakfast. This hotel is also very close to Pacific centre, Granville and Robson Streets, the perfect location. Parking is Valet, most of the time they were good, unloading the bags, and helping. There were only a few times where they were very busy that it was a bit slow bringing the car around. Front desk staff was friendly, and once we had our key deactivated, and they fixed that no problem. We chose this hotel for the gym facilities, these were fantastic. Over all I would come back to this hotel due to all of the above. But most of all the price is very good for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: littlereddevilag
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a good location. We booked 14 nights in an executive suite on the 31st floor. It was a good size but the bed was a bit narrow and the curtains let the sunlight in all around the sides and top. We didn't have a separate bath and shower as others have said.There is a building site right next door which works from 7am til 7pm except sunday. There is also a lot of traffic noise especially as there is a fire/rescue depot around the corner whose vehicles wake you up at all hours of the night. They tried to charge us for 2 sodas from the mini bar which we didn't drink. The pool and area was too small to bother with. The restaurant staff are second to none but the restaurant is open plan with the lobby and reception which is strange and quite noisy sometimes. Also people tend to wander in on their way past and help themselves to fruit etc from the buffet ! The buffet was ok same everyday but all fruit,bread and pastries are uncovered and were usually covered in small black flies. We avoided them after a couple of days. Our breakfast was included but I wouldn't pay extra for it. Had a great time in Vancouver though.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Westin Grand”
Reviews.Author: Cyress
Reviews.Content: I spent five days at this fine hotel. I picked this hotel because of its central location and reputation as a great hotel. It was an easy walk to Canada Day activities, Yaletown, theater, city library, etc. The staff did a fine job getting me into my room. The entire hotel staff from check-in to concierge to restaurant staff (hats off to Barry and Oliver) were pleasant and professional in handling my requests. My 16th floor suite and bathroom was comfortable, modern, spacious, quiet, and secure. The bed was most comfortable; I slept soundly. I loved the daily selection of Canadian papers with my buffet breakfast as well as the Wall Street Journal The fitness and outdoor pool areas were also a pleasant surprise although new construction was on-going and quite visible and noisy across the street. Earlier in my stay, the elevators were suprisingly quick, however, during the latter part of my stay, the wait time for an elevator to my room took over five minutes on several occasions. During my trip, I visited several of the other fine downtown hotels, but I'm glad I chose the Westin Grand. The streets are safe to walk and I enjoyed the buzz of this beautiful city, its small stores/shops, and its wonderfully diverse population and creative types. The price neared $300 US dollars per night, but it was worth it. If I come to Vancouver again, I'll once again visit the Grand Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, standard Westin Grand experience”
Reviews.Author: sheraprincessofpowa
Reviews.Content: Great location on Robson Street - close to Yaletown (the trendy part of Vancouver), and very close to Robson Street shopping. Budget rental car is around the corner, which is great if you want to rent for a day trip! There's a Starbucks across the street and a grocery store next door. The great thing about this hotel is that every room is a suite, so each room has a separate living room. Very expansive, all room have nice layouts. I was in my room for about 20 minutes when the heating broke, so they ushered me to the next room...and in that room there were short and curlies on my towel. I was very angry and management took notice and corrected the problem. The manager on duty came and ushered me to their high end suite on a top floor, comped me internet for my stay and breakfast the next day. The difference between an elite hotel and the rest is how problems are handled by management. Since I was there for 6 nights, I was provided a fridge free of charge. The standard Westin amenities - heavenly bed, Westin workout, etc. were in fine form. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Grand: Comfortable, Clean, Walkable”
Reviews.Author: pachelad
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend in Vancouver at the Westin Grand. We used Starwood points to stay, and the visit was very nice. The hotel is setup as though it may have been an old condo building long ago. The lobby is on the second (above street level) floor. The lobby is a very small floor that contains the check-in desk, restaurant and elevators. There just over 30 floors at the Westin; each floor contains about 8-10 suites. Our suite (#1107) was a very comfortable corner one-bedroom. We had a nice view of the library and a few other buildings. In general, views in Vancouver can be hard to come-by because of the number of high-rises in the city. The room had a very nice bathroom with separate shower and sunken tub. There was a small area for the kitchenette behind closed cabinets. I don't think that it would be suitable to prepare a true meal, but it was fine for snack and drinks preparation. The bedroom was small, but the living area was nice and spacious. The location was great. It was very close to all the dining/lounge options in Yaletown. It was about 7 blocks to the shopping district on Robson Street, but there was plenty to see along the way as well. Cabs are plentiful and relatively cheap by US standards. The valet parking is $25 CAD per day. The 3rd floor contains a fitness center with a nice view. It's smaller, but it faces the outside deck that houses the pool and hot-tub. There is a steam room in each locker room as well as a shared sauna. There were no extra charges to use these facilities. The only real negative to this hotel is that only two elevators serve the entire building. So, it can be a wait to get to your floor or lobby during peak times. We only had to wait in a line once. At most times, the wait seemed comparable to any other elevator wait. This hotel hosts a number of passengers who have either arrived or will depart on an Alaskan Cruise. This is typical in Vancouver (or Seattle) during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: belmondo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia (via Tripadvisor) and was extremely impressed with the attentive service from staff throughout the hotel. They would smile and greet us and those who had dealt with us would acknowledge us by name. We arrived very early from our Alaskan cruise so left our bags at checkin and on our return, Andrew, who checked us in had left a message on our phone to check that we had received our bags and that the room was to our satisfaction and to call him should we need anything. Our room had a separate lounge and a small kitchen with microwave. The bed was very comfortable and the apartment had top quality fittings and a magnificent view. The hotel is on Robson Street and therefore very central. Both concierge staff we dealt with were able to answer in detail any questions we asked them of the area and were again exceptionally friendly. A lovely hotel in which to finish our holiday after the cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up To Its Reputation”
Reviews.Author: MRH-TMS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Westin from 10 to 14 May as we had a four day stopover in Vancouver before boarding a cruise through Alaska's Inside Passage. We were both impressed with the service, efficiency, rooms, amenities and decor in the hotel and all staff we came into contact with were polite and helpful, especially the restaurant and consierge staff. Check in was a hassle free and checkout was even easier. Our room was a good size with good size bathroom, clean and the bed very comfortable. Location on Robson street was also handy with everywhere in the Vancouver CBD being within easy walking distance. We took taxi's to both Granville Island and the cruise ship terminal and both times this was quick and not very expensive. We will return to Vancouver one day (as four days was simply not enough) and we would definately stay at the Westin Grand again.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: soxgal78
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Westin for three nights as part of a trip to Seattle and Vancouver. Overall, it's a really nice hotel -- even in a small suite, we had plenty of room for two people. The heavenly bed invited sleep, and the room darkening shades were a big help when the sun was rising by 5 a.m.! As others have said, the hotel is in a great spot -- very convenient to Robson Street shopping, Yaletown, etc. It was probably a 20-25 minute walk to Stanley Park -- maybe too long if you're walking with kids but otherwise very doable. A couple of negatives: generally the staff (especially the bellmen and the concierge) were very helpful. However....I felt like the front desk tried to "upsell" us when we were checking in. The room we'd reserved through the Internet-only, prepaid (read: "cheaper") rate wasn't ready yet (it was 30 minutes before official check-in, so no problem there), and they tried to get us to upgrade for $30 more a night to a bigger suite. A small thing, yes, but it just rubbed me the wrong way. And it might have been our end of the hotel, but I did feel like it was pretty loud, both room to room and from the outside construction noise, of which there's a lot. None of that would keep me from staying at the Westin again, though -- the location was great, and we did get a good deal on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: louwa
Reviews.Content: Check in was great, fast and very friendly. Got a nice room on the 31 floor - what a view!! Nice comfy beds, hide-away kitchen and a good size bathroom with an awesome shower. Breakfast was great...the service in the restaurant was absolutely fantastic - thanks guys you do an awesome job!! Hotel is very well situated, near to the skytrain, shopping, restaurants, etc. The only problem we had - theres only 2 elevators for the entire hotel and sometimes it ends up being a waiting game. But overall - it made our stay in Vancouver great and we will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: tommytyker
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel to be in an excellent location for anyone visiting down-town Vancouver. Close to Yaletown, Chinatown, Gastown, Skyrail, Harbour Centre Tower etc. Word to the wise: Go careful when walking to Chinatown. It's in a rough area. Ok during the day, but not at night. I did not feel threatened. The suite was small. But that's to be expected considering the hotel's location in the downtown area. It contained a seperate living area complete with small kitched built into a closet space. The bed was super comfortable. Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Other reviewers mentioned building going on in the area. This is true. My 7th floor suite faced one such tower being constructed. No detectable noise was heard during my stay... and I did see the crane moving frequently. I am guessing a little later in the year as the structure grows up, more noise will be heard. Now the bad. The hotel has 30+ floors with up to 9 suites per floor. There are only two elevators serving the entire hotel. Wait times to get to the lobby, especially during check in/out time can be horrendous. I had to wait 10 minutes on one occasion. Several occasions found me waiting more than 5 minutes. Go to a Blenz coffee shop if you need internet access. For the price of a cup of joe you get free web surfing. Or spend $15+tax for 24 hours of internet at the hotel. Unless you use the Business Center. Then it is a $3 min charge or 25 cents per minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: wilytraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the last leg of a visit to Canada summer 07. Booked Executive Deluxe Suite which was exellent with great views from the 30th floor. Good size with seperate living area. Hotel is centrally located in Vancouver which is useful and has on-site parking. Leisure facilitates were good, although we didn't use them much. Downsides: - Only two lifts and being on the top floor meant you might have to wait a while! - By booking the executive suite you get breakfast included - but unfortunately we noticed flies near the buffet which meant we avoided the pastries! - Internet access is extra if you use the business centre - and more annoying was that it was run by an external company!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotek, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Skamusic1975
Reviews.Content: I took a cab from YVR to the Westin Grand at around 11:45pm on 4/11. The cabride over took about 20 minutes and cost $25 CAD + tip. You arrive at the belldesk area which requires you to actually take the elevator up one floor to the actual check-in desk. Check-in was an absolute breeze - very friendly staff, recognized my Gold status and gave me a complmentary upgrade to room 2700 - a 1-king bedroom deluxe suite with a view of False Creek and the B.C. Center. Great nighttime view in my opinion! The suite was small, but was one of the best Westin properties I have ever stayed at. The living room included floor-to-cieling windows as did the bedroom which were seperated by a very small hallway and doors. The bathroom had a DEEP soaking tub and a seperate walk in shower. The suite was nicely furnished -very modern & comfortable. The kitchenette was hidden away by what seemed to be tall cabinet doors. They opened up to reveal the sink, dishwasher, toaster, microwave, flatware & tableware, and coffee maker. Very impressive and an excellent use of space. The room service staff was wonderuful and genuinely friendly. The food was delicious. Even the burger & fries were to die for - perfectly cooked & purposefully seasoned - just great. The staff were all very hepful - I can't say enough about how responsive they were to an air conditioning issue that I had which was resolved very quickly end effeciently. Great service. The location is wonderful - right at the edge of Yaletown. One should be warned, however; that there are many construction projects going on (for the 2010 Olympics?) which includes two specific build sites adjacent to the Westin. The weekend was quiet as construction was halted, however; Monday morning we could hear and see jackhammers, cranes, dumptrucks, and backhoes working from fairly early in the morning until the evening. From my Suite 2700, the noise wasn't so terrible, but those staying on the lower floors might beg to differ. Vancouver is a small city (compared to my home Los Angeles) and is quite easy to get around on foot, by bus, cab, or ferry. The hotel is on the edge of Yaletown and I really did not have any concerns for my safety at all whilst I was walking in the area at all times. The only time I felt semi-uneasy was when I was walking near Chinatown at night which really isn't in the best neighborhood, but still it's about a 15 minute walk northeast of the Westin. I would definately recommend this hotel to couples looking for a classy, yet understated Westin with very modern but never tacky decor. I just loved it and will definately return next time I am in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Halfway between "meh" and "good"”
Reviews.Author: alranson
Reviews.Content: I chose two hotels in Vancouver, at pretty much the same rate on Expedia: the Sutton Place for my trip out, and then the Westin Grand on my way back. The Sutton Place won the contest hands down, even though I had a standard room there and a so called "deluxe suite" at the Westin. The Westin Grand is tall, new, and oddly shaped. The lobby is not on the ground floor, resulting in a rather unimposing street entrance that one could easily miss. I entered round the side where the cheerful and friendly valet parking ($20 + tax a day for hotel guests) and bell boys hang out. The lobby is accessed by a fairly long flight of stairs up, which are a bit knackering after a day trudging round the city, although there are elevators further into the building. The lobby itself is sort of like a modern gentleman's club only with no seating: just some rounded off corners, dark wood, a bit of marble, a bit minimalist. There's a restaurant/bar (Aria) on that level which had an interesting looking menu but there was noone in it. Check in, yes, again, it was OK but not awesome, as the Canadians like to say. Efficient but not over friendly. My room, an end "deluxe corner" suite on the tenth floor, was very weirdly shaped and I still can't decide what made it deluxe exactly (given all the rooms at the Westin are meant to be suites). There was a tiny entrance area with a closet and a tiny kitchenette consisting of a toaster, a microwave, a dishwasher and the ubiquitous minibar fridge. There was also a small ration of free Starbucks coffee and some paper Starbucks cups. Then there was the sitting room, which had a sofa/pull out bed, a desk, and a TV. The TV however was located opposite a blank wall, not the sofa. We thought that was extremely weird and uncomfortable, but later realised the room was so narrow that there wouldn't be space to pull out the sofa bed if the sofa faced the TV.... The bedroom... on the small side, not much space to move around. The queen sized bed was comfortable and had nice Westin linens. The TV had that very annoying thing where every time you turn it on you have to go through a promotional hotel rigmarole where they tell you about the bed you're sleeping on and all the movies they want to sell to you, before you are able to just tune in to plain normal telly. Also I noticed there was no CD player or DVD player: not even the clock radio could play CDs. Given how cheap these items are these days, I think four and five star hotel rooms should have them as standard (the Sutton Place does....) Wireless internet: all their hotel rooms have it, and it is a reasonably quick speed, but they make you pay $14.99 plus tax per 24 hours. If you want to surf, I recommend any Blenz coffee shop - there's one on every corner virtually - where wireless is completely free. Bathroom: connected to the entrance area and to the bedroom which is nice if you have a someone using the pull out bed in the living area. It was a little poorly lit but quite nice, with an unusually big deep bathtub for North America, and plenty of big towels, but the shower took some figuring out. Amenities - just Westin label shampoo, conditioner, soap which were not replenished- were OK, nothing special. But big plus point: there was a proper detachable hairdryer, not one of those awful tiny things chained to the wall that you all too often find. What else? I didn't use the pool or fitness room facility on the third floor although I did look at it. The fitness room was on the small side, accessed via a room key. Not many weight machines but the treadmills all did have personal TV screens which was neat. The (absolutely tiny) pool and hot tub were outdoor ( a bit alarming for Vancouver...) surrounded by grey concrete and some sad looking planters although there was promising looking steam coming off both in a very un-environmentally friendly way. The hotel offers a limited menu of "spa" services in a small locked treatment room, but for the prices they charge I would advise visiting another hotel with a proper spa facility (eg the Sutton Place or the Fairmont) if you are in the market for that sort of thing. Airport pickups: the Vancouver airport shuttle service does not drop off or pick up at this hotel. Instead you need to walk two blocks away to another hotel - or get a cab, which is about the same cost if there's two of you. Service Sub par. Bellhops aside (they are the best thing about this place) I thought the service was not great. Having been told that all we needed to do to set up the pull out bed was to ring the instant express service button (otherwise known as front desk, I suspect) to ask someone to come, whatever the hour, we did so at 11pm. At 11.45pm, we were still waiting. At 11.50pm I rang again. "Someone will be right up, madam." At midnight, someone arrived, but without any pillows or blankets, two essentials which were missing from the room which I'd specifically asked for on the phone. Example two. We asked the concierge for a sushi recommendation. She sent us somewhere twenty five minutes walk away, and when we got there it wasn't even open. Example three. My final bill included mini bar beers and sodas that my companion and I most definitely did not consume. Then they argued with me about who else might have drunk them. The bill also did not include all three days I'd ordered wireless internet, and when I tried to point this out, the front desk person was quite abrupt in telling me the billing computer never made mistakes. Example four. What kind of Canadian hotel does not have pancakes and maple syrup on the breakfast menu? This one! Small things I know, but rather annoying and not really good enough. Lastly, a word on location. Some people say the location of this hotel is bad. I think the only reason the location might be bad is if you have lost all use of your lower limbs (in which you have my sincere sympathy) or if it is raining cats and dogs and you truly cannot afford the $4 cab fare to anywhere else in downtown Vancouver or Yaletown. The location is FINE. The Westin is on Robson St, which has hundreds of cool shops and eateries mere staggering distance away, and it is within spitting distance of loads of civic amenities like BC Place and the Art Museum and Crepe Express. I'd rate the location as much better than say the Pan Pacific or the Westin Waterfront or the Hyatt, and darn nearly as good as the Hotel Vancouver or the Sutton Place.

Reviews.Title: “All-suite hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: banjo815
Reviews.Content: This all-suite hotel has about 200 rooms. Each floor has 2 corner suites while the top two floors 30-31, are Executive Suites w/a larger room, key -access, WiFi internet, breakfast and nightly turndown service. Check-in was effiicient and staff is friendly. My room is a deluxe corner suite w/a glass-enclosed balcony. It has a living room w/floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking downtown Vancouver, marble bathroom w/separate tub & shower, plus a kitchenette completed w/microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher, sink, toaster and utencils. The entire hotel is served by only 2 elevators, the wait can be long during busy hours. The hotel's main entrance is hidden in an alleyway, making navigation a bit problematic. There is valet or self-parking available. Self-park costs $7 w/in-and-out priviledge.

Reviews.Title: “[--] stains on the drapes, Come on folks !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NWBKTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had reportedly one of the nicest rooms in the whole hotel . . . . top floor, corner room with balcony. The shower has mildew growing in the corner near the door towards the bottom of the shower pan.
