The curtains have stains all over them in the bedroom. . . . presumably body fluids or something disgusting like that. The sofa is stained thoroughly as well. The floor plan of the hotel room we were in is ridiculous. The so called seating area is like a shotgun bowling alley lane. It's could more correctly be named a hallway. The room next to us that our parents occupied was a much nicer configuration but a "cheaper price". The floor outlet under the TV in the bedroom was not secured to the floor so that when you pulled the plug out of the outlet, the whole housing comes up out of the floor. For this price and this locations and for this to be a Westin, I can't imagine that things like this have to be pointed out. Ridiculous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It - great value”
Reviews.Author: kipster39
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business, large suite, well furnished, heavenly bed, heavenly shower, good brekfast, 20 min walk to downtown but easy to find. Walking distance to everywhere. Great value chain hotel, would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and well situated Westin”
Reviews.Author: terravisum
Reviews.Content: We have chosen the Westin Grand for its all-suites nature as we wanted some nice space for our little rest after the long flights. We checked into the hotel quite early around 10AM and my status was quickly recognized and I was offered an upgraded room on the 27th floor. Upon arriving in the room, we found out that the suite Queen bed is rather small and we wanted a bigger bed to stretch out. A call down to the front-desk and I was offered a king bed suite albeit in a lower floor. We took the offer and found out that the new room is actually a better room with a small balcony (although the weather was pretty cold while we were there). The suite is brightly lit from natural lights from the floor to ceiling windows. The living has a confortable sofa and reading chair with a coffee table. The workdesk is tucked to one side and the TV/drawer is placed in the other corner with an extra sitting chair. Next to the entrance is the minibar and the usual coffee machine. Hidden behind a closet door is a little sink, microwave and a diskwasher. There are enough utensils for a few days of usage. The bedroom is also brightly lit with the Heavenly bed as its central piece. Rounding out the room is another TV/drawer and a reading chair/ottoman. The room heavy curtains effectively blocked out all the daylight for the lazy days. Connecting between the bedroom and the living room is the super roomy marbled bathroom with a complete standing shower with dual-shower heads and deep-soak tub, all with Kohler fixtures. The Westin Heavenly Bath products are ever present here. The Westin entrance is a little bit small and in time of traffic can be a bit crowded. However, the bellman and the concierge is also present to give you a hand. The lobby is actually situated on the 1st floor as well as the hotel restaurant and some conference rooms. The Westin is centrally located between the Robson shopping crowd, BC place and the Yaletown which offers some great restaurants. I was very pleased with my stay here and won't hesitate to come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: travelfranck
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel just after 11:00 in the morning with the intention to drop off our bags and come later when the room would be ready, but one was available already so we were able to check immediately, which was great. The Heavenly Beds really are heavenly (although a King instead of a Queen would have been even better). The room was clean, staff were very friendly and professional. Can't really think of anything negative to say about my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great room, astonishing view”
Reviews.Author: Belgian_Traveller_73
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel through Starwood website. The hotel is really fantastic, and I have to contradict some previous reviews. First, we had booked an executive room, on 31st floor. The room was awesome, wvery bright, with a separate bedroom. The sitting room was so nice. The bath room was large with a bath and separate shower. The bed was a WEstin bed, hence excellent. The executive room comes with a breakfast. The latter was not only excellent, but also the staff was great. They always remembered us from one day to another and also remembered what we used to drink (cofffee and hot chocolate). Now, I have to contradict two critics read here. The fisrt one is about elevators. Yes, there are only two eleators for 32 floors(actually less than that, as some floors don't exist)... but there are only 9 rooms or so per floor ... so the waiting time was at most 1 or 2 mlinutes ... Come one, what are two minutes in life ? The fact is that people like to complain about the elevator ... By comparison, the Omni Washington DC has two small elevators, one per wing, with less floors, but tens of rooms per floor. The second thing is the location: it is not unsafe, or full of homeless (and even then ...) or full of construction. Actually, the location is excellent if you want to dine out in Yaletown (the hippest and best restaurant in Vancouver). This hotel really makes you feel you are actually living in Vancouver! The hotel has actually more charm than the huge Sheraton! Finally, the psort facilities are great, with an outdoor heated pool, a sauna, etc, all of this in the middle of downtown. Shortly speaking, I would return there without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Class”
Reviews.Author: alekona
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Grand Hotel, Vancouver for 6 nights in early September 2007. I booked the hotel through the Starwood Internet Site and managed to “Stay 6, Pay 4” nights. As a bonus, for an extra $40CDN per night, we were upgraded to an Deluxe Executive Suite on a high floor. This upgrade also included continental buffet breakfast for two people. As with all hotels, there are positives and negatives. Here is my personal view of the experience: Positives: *massive bathroom with Westin’s signature heavenly shower. *signature Westin beds. *separate bath and shower. *room came with a balcony, so you could get fresh air and enjoy the magnificent view from the hotel room. *room had 2 televisions. *housekeeping was efficient and polite. *hotel had an excellent gym. Not the biggest around, but with new equipment. *staff were courteous and helpful. *a small liquor store is located next door to hotel. *food in hotel restaurant was great quality, although a little on the pricey side. Negatives: *hotel is not in the best location. It seems to be at the other end of town compared to the majority of hotels in Downtown Vancouver. There are several homeless people sitting on sidewalks near and around the hotel. Although, this did seem to be a common occurrence in Downtown Vancouver. *hotel only has two elevators for 32 floors. They were particularly slow and you could end up waiting as long as 5 minutes for one to arrive. So plan ahead and leave extra waiting time. *at checkout, our bill was double charged for the upgrade. The front desk staff were helpful to amend this mistake, but it cautions all to check your hotel bill before checking out. *hotel room was looking worn. The couch had notable stains on it. The carpet in the room was also stained. The curtains had stains. The light shades had stains. It could have done with a replacement of these items, or a really good steam clean. *the day tour company that we chose does not pick up from this hotel. This is due to the road/driveway of the hotel. We found this a little annoying that we had to walk to another hotel to pick up our day tours. Overall, I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Although there were some negatives to this stay, it provided us with a big enough room for our 6 night stay and was a comfortable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but not a fanstastic value”
Reviews.Author: PastryBandit
Reviews.Content: The staff were exceptionally friendly (perhaps overly so), and were always helpful when needed. You do pay through the nose for any extras, but there were some delightful touches-- afternoon fruit bowls and Voss water, complimentary breakfast buffet (we had a suite on the Executive levels, on the 31st floor, and breakfast was included), and fast valet service. I would recommend not staying in a studio suite, and upgrading to at least a superior (preferably a deluxe) suite.

Reviews.Title: “What a view.”
Reviews.Author: TeantravellerUK
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in September, on the advice of The Independent Traveller-Loughborough, through an offer of four nights for the price of three. We arrived somewhat tired after the long flight from Manchester, but when we entered our room 2308, wow, what a view. The city and harbour all lit up, we sat and admired it for several minutes. The suite was immaculate,clean and spotless. The bed large and comfortable. A large television in each room, film channel AMC(American movie channel) has less adverts than most. The location is superb and although I have some difficulty in walking, we still managed to reach Canada Wharf ( a must see )by foot. That said, the taxis are not expensive although eating out could be. We can recommend "Rosies on Robson " a short walk from the hotel (less than 1/4 mile) for a good value meal. The sea wall at Stanley Park was badly damaged in storms last December and will not be repaired until next year,important, if like us, you like to cycle round it. Another tip the price of bottled water in shops near the hotel is expensive, find a large store for better value. Would we stay here again, you bet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views - good location - terrible room service menu”
Reviews.Author: MA&DF
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Westin (29th floor) while working in Burnaby. Pros: - Good location. 8 mins walk to the sky train station. At the end of Robson street so none of the noise and traffic but close enough to still enjoy the area. - Nice kitchenettes with everything you need to have a quick bite. - Great views from the upper floors. - Little balcony in the room so you can get some fresh air. Cons: - Terrible room service menu - tried different options for 3 nights and didn't find one decent dish. - The entrace is barely visible from the street and there isn't a doorman so if you are walking in with things you have to struggle with the heavy glass doors. The taxi entrance where the doormen are is in an alley and not nice for walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: bb24aka
Reviews.Content: The location is right in the heart of the city, you're within walking distance to tours, great shopping, restaurants, and cool neighborhoods. The customer service is excellent, and everyone is willing to help wih recommendations. The room is really nice, but the bathroom could use an upgrade. Other than that, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Grand, a comfortable experience”
Reviews.Author: EGinDC
Reviews.Content: I'd been dying to visit Vancouver after my boyfriend spoke so highly of it. I had accumulated enough Starwood points to get a free night, so my boyfriend and I booked a recent weekend in August, definitely high season based on all the prices of comparable hotels. The night we paid for was $353 CAN, more than I'm usually willing to pay for one night, but after checking the prices of other hotels, and since we were getting a free night too with points, we decided what the heck. We arrived in Vancouver on a Saturday around 9 am and dropped our bags off with the bellman, and went off to breakfast. While we were exploring Stanley Park, the front desk called to say our room was available for check in around 11 am. We checked into a suite which was very clean and modern. The fitness room had new equipment, but was rather small, as was the pool outside. This hotel was in easy walking distance to shops on Robson and Granville, and eating in Yaletown. The elevators were a wait though. The entire staff was super helpful and friendly, and even allowed for me to check-out at 4 pm, as I wasn't flying back to the US East coast until 7 pm in the evening. Very accomodating staff! I'd definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: phxtraveler75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for two nights before leaving on a cruise. We arrived in the evening and the taxi driver had a hard time finding the hotel because the entrance is down a small alley. The bellman was quick to help with the bags and directed us to the front desk and said that he would bring the bags up to our room. We went to check-in and up to the room. Within two minutes there was the bellman with the bags, when he delivered them to our room he used our last name to address us, a nice personal touch that many hotels forget. The location is great, right in the heart of downtown and within walking distance or a short taxi ride from the sights. We stayed in a suite, which was a little oddly shaped with a very small bedroom and a large living area that featured a small kitchenette area with a fridge, sink and microwave. Overall a nice room. The fitness room was small but each piece of cardio equipment had its own TV and they provided head sets for those that forgot them. They do charge for internet access, so if you plan on working be prepared for the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Clean Hotel, Great Location, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonSeattle
Reviews.Content: Staff of the hotel is excellent. The head concierge recommended several things that we took advantage of and were happy we did. We have been to Vancouver before and had never done some of them so we are glad we talked with her. The room was clean but on the small side of rooms. The location was great on Robson street and close to shopping, dining and culture. The elevators were a little slow but overall not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: traveljunky81
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great room. Pool area was very nice. Parking was very pricy and a bit of a gong show. Overall a nice hotel but I felt a little over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great rooms/location, excellent concierge”
Reviews.Author: scottmichaelmorris
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a large "business" hotel, but in typical Westin style it is definitely above average -- nice Pottery Barn-style design, great rooms, a nice pool, and really terrific staff. It might not be a "design hotel" but it is definitely a great place to stay if you are looking for a solid hotel in a very central location (easy few minute walk to Yaletown, Robson Street shops, etc.). They gave us a 1 bedroom suite which was really fantastic -- can't beat the Westin's Heavenly Bed! One real highlight is Lisa, the head concierge. She is absolutely fantastic with spot-on recommendations, plus she's tons of fun. She recommended Brix for dinner, which was absolutely fantastic and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Big-City Chic”
Reviews.Author: Resort_Employee
Reviews.Content: I hosted a small 'Canada Day' party at the Westin Grand this July 1st. I contacted the property directly and obtained a special rate. As a Starwood Preferred Guest I also recieved a room upgrade (from a 'Superior' Suite to a 'Deluxe' Suite). Unfortunately, upon check-in, I was greeted by a very pompous front desk agent. He informed me that there was an issue regarding my special rate and that the reservations agent that I dealt with was new and inexperienced - thus had given me incorrect information. However, rather than being sympathetic, the agent was aggressive and indifferent. He made me feel like riff-raff. This is so un-typical of Westin employees. Check-in aside, I had an enjoyable stay at the Westin Grand. Here's the low-down on the hotel: Pro's: -Gorgeous entrance and lobby -A lot of room-types to choose from -The rooms are amazing (in terms of amenities: wet-bar/fully-equipped kitchenette, sitting rooms, separate bedrooms, pull-out couch, & the always amazing 'Heavenly Bed' etc.) -Bathrooms are great! Granite everywhere! The soaker tubs are so relaxing and the separate shower stall is very nice. -Location is great in relation to downtown amenities. -Rooms sizes are nice and spacious for the most part. Con's: -Service is sketchy. Some hotel associates make you feel welcome and appreciated - others (such as the man who checked me in) can make one feel like rubbish. I found the Service Express Agents to be very nice and helpful. -Decor is tasteful - but is kind of boring? The lobby is nice enough, but the rooms look muted and dull. -The TVs in the room are old and outdated. My room also did not have a DVD player or anything of that sorts. It also lacked a CD player of any kind. I was surprised considering this is considered a 'Deluxe' Suite. -Prices: okay, so nothing shocking here.. all hotels of this calibre seem to overcharge and nickle-and-dime on everything. I was charged $20 to borrow a CD player overnight and I paid $12 for 'breakfast' which consisted of 2 croissants (both the size of a finger) and 2 VERY mini pieces of banana bread. I got a free glass of ice water though. How generous.. geesh. Overall: I would probably recommend this hotel to friends and family. It isn't anything 'grand' or amazing, but it's new, clean, and generally quite nice. I would advise people to NOT book 'Studio Suites' necessarily, as they seem like basic hotel rooms (they don't feature separate bedrooms etc.). This hotel is only really worthwhile if one gets a good deal on a Superior / Deluxe / Executive Suite.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: brooklyngurl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying in a suite at the Westin Grand. The bedroom is a bit small and we didn't have the greatest view (facing the construction site next door) but the room was very clean. There is a 24 hour gym and the pool was open until 10pm. The concierge was very helpful and the service was impeccable. The hotel is centrally located on Robson Street. Shopping, the art gallery, movie theatre, Korean supermarket as well as a gourmet supermarket was just up the street. There was also a great crepe place up the street on Robson. The hotel is also within walking distance from the Seabus Terminal, should you wish to take the sea plane or ferries to go whale watching. I have no complaints about the hotel and by no means is this a reflection on the hotel, but I would stay af a different hotel if I were to go back to visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: SeattleJeremy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because they were centrally located for shopping on Robson Street and just a few blocks from the SkyTrain station. The hotel staff as extraordinarily courteous and the room was had was perfect. We had the 1-bedroom executive suite which featured a pull-out sofa so our friend traveling with us didn't have to sleep on a cot or a roll-away bed. The concierge gave us several recommendations for restaurants which we found very helpful and the staff was generally very willing to jump in and assist when requested (late checkout, help with bags, etc). I'd highly recommend the Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: anonomous_7
Reviews.Content: I received a lowered rate by prepaying and using a AAA card. This hotel is nice but certainly not exceptional. It has great views of downtown Vancouver and we did find the concierge very helpful. The carpet in our room was stained and worn. The room was very clean. Although we didn't use the pool, it looked clean and well kept. I do think it is a little overpriced for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dimed to death”
Reviews.Author: Euphemia07
Reviews.Content: This was a second chance stay for us at the Westin. Our first stay last summer on their Girls Night Out package was a disaster. The GM insisted that if we gave them a second chance they would totally take care of us. Well their idea of taking care of us was a basket with one bottle of water and a bunch of grapes. No room upgrade or free valet parking, which by the way is $20.00 a day. I was treated like a vagrent when I did not have ID when I needed my room key re-magnitized and was followed to my room to verify my idenity by my suitmates all done in front of other guests, We were also charges $2.50 for extra coffe packets for the room when housekeeping forgot to replenish it. Internet is $15.00 a day. Nothing is complimentary at this so called 4 star hotel. Next time if I want to be treated like this I will stay at the Holiday Inn where at least you get free internet and complematary coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Not really "grand"”
Reviews.Author: Travel Richly
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand (named after the shape of the building, a grand piano) was originally designed as a residential property and so the room designs and sizes are all different (and not all are suites). If you book the lowest category or do not have elite status with Starwood (and so are not upgraded), you will end up in a standard-sized hotel room (ending in 05, 06, or 07), all of which face a large construction project across the lane. The noise starts at 8 am. There are only 2 elevators per floor (remember that originally there were only half the number of units when it was a residential development). Wait times during busy periods easily exceeded 10 minutes. This is made worse when your room key, which is needed to access all floors, is not working (twice in my case). The other stuff you might want to know about: -- The beds (queen size), are wonderfully comfy. -- Internet access costs CAD 15.89 per 24 hours. Stick with the cable hook-up as wireless is spotty. -- The fitness center is basic but free. -- TV channel choice is extensive. -- Staff are very friendly and eager to please. -- There is a wide variety of restaurants and shops within easy walking distance of the hotel. All in all, a fine hotel but certainly not "grand".

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnny63
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff (e.g. making suggestions about restaurants and offering help with directions spontaneously). Well appointed rooms with Kitchenette if you like that sort of thing. Shame we had a view of a building site. Everything you would expect of a Westin. Modest entrance with reception on a different level.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladybugx87
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand Vancouver is a good enough hotel- certainly not the best Westin I ever stayed in but not too many complaints either. Check in was smoothly. My room was 2807 and I had a pretty good view when the clouds left. The room had a very nice kitchenette type area with plates, bowls, silverware, etc. The living space was nice as was the bathroom. The bedroom was tiny. I think they could have done a better job with a larger bedroom and no separate living space. There are 2 TVs in the room. The internet worked great for me throughout my stay if I was plugged in. The wireless was sporadic. All of the workers are quite pleasant. The housekeeping lady even knew my gym schedule and would clean my room during my daily workout. I ordered room service twice for breakfast and once for lunch. The food was good and arrived as I ordered. Hint- ordering off the child's menu saves you money without decreasing the amount of food greatly. The concierge is not the best. I asked for a deli nearby and he recommended one so I chose that even though I saw many more. The sandwich was drab and the service was bad. I should have trusted my instincts and gone elsewhere. Only other complaint- the elevators are slow.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff, great suites”
Reviews.Author: Max_ramento
Reviews.Content: Had a suite for 3 day get-away. Can't say enough about the staff - very helpful, friendly & accomodating. Room was clean, roomy, modern. Beds as always comfy. Hotel is great location - just 2 blocks from yaletown, and walking distance to about everything.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: Dimu
Reviews.Content: My husband travels to Vancouver often on business and for this stay we decided to try the Westin Grand . We (self, husband, one year old) stayed in a King bed suite with a walk out balcony for 6 nights at the end of May. The room was large and very clean and it was very convenient having a microwave/kitchenette area to heat up meals and milk for my little guy. The balcony was maybe 12 square feet, so it may not be worth it to book the step out balcony if you are expecting something bigger.The beds were so comfortable, and the bathroom had a wonderful shower and separate soaker tub, and was very large as well.The staff was very friendly and accomodating and made all of us feel very welcome. Since we have a toddler we received a welcome kit that contained a rubber duckie, night light, first aid kit, and outlet plugs for our room. The porter even told us to let him know if we needed anything special for our child (soy milk etc...)as he would run out and get it for us. Room service was prompt, and the seared tuna sandwich, portobello sandwich, veggie lasagna, and apricot french toast were very tasty. The pool was not heated enough to be an outdoor pool at this time of year, but it was pleasant to relax on the deck. The location is great and within short walking distance to Robson shops, BC place, the theatre, Yale town, and the library. There is a liquor store right next to the hotel so that you can buy your own wine and a budget rent a car one block east of the hotel. I would definitely stay here again, as many of the rooms are suites and can accomodate small families very well. A tip about the rooms is that the king suites ending in 03 are a bit bigger than the ones ending in 09 (there are two on every floor)

Reviews.Title: “awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: deriko
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Westin Grand is incredible. They not only offered us an early check in, but gave us an upgrade. The room is beautiful; the view is spectacular and the room itself is clean and comfortable. Unfortunately, the internet service did not work from our room and the tech service they go thru is useless. After I was on the phone with the tech service for a over an hour, I went to the front desk to complain. And to my surprise, they were very kind and offered us a different room or the use of their business center. Later that evening upon returning to our room, we were so surprised to find a gift card for breakfast. They went above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location... and the motel is great!”
Reviews.Author: JBOUD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks on business and found the staff extremely helpful and friendly. No issues with the room, very very clean and well kept. Stayed on the 23rd floor... exceptional view. within walking distance to everything in downtown and skytrain access is close by. Would recommend to anyone... will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, amazing rooms, beautiful city views..”
Reviews.Author: slashd0t
Reviews.Content: I can't really write more then what's already been said, but, a couple key points about this hotel I wanted to make sure everyone knows about: 1) The Restaurant was fantastic. The food was well prepared and the staff were prompt and very friendly 2) The rooms are amazing; this was quite simply the best hotel I've stayed in this past year 3) The location is close to bars, clubs, restaurants, GM place, anything basically that's worth going to in the evenings while in town on business 4) The staff really do make this place special. They will go the extra mile for you 5) If you don't stay in this hotel you are really missing out..

Reviews.Title: “Sweet pad”
Reviews.Author: hopabout99
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite place to stay in Van. Great location and amazing views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Grand is for the shape of the building”
Reviews.Author: alessi1212
Reviews.Content: I would just like to point out that "Grand" in its namesake is not intended to describe level of service or ammenities but the architectural design of the building. Stand back and look directly at the building and you will see that the glass front is curved like a grand piano! I've been to this property many times (most recently in late Dec 06) and cannot understand people who have rated it anything other than unpretentious, immaculate, professional and centrally located. Compared to the Pan Pacific, Waterfront and Hotel Vancouver, the Westin Grand is a better value. As far as contruction is concerned, you can't escape it in Downtown Vancouver. For those who complained about this is just complaining for the sake of complaining. Construction projects do not stop just because you're in town. Highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate coming back construction or not.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: tokyogal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Yes, it was compact but it was utilized well. The staff were super friendly, the ARIA serves good food, the room was comfortable. The work-out facility was great, the spa was great. The location is the best thing about this hotel because it is close to Pan Pacific shopping mall and it is right on Robson Street. It will definitely be visited by me again and again. The only thing that I could complain about would be that the toilet seat was dirty. I always wipe toilet seats down before using them anywhere. The tissue that I used to clean the toilet seat was filthy and brown in color.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: walrus007
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Excellent staff. Front door staff and valet attendants were friendly and efficient. The room was very clean, bed and bedding were fabulous. Rooms are not huge but the space is very well utilized. This is the most intelligently furnished hotel room I have ever been in. I liked the sitting area set up; you could invite friends to the room for a drink and be very comfortable. We had a separate bedroom which worked out great, I was able to make coffee, star bucks, cups to go supplied :-), and watch TV while my wife slept in undisturbed. Microwave, sink, cooking utensils and dishes are in the room. Large clean bathroom with a good shower and selection of high quality toiletries. Great city views. The location is excellent; it's ON Robson Street! We easily and comfortably walked to Yale town for dinner in the rain. It’s across the street from the library. It’s very close to the QE Theatre. It's within easy walking distance of both stadiums. We walked to the Pacific Centre for shopping in a few minutes. We ordered breakfast using the card. It was delivered within 2 minutes of our requested time. Food was very good, still hot, and came with a full array of condiments. An all round good experience, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: TravelWarrior
Reviews.Content: Stayed here nine times when in Vancouver on business and don't have one complaint. Well furnished rooms, beautifully decorated and with every facility you could ever need, many with a kitchenette facility. Excellent service from all staff every time without fail. Central for everything. I love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Modern 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LNTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights over Canada's thanksgiving weekend. Room clean, comfortable and has obviously been renovated fairly recently. Loved having a separate bedroom (all-suite hotel). Felt the cofee etc pricey to have in your room, especially as there is a Starbucks across the road open 0500-2100 every day, but you always pay a premium for such extras. Some good views to be had from higher floor rooms. No problems with waiting for the 2 elevators, also found the staff to be helpful. Ate in the bar on the first night, and food was good, not overpriced either. Menu at the restaurant looked good too. Located at the more up-market end of Robson St and an easy walk to Yaletown, Shopping district, The Lookout etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: rcastro2
Reviews.Content: As a starwood preferred guest, I've stayed in alot of Westin's. This one was one of the best! We booked a few months in advance so there was no problems getting an available room using our star points.Although the suite was alittle small it was more than adequate. After reading many of the reviews, I was alittle nervous about the construction and the complaints about long waits at the elevators.... My suite was located on the front glass side and I never heard the construction and the view was breathe taking from the 29th floor! As for the elevators, I never waited for more than a minute or so. The service was great. Our AC messed up about the third day there. We called downstairs and someone was in our room within 10minutes fixing the problem. The conceirge service was a great help giving directions and ideas.The location was perfect. We were there for 5 days in September and we walked everywhere except for our trip to Granville Island,Stanley Park and Lynn Canyon in which we used public transportation (it was easy and inexpensive). The city of Vancouver has sooo much to offer. There's restaurants for everyone's taste, art, music, shopping, hiking, biking, museums, etc. By the way, if your looking for a great burger try Red Robin's. It's a trendy place within walking distance with good prices. Also Earl's was a chain type restaurant with a wide variety, good atmosphere, and also decent prices. If your a chocolate lover check out Death by Chocolate in Yaletown.....the desserts are wonderful! Overall this was one of my favorite starwood hotels. We have decided to make it one of our regular vacation spots. They will definitely see us again! Don't believe all the bad reviews, some people are just over analytical....it was a great place to relax and enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “Air Conditioning inadequate”
Reviews.Author: OvationGX2
Reviews.Content: I booked a "deluxe suite" for the 23rd September, and that's exactly what I got. The room was spotlessly clean and well appointed, the bed was comfortable, bathroom was fine BUT......................... The sun hitting the huge expanse of glass windows heated the room up so much that the air conditioning just could not cope, even with the drapes closed to keep the sun out of the room. The suite was like a sauna by 9:30 am. This is not a problem that just happened or would be unknown to the front desk, which demonstrates a poor attitude to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pricey”
Reviews.Author: sfuji1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very accommodating for large families and pets are accepted here as well. However, beware of major construction taking place right next door. Parking is 21.00/day and we ended up renting a car because Vancouver is much larger in area than we had anticipated. The locale was okay, but I hear the Bayshore is located in a more tourist friendly area with more things to do and see over there. If you want to use your Starwood points, they only allow them for the 'standard' rooms which are one to a floor. Needless to say, the 'reward points' rooms were unavailable and my 50pct off coupon, was really 0 percent off as a friend walked up and was offered the same rate of 259.00CAD. Buffet breakfast for 17.95 is very dissappointing, so it's better to walk across the street and find a restaurant. Unless you have a large family and need the room, I would choose elsewhere as this is strictly a hotel for business travelers, and I would not recommend it for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great but a little on the pricey side.”
Reviews.Author: RamblingVinnie
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the Vancouver Westin Grand becasue we were seeing a show at the Queen E. The location is great. It's about a block and a half from the Queen E so it was a nice evening walk to the show. The hotel itself is beautiful. Lots of wood and black granite in the lobby. The rooms are also really nice. We have a small baby with us so the suite arrangement with the small kitchenette was perfect. The bed and the linens are fantastic. The fitness center was fine, better than what some hotels try to pass off as a fitness center. The pool and hot tub area were nice too. Great views. The staff overall were good. We were always acknowledged and greeted althought you could tell some of them were forcing it. The things I didn't like were... two elevators in a building this size is ridiculous. Epsecially if you're trying to get one during the morning rush. I hate...hate having to pay for internet access. I've stayed in many other hotels were it's free. Same goes for local calls. $1.25 per local call is obsence. I'm sure most people use their mobie phones anyway so why don't they stop offending people with these rip off charges. Lastly, the parking was $24, too much. All these little charges end up being 10 to 15% of the room rate. Overall, I would stay there again. it's a nice palce and staff make an effort, maybe just not during high season.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel26
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with our stay at the Grand Westin that there isn't enough space here to comment! Excellent rooms. We had an Executive Deluxe Suite that was amazing. The views were incredible! We had the wall-to-celling windows room. The room was big and the bed was totally "heavenly". Better than that was the bathroom and seperate "soaking tub". The hotel itself is classy, modern and unpretentious. We have stayed at the Fours Seasons, Ritz Carlton and other noteable establishment, and I will say with all certaintly that this property was just as comprable. The staff was friendly, knowedlegable and very curtious. The staff at the resturant, "Aria" was even better! The food was fantastic and the breakfast that came with our room rate was even better! I will always stay at this property if I return to Vancouver. You won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line room!”
Reviews.Author: iscreenwriter
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the top floor with a balcony and have to say the room was as good as it gets. If the most important thing you look for in a hotel is the room quality and size you can't go wrong. The lobby was basically non-existant. The restaurant was really good and the weightroom was nice. The hotel website said it had a spa so when I learned that they didn't I was upset. They have a room for massage that is very hard to get appointments. The location was OK. Not bad but not the best. All around i was happy with my stay and would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Grand Fantastic Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: billyar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand for 7 days in July. While the hotel was not completly perfect I must say that it is one of the best overall values I have found in my travels. First the minor negatives: The elevators are inadaquate. There are only 2 and the wait during the day is long and the stops are many on the crowded way up or down. The hotel completly messed up my room assignment but a little persistence cleared that up. However, if one is willing to accept a bit of a wait for an elevator one receives many things that few hotels in this price range offer. First it is the best location for walking in the city. Gastown, Chinatown, Yaletown, The Aquabus dock, the amazing Library, Downtown Shopping and Arts Houses, are all within easy (10 min max) walking distance. We were able to walk everywhere. The hotel is surrounded by inexpensive and excellent local eateries. As well as stores. The design and decor is clean and modern but comfortable. The baths are large and lux with seperate soaking tub and shower. The suites are large and comfortable with a small, smart, mini kitchen. It even had a small dishwasher. Also the kitchen was actually stocked with enough equipment to make a light meal. Even a toaster was included. Very impressive! It was neatly tucked away behind doors, not intruding into the room. The pool was decent sized and tiled, the surrounding deck was huge with both lounges and tables, there was a spa as well. Lovely modern design that clearly was integrated with the stunning Library across the street. A lot of good planning went into this Hotel and it shows. Large healthy potted plants enhanced it further. The workout area was excellent: large, cool, with floor to ceiling windows out to the pool. Good selection of cardio, a weight machine, dumbells, and streching equipment. Bath had a shower, steam room and was immaculate. I only had breakfast (every day) in the Dining room as it was included in my rate. The continental was very generous with many choices. For a nominal fee hot entrees were included. The fruit selection was vast and actually ripe. Many different carbs were offered including bagels and toast. Yogurt, granola, and juices were all available. The display was always lovely and never looked "picked" over. The same three professional waiters quickly recognized us after the first day and were friendly and welcoming. I don't understand complaints about the room itself. It is fairly large and graced with a very high ceiling and huge windows on two sides that look out on the tree-lined streets below. It was modern and elegant, full of great design details. Massive lengths of fireplace screens covered the windows, it was suprisingly effective. I think folks interested in clever design would like this room. It was not usual hotel dining room. The staff were all quite professional and response time was always good. My housekeeper was the same everyday and she knew me by name and knew what I liked. That is so Four Seasons. She called me Mr. William, you gotta love that. I have to single out Lisa, the head Concierge as truly excellent. She gave us a ton of help and suggestions and always got us good tables. She really went the extra mile to get us into the sold out fireworks spectacular. It meant a lot to us. She knew everything about the city. What a true pro, and no attitude. Now on to the view and some practical advice. We stayed on the top two Grandview Floors. I have stayed at the Pan Pacific (in a front facing suite) a Downtown Hotel, and the Delta Vancouver. None of them has a view as good as the one from our rooms. We could see everything from the Harbour to False Creek. It was truly amazing. I strongly recommend staying on a higher floor or springing for the Grandview Floors. Also, the 09 balcony rooms are by far the best. Frankly, there is too much of a disparity between these and some of the other suites in the same deluxe category. The balcony rooms on the other side are just as good in design and have decent but not breathtaking city views. The rooms on the curved side of the hotel are more desirable than the ones on the flat side. I would have had to pay 3 times as much to replicate this experience anywhere else in Vancouver and would not have had as good a view or location. Was this hotel as good as a Four Seasons or Ritz: not quite. Would it have been worth paying three times as much for a bit more service: no way! This hotel is real find and an incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “When construction ends, it will be much better!!”
Reviews.Author: DFTripper
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is really quite nice- not too small/boutique-like (like the Opus Hotel), and not too overwhelmingly large, like the Pan Pacific. It has a very nice pool, and extremely clean facilities and rooms. (I have stayed in the Westin in Boston, Mandarin Oriental in San Francisco, Phoenician in Scottsdale). The suites are nice, with decent sized sitting areas, and bathrooms. The bedroom area is a bit small, but since your actual room is an adequate size, it's not a problem. Plus, the "heavenly bed" is fabulous!! The staff, although not too helpful, were very kind, and eager to help. (They seemed to be unfamiliar with the local restaurants/directions). We found it more useful to direct our "Vancouver" questions to locals on the street! The only major issue that we had was the construction in the lot directly adjacent to our room (facing north). It's not the fault of the hotel, but rather due to the rapid expansion of condo complexes throughout the city. It seems as if this particular construction project is neverending, as reviews as far back as last year, complain about the noise. I would highly recommend this hotel, for its cleanliness, amenities, and location. However, I would strongly recommend staying in a room facing Robson Street (or a Southern view) so as not to contend with construction noise.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Grand is merely good”
Reviews.Author: MJPBAF
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand is an odd hybrid of a hotel – a boutique business hotel that tries to be two things at once and doesn’t really succeed at either. The biggest problem is one of scale: boutique generally means intimate spaces and personal service while grand generally means large public spaces and efficient, business-focused service. Calling this boutique hotel “grand” sets an expectation that the public spaces, service and ambiance do not live up to. We enjoyed the modern, tasteful suite: it had a comfortable bedroom and a well-organized bathroom. Our corner location meant we had great views of Vancouver plus a small outdoor balcony off the living room. Unfortunately, this 30-story building has only two elevators, making a trip up to or down from the room a longer process than it should be for a hotel that aspires to be “grand.” The constant grumbling of the other guests about the elevator reinforced our view that this was a legitimate problem. The small dining room/bar/breakfast space right off the lobby is trendy, but again, it’s more boutique than grand and the resulting impression is one of trying to fit too much into too small a space. The hotel seemed to be understaffed much of the time, with the bellhops/porters serving as doormen, valets and concierges, often at the same time. Multitasking can be admirable in the corporate world, but it is rather challenging in a hotel that should place more of an emphasis on service. The Westin Grand is by no means a bad hotel; it’s perfectly fine. But if you’re expecting it to live up to its name, you’ll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Grand was Grand”
Reviews.Author: Aberdeengirl
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern hotel in a great location for seeing downtown Vancouver. Lots within walking distance. Breakfast ample. Staff helpful concierge/ porters particularily so. Had a problem first night, wrong room type allocated but was sorted amicably for the rest of our stay. We stayed there June 2006. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: piatty73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights after a cruise and were initially turned off by the lobby area and thought the small suite was tiny compared to the Four Seasons suite we had just left in Whistler. After awhile we thought the rooms was fine and met our needs. The upper floors have good vews and are key card access only. The room came with continental brfst which was more than enough for us. The concierge was helpful and knew alot about the local dining. I would recommend this property, good location on Robson

Reviews.Title: “really Happy”
Reviews.Author: Layover
Reviews.Content: I was originally supposed to stay at another nearby hotel. I wanted something close to the client's office so I could walk and I didn't want to rent a car. I chose the Westin because of the Starwood program and my near addiction to getting more points. Got in late after an insane immigration wait. Was in kind of a crappy mood. Was expecting something a little more, well, "grand" from the car port and lobby. It had a boutique hotel feel to it. Which is fine. I had read the reviews and totally blew it by not asking for a room facing away from the construction. The previous reviewer was right. They started pounding something at about 6:30 am. But, the staff was great. The room was great. I got tons of work done. The restaurant was terrific. The holiday decorations were festive. (This is a big deal with me. If I'm traveling on business in December, I want a place that will keep me in the mood until I can get home to my family.) Close to everything. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “stay at the bayshore”
Reviews.Author: gratch77
Reviews.Content: as a very frequent traveller and a starwood prefered guest I get to see lots of hotels. I wanted a night away and decided to give the Westin Grand a try. I have to say I was disappointed. To start they had no record of my reservaton. Even after I printed it out they couldnt find it. I was then given a room different from what I had reserved. The lounge/ restaurant is incredibly tiny. I thought it was just the lounge as it was the size of one. The hotel has 31 floors AND only 2 elevators. Needless to say you can wait a while to get to and from your room. the room was fairly nice, though had some bad design elements. First you could hear the elevator in the room, while this may seem small, the computer power plug in was hidden on the end of the desk in a location one would never know or think of and it was impossible to find. the bathroom lights are either all on or all off, meaning if you want to have a nice bath you are either in full light or complete darkness. the best thing about the hotel is the location. The Bayshore is a much better laid out hotel right on the water. in the future i would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “noisy”
Reviews.Author: hamcan
Reviews.Content: Rooms ok but make sure you are not facing the construction site! Stayed over the oct 25 weekend and 6:45 monday morning had a crane swinging outside my window and drills hammering away...and this was supposed to be a holiday! No reason I could see why we were put in a room facing the site as the hotel was nowhere near full. SPG membership didn't make a difference. Service was fine, friendly staff and no other major problems. Got double charged for parking (twice) but eventually correct. Booked a smoking room and got put in nonsmoking but they found us another room quickly. Check your charges on checkout. Not bad but I certainly won't be returning until after whatever is being built next door is finished!

Reviews.Title: “Good Times At The Westin”
Reviews.Author: CFNOBIS
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Westin at about 9:30 am as we had just departed our ship. When we went to check in there were no rooms available. The front desk was very professional and requested we check back periodically. Since I had anticipated this problem, I had set up a tour of the town for 11:00. The bellman secured our luggage and even marked a bag "fragile", for us. We were assured the bags would be in a locked room. He then gave us a map and showed us where the shopping was and where to stay away from. I then mentioned to my girlfriend we needed to call the tour company and tell them we have arrived. The bellman over heard me and offered to call the tour company for us. Before I knew it he asked what company and was dialing the phone. Nice touch! This is what service is all about. The hotel is a short walk to all the high priced shops on Robson St. A perfect location. After our window shopping and the city tour by Landsea, which was great, we returned to find our free upgraded room ready. We were surprised to see how big the room was. It felt like a small apt complete with a kitchette. We never used the kinchette since we were only there a few nights but it was nice to have it available, if needed. There was also complimentary water in the refrigerator. We were on the 29th floor with an excellant view of Vancouver. Beautiful, especially at night. Breakfast in the resturaunt was pretty good. Since were are Starwood members we received 20% off the food in the resturaunt. This was a nice perk for being a member. The food was good as was the service. The day before check out, we received a call asking if we needed assistance in setting up transportation arrangements to the airport or where ever we were travelling. Another nice touch! Overall, the Westin exceeded my expectations. I would be glad to recommend this place to anyone and if I return to Vancouver, the Westin will be where I stay!

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: bo
Reviews.Content: Big, spacious rooms. A "Heavenly" bed. Good location. Very friendly and efficient staff. We couldn't fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Westin...outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Sammath
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for two nights in Spetember while attending a concert and were very impressed. We arrived early and were able to check in to the room straight away. We had been given a room that did not match our reservation - not a real surprise as we had booked through expedia and have had problems with their reservations before. On returning to the front desk the staff had made keys for our new room. This was all done with no fuss and could not have been handled better. We had a deluxe one bedroom suite and it was fantastic. Decorated in subtle tones and with blond wood furniture the rooms are classy in an understated way. The convenience kitchen consisting of a microwave, toaster, dishwasher and sink was a welcome addition also. The heavenly bed was unbelievable, pretty much the best bed I have ever slept in. The bathroom was well equipped with all the amenities you would expect from a hotel such as the Westin. The shower was also amazing, twin shower heads that pumped out as much water as a small waterfall, I didn't wan't to get out! All of the staff that we dealt with were courteous and very efficient. Two special mentions: to the manager on duty on our day of check out who called before we had departed to ensure we had a pleasant stay, and the night bell/guest services staff who gave us directions and recommendations for dining and bars - well done gentlemen. Would return to the Westin Grand without hesitation...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room!”
Reviews.Author: suehiker1
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand is in the heart of downtown, right on Robson Street. Good location, beautiful lobby and bar. We had booked a deluxe one-bedroom suite but when we got to the room, the room did not match the room description I had printed off the web. I went back to the front desk and showed the clerk our reservatin and the room description (floor to ceiling windows, balcony, etc.) and she put us in a beautiful room (actually an upgrade from a queen to a king) with no fuss whatsoever. The suite was beautiful! Big entry, living room, bathroom, and bedroom. Good views although there is a lot of construction going on around the Grand right now. We were very happy with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “This Westin truly is GRAND”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all: charm, warm and personable staff, it's all-suite with that great, comfortable Heavenly Bed and has everything you need in a 4-5 star hotel: pool, health club, room service, valet parking etc The location is great too, being close to shopping, entertainment and theatres. What really differentiates this hotel from others we have stayed in Vancouver, is the staff. They're attentive, always smiling and professional. The concierge, whose help we enlisted almost daily, was fantastic - the best we've seen. Attention to detail was meticulous and treating us as if we were the only guests in the hotel seemed standard to her. The restaurant seemed a bit small, but once we were seated, it turns out to actually have a great ambience. The kitchen offered numerous specials and the food was very good. Overall - very impressed and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to expectations”
Reviews.Author: LauraHarden
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the hotel we were very impressed with the beauty of the structure. Unfortunately this was our only "grand" impression of this hotel. We stayed for four days in a deluxe one bedroom suite. First I would like to mention that the staff at "Aria" were very kind and worked very hard. We had breakfast twice and dinner once during our stay. The food was very good. The menu is a bit limited. We waited almost an hour for breakfast on the day we checked out, they were quite busy. The room service menu is very limited as well. The conceirge (Lisa)that works full time there during the day was very rude to us. She did not smile and tried to brush us off as quickly as possible as though we were bothering her. We asked for information about dining and activities in the city. She told us one or two things in a very rushed tone and then rudely brushed us aside as though we were bothering her. We later found that the information she had given us was not totally accurate, which caused us some problems with transportation. During our entire stay we met two staff members who worked at "Aria" who were friendly. I can not say that any of the other staff in the hotel were friendly or welcoming at all. The bed and tub in the room were great (as usual) with Westin. The furnishings were attractive but very uncomfortable. The pool looked nice for swimming laps. On our last day at the hotel we had a few questions at the front desk. We were quickly "blown off" by the front desk clerk named "Tara". I have to say that the front desk and conceirge staff at the Westin Grand were some of the most rude and unwelcoming that I have ever dealt with. If I ever return to Vancouver I will not stay at The Westin Grand.

HotelInfo.Name: Westin Grand Vancouver
HotelInfo.Address: 433 Robson Street and Homer Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6B 6L9, Canada
